loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La Sra. Agustina G., es una madre soltera de 3 hijos, vive en el Barrio San Miguel de la ciudad Carapeguá, se inició en el negocio del vendedora ambulante hace 5 años, realiza sus ventas por la zona de Asunción y sus alrededores empezó con una pequeña cantidad de clientes, hoy día  gracias a su esfuerzo y a la aceptación de sus productos pudo lograr una cantidad mucho mayor.
    
En busca de poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya con el fin solicitar un crédito para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías.

Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de sábanas, remeras, pantalones,manteles, zapatos.
texts.en:
Agustina G. is a single mother of three children. She lives in the city of Carapeguá's San Miguel neighborhood. Five years ago she started out as a peddler. She sells throughout Asunción and its surrounding areas. When she started, she had few customers. Today, thanks to her efforts and the acceptance her products have, she has managed to increase her customer base quite a bit. In order to meet the demand she has, she called upon Fundación Paraguaya to request funds to buy larger quantities of merchandise. She will use the funds to buy sheets, t-shirts, pants, tablecloths, shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, t-shirts, pants, tablecloths, shoes.

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Abdu, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of his group in Kihihi. He is 34 years old and married with three children, all in primary school. He also takes care of two dependents.

Abdu has operated a retail shop in Kyabiyorwa Upper Cell for four years. It started as a small shop but now is expanding. He is able to make 400,000/= as monthly profits and this helps him in taking care of his family and mostly his children’s school fees. He has good customer care skills and this has tremendously improved his business and increased his profit margin.

Abdu sells general merchandise and he needs a loan to be able to buy more goods to increase the stock he has for sale.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben  es un joven de 19 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Nueva Esperanza, una zona agrícola del distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a trabajar como chofer de mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el nos comenta que la unidad vehicular con la que cuenta es de su padre y que este se la ha brindado para que pueda ganar un poco de dinero y solventar sus gastos personales. Rubén cubre rutas dentro de su caserío y con los caseríos circundantes.

La naturaleza accidentada de los caminos de la zona y el continuo uso brindado a la unidad móvil, ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello Rubén se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de la mototaxi.

Rubén es un joven responsable y muy trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es poder reunir en dinero suficiente y poder empezar a estudiar alguna carrera técnica que le brinde la posibilidad de asegurarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rubén, 19, lives with his parents and siblings in the Nueva Esperanza settlement, which is a farming area of Olmos district, Lambayeque province, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years he has been a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) driver. He tells us that his vehicle belongs to his father but his father has offered it to him so that he can earn income to meet his personal expenses. Rubén covers routes both within and outside Nueva Esperanza. Because the roads in the area are in poor condition and his vehicle is in constant use, it needs service and repairs if it is to continue to run properly. For this reason, Rubén is asking for an 800 new sol loan, for the first time, to invest in service and repair of his mototaxi. Rubén is a responsible, very hard-working young man. His greatest wish is to save enough money to study a technical career that will provide him with the possibility of a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Bwoma Farmers' Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
B. Sam, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is 38 years old and married with six children aged 11, 9, 7, 4, 3 and 1 year.

Sam has operated a business selling produce from Butemba trading centre for ten years. He says that his business started small but well and, now that his customer base has increased, he lacks enough capital for business expansion. He is able to make 25,000/= as weekly profits and he hopes for this to increase once the business expands.

Sam’s customers are mostly attracted by the good quality of his produce, his good customer care and the reduced and affordable prices. His goal is to see his business expand and to see his family develop. He needs a loan that will enable him to increase his capital base for business expansion.

Sam is a loyal person and very truthful to his customers.

loans.use: To increase his capital base for business expansion

loans.name: Burema Women's Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
M. Medius is 32 years old and married with five children aged 12, 9, 7, 5 and 1 year. She also takes care of three orphans.

Medius has operated a retail shop in Burema for two years from which she is able to make 30,000/= as weekly profits although she has some defaulters who affect her cash flow. She has good customer care and she would like to expand her business into a wholesale business and have all her children attain the best education.

Medius sells general merchandise like sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread and so on and she hopes to expand her business by having more purchases for an improved stock. Medius appears in the group photo and is also shown at the top left. She is a very hardworking lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to expand her shop

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 3,4,5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group “Mata D. Palma en Desarrollo 3,4,5” (Palm Tree in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small butcher shop by purchasing the necessary meat.

Carmen will use the profits from this business to invest in her children by purchasing the necessary food and school supplies. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.es:
La señora Claudelina P. tiene 36 años de edad, es de Carapeguá compañía Calixtro;  desde muy joven comenzó con los trabajos del campo, su cónyuge es empleado en una  fabrica donde se trabaja con cueros.
Viendo la necesidad de contar con más ingreso la señora decidió dedicarse a la venta de pollos, es una actividad en la que muy pocas personas se dedican, lo que hace que cuente con una gran cantidad de clientes en la zona.
La señora Claudelina P. solicita el crédito para compra de pollos ponedoras y parrilleros .
texts.en:
Claudelina P., 36, is from Carapeguá, Calixtro. She has worked in the fields since she was a young girl. Her husband works in a tannery. In order to generate more family income, she decided to raise chickens, an activity that few people are into in her area; this guarantees a large number of customers for her. Claudelina is asking for funds to buy laying hens and grills.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Victoria desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene la edad de 34 años, junto a su esposo han logrado construir su casa pero que aun le falta embaldosar el porche, poner verja, pintar entre otras mejoras, en sus prestamos anteriores logro avanzar en esta mejoras para su casa para el bienestar de sus tres hijos, jóvenes que están cursando la secundaria. La señora Victoria también es docente el cual tiene un ingreso fijo a parte de sus ventas el cual inicio con sus ingresos a vender productos de la vogue en donde ha  logrado captar clientes,  trabaja al contado y al crédito. Con este financiamiento desea invertir en cosméticos, perfumenes, ropa variada para dama, niños y caballeros para obtener mejores ventas como mejores utilidades y poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos ya que su trabajo de odontología a veces no esta tan bueno oh te tiene que viajar a los departamento para poder lograr hacer su trabajo. Contenta con los préstamos que la institución ha otorgado ya que se ha beneficiado en mejorar su casa, como aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Victoria, 34, has sold clothing and cosmetics for several years. Together with her husband, she has managed to build her house although the porch still needs to be tiled, iron gates need to be installed and it needs to be painted, among other improvements. She has used her previous loans to move these home improvement projects ahead for the wellbeing of her three children, youngsters who are in secondary school. Victoria is also a teacher, which provides a steady income in addition to her earnings from sales. She started off selling Vogue products and has a regular customer base she can count on; she sells both for cash and on credit. She will use these funds to buy cosmetics, perfumes, assorted clothing for women, children and men so that her sales and profits will improve and she will be able to help her husband, who is a dentist whose work often does not produce enough, even when he travels to other departments to work, to better meet family expenses. She is happy with the loans that the institution has granted her because they have made it possible for her to make improvements to her home and to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children and cosmetics.

loans.name: Camino Seguro Group

texts.es:
CARMEN, TIENE 47 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA, TIENE 3 HIJOS YA MAYORES D. EDAD. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "CAMINO SEGURO" JUNTO CON NUEVE PERSONAS MAS, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. SU GRUPO. ELLAS RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.APRECIAMOS A LA SRA. CARMEN SENTADA AL LADO DERECHO D. LA FOTOGRAFIA.

HACE TRES AÑOS, CARMEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CEVICHE EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILIO Y A LA VEZ REPARTE MENÚ A PEDIDO. 

ANTE LA NECESIDAD D. APOYAR A SUS HIJOS QUE ESTABAN ESTUDIANDO, INICIÓ A TRABAJAR REPARTIENDO MENÚ A LOS TRABAJADORES D. LA EMPRESA DOND. LABORABA SU HIJA Y POCO A POCO FUÉ AUMENTANDO SU CLIENTELA. Y LOS FINES D. SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CEVICHE.

CON EL INGRESO D. AMBOS NEGOCIOS PUED. CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y HA IDO AUMENTANDO SU CAPITAL, POR LO QUE EN ÉSTA OPORTUNIDAD EL CRÉDITO QUE HA SOLICITADO MÁS LO QUE HA PODIDO AHORRAR LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA APERTURA D. UNA BODEGA QUE INSTALARÁ EN SU CASA.
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, is single and has three adult children. She is a member of the “Camino Seguro” (Secure Path) group along with 9 other people who chose her has group president. They all resiD. in Comas district. Carmen can be seen seated on the right siD. of the photo. Three years ago, Carmen began to sell ceviche (marinated fish dish) from her home; she also prepares meals on order that she home delivers. In order to support her children, who were in school at the time, she started delivering meals to the employees of the firm where her daughter worked. Gradually, her customer base grew and she sells ceviche on weekends. With income from both businesses she is able to meet household expenses and she has been increasing her capital. On this occasion, she will use the funds from the loan plus some savings she has to set up a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in setting up a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 6, 7 Group

texts.en:
Amada is the coordinator of her group “Mata de Palma en Desarollo 6,7” (Palm Tree in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband.

Amada is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling gasoline (a necessary business in her rural community which is miles from the closest gas station) by purchasing more gasoline to sell.

Amada will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing the wooden walls with concrete block. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesús tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y golosinas por lo que tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, cuando inicio a vender fue porque no tenía el capital suficiente por lo que estaba atravesando una difícil situación económica por que tenia 2 hijos que mantener pues es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de tener este medio de vida, pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano ya que tiene que recurrir al mercado a realizar las compras de las golosinas además tiene que hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña con proporcionarle una educación digna a cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Maria De Jesús, 38, has sold clothing and snacks for over 3 years now. She started because she didn't have enough capital and she was going through a difficult economic situation: she had two children to support. She is a responsible woman, who enjoys her work very much, because she rises very early every day to go to the market to buy her snacks; she also has to do all the household chores. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise. She dreams with providing each of her children with a proper education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mugoma Feed The Family Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
R. John is 33 years old and married with six children aged 10, 8, 6, 4, 4 & 2 years. He also takes care of four dependents.

John has operated a retail shop in Mugoma trading centre for seven years. It started as a small shop with poor transport means to the main city where he buys his stock. He is able to make 30,000/= as weekly profits and this helps him in taking care of his family, mostly his children’s school fees.

John has good customer care skills and this has tremendously improved his business expansion and increased his profit margin for self-sustainability. John sells general merchandise and he needs a loan to be able to buy more goods to increase  his stock.

John appears in the small photo and also in the group photo. He is such a hardworking and devoted man.

loans.use: To buy more goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 4 Group

texts.en:
Luz (or Light) is the coordinator of her group, Primera Esperanza (First Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Luz is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling beauty supplies and clothing by purchasing makeup, creams, deodorants, pants and blue jeans to sell.

Luz will use the profits to purchase a computer to learn on and to save towards owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Will buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Chochope antiguo del distrito de Motupe, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en la agricultura, comenzó trabajando como peón en diversos campos de cultivo de la zona y luego pudo adquirir con mucho esfuerzo un terreno de dos hectáreas que viene utilizando para sembrar diversos productos con los cuales se pueda generar un ingreso adicional y solventar los gastos familiares.

Actualmente tiene sembrado maíz en este terreno, Eusebio se esfuerza diariamente para obtener una mejor producción de su cultivo, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Altyernativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindarle mantenimiento.

Eusebio es un padre de familia bastante responsable y muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Eusebio is thirty-two years old and lives with his wife and sons in the old Chochope area of the Motupe district, in the province of Lambayeque, located one and one-half hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He began as an agricultural laborer at various farms in the area and later was able to acquire with much effort a two hectares plot. He sows various crops on this plot, which can generate additional income and pay household expenses. He has currently sowed corn in his plot. He works hard every day to increase his yield; thus he requests for the first time a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa, with which he will buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crop. Eusebio is a responsible father who is very devoted to his family and his work. His greatest desire is to see his boys become professionals and prosperous men.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feritlizers and pesticides for the cultivation of corn

loans.name: Kinyerere Abeteraine Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
B. Alozio is 59 years old and married with fourteen children. He also takes care of ten dependents. He is the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo.

Alozio has been a farmer in Kinyerere village for thirty-five years. He grows farm produce and sells to his customers, mostly traders in different towns. Although the transport system is poor, he is able to make 60,000/= as profits every week. He has been in business for a long time and he hopes to expand his business further so that he is able to earn more income from it.

Alozio needs a loan to be able to buy more fertilizer for his farm. He is such a hardworking man. He appears in the small photo and also in the photo of his lending group.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farm improvement

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 52 años y es madre de 4 hijos todos ya independientes.

Isidora tiene por actividad la venta de relojes que se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado 
Nº 02 de Tarapoto, cuenta con clientela fija, amigos, moradores y otros. Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró relojes de todas las marcas y modelos diferentes, piezas y otros.

Con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará, relojes  de todas las marcas y modelos, para damas, caballeros y niños, así como correas, pilas  para relojes y lentes de sol, etc.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” ("Our Lady of Peace") communal bank, in the Tarapoto District, Province of San Martín, Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old and has a live-in partner, and she is the mother of 4 children who are already independent. Isidora's business is selling watches in Tarapoto's Market 2. She has a steady customer base among friends, local residents and others. With her first loan for 300 Peruvian new soles, she bought watches of all brands and various models, along with parts and other items. With this loan for 2,000 new soles, she will buy watches of all brands and models, for men, women and children, as well as straps, watch batteries, sunglasses, etc. She says: "I am grateful for the opportunity offered to me by the Manuela Ramos Movement organization, providing loans that help me develop as a woman and a small business owner."

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various models of watches to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gasoline in jerry cans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sweets by the dozen to stock her store

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 42 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 pues los créditos han sido de buen provecho para su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, es una actividad muy humilde pero muy importante pues le ha dado lo necesario para mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuando sus clientes llegan sonrientes a comprar sus productos pues esto le produce una gran satisfacción. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo así podrá comprar maíz, cal, leña. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su local.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 42 years old. She has worked with the León 2000 Foundation for a long time, since the loans have been an excellent resource for her business. Her work is selling tortillas. It is a very humble but very important job, because it has provided her with the means to support her 2 children, for whom she is responsible. What she likes most about her work is when her customers arriving smiling to buy her products, since that gives her great satisfaction. The financing she is currently requesting will be used to provide working capital, so that she can buy corn, lime and firewood. Her desire is to improve the condition of her sales stand.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a tres de sus seis hijos en el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito cuya población se encuentra situada en su mayoría en áreas rurales , pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender carne de pollos de ganja y aves de corral desde hace más de ocho años. Sebastiana nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en esta actividad debido a que su espso trabaja como obrero aventual y los ingresos que percibe no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

Sebastiana compra pollos de granja vivos en el mercado Moshoqueque y los lleva hasta su casa donde los cría y, de acuerdo a la demanda, los va sacrificando y vendiendo por kilos. Eventualmente también ofrece en venta la carne de aves de corral que ella misma cría. El negocio es de mucha utilidad no sólo para ella, sino que también lo es para sus vecinos, ya que la zona queda muy alejada del distrito de Morrope y no tienen acceso a productos frescos.

Sebastiana desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas pollos para venderlos no sólo en su caserío, también en los caseríos cercanos, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momendo de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 50-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and three of her six children in the Lagunas community in the district of Mórrope, a district whose population mainly lives in rural areas. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than eight years, Sebastiana has worked selling domestic birds and the meat of farm-raised chickens. She tells us that she had to begin working in this field since her husband works as a seasonal laborer, and the income he receives was not sufficient to cover the family's expenses. Sebastiana buys live farm-raised chickens at the Moshoqueque market and takes them home where she raises them. She butchers them when there is customer demand and sells them by the kilo. At times, she also offers meat from pen-raised birds which she raises herself. The business provides great benefits not only for Sebastiana herself, but also for her neighbors, since their area is very isolated within the Morrope district, and they do not have access to fresh products. Sebastiana wants to expand her business, buying more chickens to sell not only in her community, but in nearby areas. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 Peruvian new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she is planning to use in support of her goal. She is an extremely hard-working woman who is very dedicated to her family. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying farm-raised chickens in order to sell the meat

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La Sra. Ludith, tiene 41 años, vive en el Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martin, la socia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, es casada y tiene 03 hijos todos independientes. La Socia presenta estudios D. Primaria Completa.

Ludith, se dedica a la venta D. salchipapas y salchipollos, se encuentra ubicado su negocio en la esquina D. su casa un lugar amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que diariamente acuden a comprar. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas,  es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida. Con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles, compró ingredientes para el preparado D. sus alimentos cómo, sacos D. papa, hot dog (salchicha), sal en paquetes , plátano en racimos y parte del dinero lo invirtió en comprar platos descartables , cucharas , etc. 

Con este crédito  D. S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos cómo, sacos D. papa, plátanos en racimos, pollos en jabas y condimentos para aderezar sus alimentos y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ludith se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante, su sueño es tener un Restaurant muy bien acondicionado y vender comidas regionales y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ludith is 41, and she lives in the Tarapoto district, San Martin province, San Martin department. She belongs to the Nuestra Señora D. la Paz Communal Bank. She is married and has three children who are all independent. She has an elementary school education. Ludith sells "salchipapas" (food maD. from fried potatoes and fried sausages) and "salchipollos" (food maD. from fried potatoes and fried chicken). Her business is located on the corner of her house in a spacious area that is equipped to wait on her customers who buy from her daily. She tells us that she has very good daily sales. She is well-known, and her business is well received. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought ingredients for food preparation like sacks of potatoes, hot dogs (sausages), packages of salt, and bunches of bananas. She used part of the money to buy disposable plates and spoons, etc. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy supplies for daily food preparation. She will buy things like sacks of potatoes, bunches of bananas, crates of chicken, and condiments to season her food. She will also buy some utensils to give her customers better service. Ludith feels full of life with the desire to keep going forward. Her dream is to have a well equipped restaurant and to sell regional food. At the same time she is also grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Tening

texts.fr: Madame Tening N. sollicite un prêt de 200 000 FCFA pour sa restauration. En effet, elle est restauratrice et commerçante de divers produits depuis 1999 sur  sa propre initiative. Cette femme très dynamique est membre de U-IMCEC depuis 2009 et sollicite ce prêt pour réfectionner son restaurant et redémarrer la restauration car elle a été délocalisée du marché par la mairie de la ville. Mère de 3 enfants d’une moyenne d’âge de 9 ans, Madame N. est très connue dans sa restauration qui lui a permis de compléter, il y’a 2 ans de cela, son épargne pour acquérir une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tening N. is seeking a loan of 200,000 FCFA for her food-serving business. She has been a restaurant owner and businesswoman since 1999 at her own initiative. This very energetic woman has been a member of U-IMCEC since 2009 and seeks this loan to repair her restaurant and relaunch her food-serving business, because she was relocated from the market by the city mayor. A mother of 3 children, whose average age is 9, Mrs. N. is well-known in her food-serving business, which has allowed her to save in order to buy a house.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair her restaurant

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario 5 Group

texts.en:
Alberto is the coordinator of his group, Desrrollo Comunitario 5 (Community Development), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Alberto’s group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner.

Alberto is excited to be taking his eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling coconuts by purchasing more coconuts to sell.

Alberto will use the profits to invest in his home by replacing the wooden walls with block and in his long term ambition of having a truck to haul his coconuts with. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Motema Plus Group

texts.en:
Adeline M. is the manager of the group “Motema Plus,” which is made up of 25 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) and Kiva partner HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Adeline’s main business is selling second-hand clothes and eggs in her area. She has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1997. She likes her business and she is working hard to achieve her goal of one day opening a general store. She is a loyal client of  HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. 

She intends to use the next loan to buy used clothes and some cartons of eggs to resell with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. 

Adeline is 37 years old and single. She has good relationships with her customers.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing and eggs to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fuerza Y Union Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
LIZET, ES UNA JOVEN D. 22 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA HIJA D. UN AÑO NUEVE MESES, QUIEN ES L. RAZON D. TODO ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO EN SU VIDA. HACE TRES AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO "FUERZA Y UNION HACIA EL FUTURO", JUNTO CON 10 PERSONAS MAS QUE L. ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. SU GRUPO. ELLAS RESIDEN POR L. ZONA DEL PARRAL, EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS
NOS CUENTA QUE CUANDO INICIÓ EN EL GRUPO ELL. VENDÍA COMIDA A SUS VECINOS, CON LOS PRESTAMOS OBTENIDOS FUÉ AMPLIANDO SU NEGOCIO Y EMPEZÓ A OFRECER MENÚ, LUEGO D. CASARSE SU ESPOSO L. AYUDÓ PARA IMPLMENTAR UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA Y AHORA  VEND. SOLO POR LAS NOCHES ANTICUCHOS, PANCHOS, POLLO A L. PARRILL., ETC.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO EQUIPAR SU CASA, COMPRÓ SUS ARTEFACTOS DOMÉSTICOS, HIZO CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y SOBRE TODO PUDO APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CUANDO SE QUEDÓ SIN TRABAJO.
SU PRÓXIMA META ES JUNTAR PARA COMPRAR UNA PARRILL. MAS GRAND., COLOCAR TOLDO AL ESPACIO DOND. TRABAJA Y HACER EL PISO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN L. COMPRA D. INSUMOS PARA L. PREPARACIÓN D. SANGUCHES Y APROVECHAR L. VENTA EN LOS COLEGIOS POR EL INICIO D. CLASES.
texts.en:
Lizet is a 22 year old young woman. She has a small daughter who is one year and nine months old. Her daughter is the reason for all of the efforts and sacrifices in her life. Three years ago she joined the Fuerza y Union Hacia el Futuro group. She joined ten other people, and they elected her as president of the group. They resiD. in the Parral area in the Comas district. She tells us that when she started in the group she sold food to her neighbors. With the loans that she got she expanded her business and started to offer fixed menu meals. She later married her husband, and he helped her set up a space in her house. Now she sells only at night. She sells kebobs, hot dogs, and grilled chicken, etc. With her work she has been able to furnish her house. She bought some household items, and she maD. her business grow. Above all, she was able to support her husband when he was left without work. Her next goal is to get together enough to buy a larger grill, arrange everything in her workspace, and put down the floor. The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies for making her sandwiches to take advantage of the school sales for the start of classes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her sandwich sales

loans.name: Kikoni Ii Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Justus M. is 30 years old and married with three children, all in the primary level of school. He has had a retail shop in Kikoni II for six years. He is such a hardworking and trustworthy man and because of this, he is able to make about 60,000 Ugandan shillings as weekly profits. 

Justus has a hope of expanding his shop into a wholesale business as well as having educated children for self sustainability. He needs a loan to be able to expand his shop by buying more goods so that he could be able to make more profits. 

Justus is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda.

loans.use: Buying more goods for his shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old businessman who sells clothing and local brew in Karuguuza, Uganda. He is married with eight children and lives in a semi-permanent house of four rooms. His long term plan is to have a general merchandise wholesale shop.

Joseph has been in the clothing and local brew business for ten years and hopes to begin packaging the local brew and purifying it. The purpose of this loan is to buy more of the local brew to sell.

loans.use: To buy more local brew to sell

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye G. est né en 1977. Il s’est investi dans le commerce depuis qu’il a terminé l’école coranique. C’est après le décès de son père, il y’a 10 ans, que son oncle lui laisse la boutique que gérer son père de son vivant.
Cet homme marié depuis 2 ans est à son deuxième prêt toujours pour la bonne marche de sa boutique à laquelle il voit son frère l’épauler au niveau de sa gestion. Il demande un montant de 300 000 FCFA pour renforcer la boutique en riz, huile, sucre et thé qui constituent les aspects les plus importants dans la vente.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye G. was born in 1977. He put a lot of himself into business since he finished his Koranic schooling. It was after the death of his father 10 years ago that his uncle left him the shop that his father managed when he was alive. This man, who has been married for 2 years, is on his second loan to run his shop, with which his brother is helping. He is asking for 300,000 FCFA to build up his shop with rice, oil, sugar and tea, which are the most important items he sells.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock up on items for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy crates of chicken to stock her business

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo tiene 63 años vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Nilda (51) y de sus dos jóvenes hijos, ya mayores de edad.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en motocarro por las calles de su localidad. Su vehículo es propio y le permite solventar los gastos de su familia, además le gusta mucho interactuar con sus ocasionales pasajeros y se distrae  movilizándolos de un lugar a otro. Para él, esta es una actividad tranquila, fácil y no es estresante, tiene horarios fijos y trabaja  sobretodo durante el día, para mayor seguridad. Como es un hombre emprendedor, para el futuro planea comprar otro motocarro para brindarlo en alquiler y obtener mayores ganancias y así salir adelante.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Bernardo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el mantenimiento de su motocarro, pues necesita algunas reparaciones y es necesario que lo haga, ya que quiere brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 63 years old and lives in his own home alongside his wife, Nilda, who is 51 and his two young children who are now grown up. For five years he has provided transportation service to his local area. He owns his car and this allows him to take care of his family's expenses. He also likes interacting with his passengers and taking them from place to place. For Bernardo, this job is calm, easy, and not stressful. It has a fixed schedule and he mostly works during the day for security reasons. As he is an enterprising man, he plans to buy another car to rent out so he can earn more income and get ahead. This is his third loan with MFP and his is grateful for all of the people who make it possible for him to receive the loans that allow him to keep working. Bernarado plans to invest the money he is asking for in car maintenance since it needs some repairs and he has to get them done so he can provide good service

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicia, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo de 14 años.

Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la minuciosa tarea de confeccionar aretes, collares y pulseras en pedrería de colores. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque ya tiene clientes fijos (tiendas) que le compran toda su producción y obtiene buenas ganancias económicas debido a que compra los materiales que emplea al por mayor. Además, dice que es un trabajo bastante tranquilo y lo puede realizar en su casa, sin descuidar la crianza de su hijo, pues con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado sacarlo adelante sola. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa, donde pueda vender toda su mercadería con mayor tranquilidad, tanto al por mayor como por unidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que han hecho posible el crédito que le permitirá seguir progresando.

Felicia tiene planeado invertir  el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales al por mayor para seguir elaborando estos lindos accesorios en pedrería.
texts.en:
Felicia is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her 14 year old son. For the past eight years, she has been dedicated to the meticulous task of manufacturing earrings, necklaces, and bracelets out of precious stones of different colors. She enjoys her work because she already has regular customers (stores) that buy all of her products. Felicia is able to generate good earnings because she buys her materials in bulk. In addition, she says this work is very peaceful and allows her to stay at home so that she can look after her son. As a result of her earnings, she has been able to make it on her own. Being an enterprising woman, Felicia has plans in the future to open a small bazaar in her home where she can peacefully sell all types of merchandise in bulk or by the unit.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Felicia is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to receive this loan so that she can continue working. She plans to use the money she requested to buy materials in bulk so that she can continue producing these beautiful jeweled accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to produce handmade jewelry

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad en el Caserío La Zaranda, una zona netamente agrícola perteneciente al distrito de Pitipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 18 años de edad, empezó trabajando como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo cercanos y hace algunos años, con el dinero de sus ahorros, pudo adquirir una hectárea de terreno que viene utilizando para sembrar diversos productos que le aseguren un ingreso adicional con el cual mantener a los suyos.

Actualmente desea instalar en su terreno el cultivo de maíz, el terreno ya está limpio y próximo a prepararse. Elias desea sembrar un maíz de buena calidad para obtener una buena producción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de semilla certificada.

Elias es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Elias is a 34 year old father who lives with his wife and two children (ages 12 and 10) in the village of La Zaranda, a distinctly agricultural area that is part of the District of Pitipo in Ferreñafe Province. This area is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Elias has been farming since he was 18 years old. He began working as field laborer for the local farms. Several years ago, with the money that he saved, Elias bought a hectare of land that he now uses to grow a variety of crops to ensure additional income needed to support his family. He wants to grow corn on his land, so he has started clearing the area which is almost ready. Elias wants the corn that he plants to be of good quality so that he can obtain a good harvest. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of certified seeds.

Elias is a responsible father who is extremely dedicated to his family and his work. He has already worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible client when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase certified seeds for planting corn

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nimia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella. 
Su esfuerzo emprendedor de sacar adelante a sus hijos, por idea propia le motivo a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en general, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa en un local amplio y acondicionado. 
Nos cuenta que tiene clientela fija que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar porque ella tiene todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza, las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Nimia, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun para continuar trabajando y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is a dependent.

She strives as an entrepreneur so that her children can get ahead. This motivated her to start her business of selling groceries out of her home, which is a spacious and suitable location. Nimia says that she has established customers who come to her house every day to shop because she has all the products that a housewife needs. Nimia personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality. The revenue she generates helps her with the family finances.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, cases of canned fish of different brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. Nimia feels strongly about continuing her work and thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Esteban (38) y de sus tres pequeños hijos que aún estudian en el colegio.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de queques que prepara esporádicamente para vender a sus vecinos y conocidos. Este negocio le genera buenas ganancias y según dice preparar no le cuesta mucho trabajo. Paralelamente, todos los días, vende salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas) en un puesto afuera de su casa, esta actividad  también le gusta mucho y obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que sus salchipapas son muy buscadas por los cómodos precios y su delicioso sabor. Lo que no le agrada mucho es trabajar hasta muy tarde en la noche, ya que muchas veces su producción de salchipapas no le sale tan rápido y debe quedarse hasta vender todo. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para los próximos meses, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de queques en sociedad con una de sus compañeras de grupo de crédito.

Este es el 14avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder a un crédito que le permita seguir progresando. A su vez,  comenta que el trabajo en su grupo va muy bien, ya que las integrantes son muy responsables.

Marina tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de un puesto en el mercado de la zona donde vive para vender todo tipo de comidas con mayor  tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Marina is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Esteban (age 38) and their three young children who are in school.

For two years she has been selling cakes that she prepares occasionally for neighbors and acquaintances. This business generates good earnings and does not have many operation costs. At the same time, she sells “salchipapas” (potatoes and fried sausages) every day from a stand outside of her house. She greatly enjoys this activity and earns a good income because salchipapas are requested often for their affordable price and delicious flavor. What she doesn’t like is working late at night because there are many times when all the salchipapas she prepares do not sell fast, so she must work very late until everything is sold. Being an enterprising woman, she plans to expand in the coming months her cake business by partnering with one of the members of her Communal Bank.

This is her fourteenth loan with MFP. Marina is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan so that she can continue progressing. In turn, she says the work in her group is going very well and that the members are very responsible. Marina plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of a vending stall at the local market where she can sell all types of food more peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Secure a vending stall at the market

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 42 años, ella tiene más de 5 años de tener este negocio que es la compra y venta de ropa. Cuando empezó a vender fue porque su familia estaba pasando por una crisis económica muy difícil poco a poco logro invertir en lo suficiente para comprar ciertos productos pues tenía ciertos clientes ellos mismos lograron darle fama que se merece fue así que decidió seguir adelante pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano. Con este negocio pues es el único medio de vida que tenia. El financiamiento que actualmente está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes formales. Su deseo es proporcionarle  sus hijos una educación digna.
texts.en:
Ángela is 42 years old and has been managing her business of buying and selling clothes for five years. She started selling because her family was going through a very difficult financial crisis. Over time, she was able to invest enough money to buy certain products for specific customers who gave her the recognition she deserved. This motivated her to continue and wake up early every day. Her business is the only livelihood that she has.

The loan Ángela is currently seeking will be used to buy merchandise such as trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and formal attire. Her wish is to provide her children with a decent education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Luis (44), y de sus dos hijas menores de edad.

Hace dos años compró una pequeña “combi” (camioneta para 12 personas) para que su esposo pudiera trabajar haciendo transporte local de pasajeros. Mientras ella administra los gastos de reparaciones, él trabaja en horas puntas, es decir donde hay mayor demanda. Le gusta el negocio porque obtiene buenas ganancias económicas y su esposo puede trabajar con tranquilidad, además ya han comprado la segunda camioneta y la han brindado en alquiler, de esta manera están saliendo adelante a base de trabajo y mucho esfuerzo. 
Para más adelante tiene planeado comprar una tercera combi para seguir trabajando e instalar una pequeña flota de transporte.

Este es el 14avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Tania tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el mantenimiento de sus dos camionetas, ya que necesitan algunas reparaciones para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Tania is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Luis (age 44) and their two dependent children.

Two years ago, she bought a small “combi” (a van that holds 12 people) for her husband so that he could have work providing local transportation to passengers. While Tania manages the repair expenses, her husband works during peak hours when demand is at its highest. She likes this business because it generates good revenues and her husband is able to work in peace. They have already secured a second van that they will rent out in order to move forward in their work and help them increase their efforts. Later on, they hope to purchase a third van so that they can continue working and build up a small fleet of transport vehicles.

This is her fourteenth loan with MFP. Tania is extremely grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan so that she could continue working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the maintenance of her two vans. These repairs are needed so that she can offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of her two vans

loans.name: Sulmira

texts.es:
La Sra. Sulmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

 Su fuerza y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y familia, por idea propia decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará ,conservas de pescado en cajas de diferentes marcas , arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar detergentes , jabón de tocador y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un Minimarket y su lema es todo lo que se propone  lo cumple, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que siempre esperaba.
texts.en:
Sra. Sulmira is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still dependents.

Due to her strength and desire to move her children and family forward, Sulmira came up with the idea to start her own business selling groceries. Over time her business increased as she gained more experience in this type of activity. She is becoming well known and admired among her customers.

With this loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy cases of canned fish of different brands, sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, detergents, bathroom soaps, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. Her dream is to open a mini-market and her slogan would be “we have everything you need”. She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity she always wanted.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Abraham Plus Group

texts.en:
“Abraham Plus” is a group of 27 owners of small businesses chaired by Alain. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Alain sells packaging in the north and most populated area of Kinshasa. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2008. He already received five loans from the microfinance institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. 

He intends to use this loan to expand his inventory. He will buy some packaging to resell at a profit. Currently he earns a profit of $70 per week.  

Alain is 34 years old and single.

loans.use: Purchasing some packaging to resell in order to increase his working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 67 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Zoila por iniciativa propia se dedica a la venta de  verduras ubicada en un puesto del  Mercado Nº 01, siempre con las fuerzas y anhelo que lo acompañan .Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles  compró, zanahorias, tomates en kilos, sacos de yuca y otras verduras más para así surtir su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, Zoila comprará verduras cómo zanahorias, yucas, tomates, culantros, repollos al por mayor para venderlos al menudeo.

Zoila, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer , cuenta que ahora se siente feliz de haber logrado que con su trabajo sus hijos sean profesionales y ahora ellos lo ayudan .
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 67 years old, single, and the mother of three children who are all independent.

Of her own initiative, Zoila decided to sell vegetables. Her vending post is located at Market No. 1 and she is always accompanied by her strength and desire. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought carrots, tomatoes by the kilo, sacks of cassava, and other vegetables to stock her business.

With this loan of 2000 PEN, Zoila will purchase vegetables such as carrots, cassava, tomatoes, cilantro, and cabbages in bulk so that she can sell them at retail price. She says she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman. Now she is happy that she is able to achieve something with her work, her children have become professionals, and they help with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to restock her business

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es:
El señor Emigdio P.  tiene 60 años de edad está casado con la Sra. Eusebia  hace  20 años tiene juntos  6 hijos  todos  mayores de edad.
El Sr. P. trabajó 10 años como ayudante de albañil fue donde aprendió el oficio, en la actualidad es oficial de construcción, también hace 5 años que se dedica a vender los productos artesanales que su esposa fabrica en la zona  de San Lorenzo , de esta manera les resulta mucho más rentable como así también le permite aumentar  más su  ingreso. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo pudo mejorar su calidad de vida.
                    
Debido a la gran cantidad de pedidos que tiene, solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas y sábanas).
texts.en:
Sr. Emigdio P. is 60 years old and has been married to Sra. Eusebia for 20 years. Together they have six children who are all grown.

Sr. P. worked ten years as a masonry assistant, which is how he learned his trade. He is currently a construction manager. Five years ago, he began selling handicrafts that his wife produces in the District of San Lorenzo. In addition to being profitable, this work also helps to boost his income. Thanks to his effort and dedication, he is able to improve his quality of life.

Due to the large number of orders that he has, Emigdio is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, and bed sheets).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hammocks, blankets, and bed sheets

loans.name: Gloria Quety

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de 19 años de edad en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace veinte años tiene instalado en el mercado de la ciudad de Ferreñafe un puesto de venta de comida, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de platos durante el almuerzo. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido al buen trato que brinda y a la buena sazón con la que prepara la comida que ofrece.

Gloria nos comenta que la idea del negocio nació debido a la necesidad de contar con un ingreso familiar más estable que les permitiera salir adelante a ella y a su familia. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y esta actividad solo les brinda ingresos por temporadas.

Gloria desea ampliar su negocio preparando más variedades de platos, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer amable y que gusta mucho de lo que hace, se esfuerza diariamente en su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia. Su hijo se encuentra estudiando la carrera superior de Computación y eso la llena de orgullo. Gloria ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos. Su mas grande anhelo es poder tener un restaurante turistico.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 19 year old son in the city of Ferreñafe, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For twenty years, she has managed a vending post at the market in the city of Ferreñafe where she sells food. She offers her customers all types of dishes for lunch. Her business has been well received because she provides good service and for the great flavor of the prepared foods that she offers. Gloria says the idea for her business resulted from a need to obtain a more stable income for her family so that they could all get ahead. Her husband works as a farmer, but his work only provides seasonal income.

Gloria wants to increase her business by preparing a wider variety of dishes. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to be used for purchasing supplies needed to achieve her objective. She is a friendly woman who enjoys what she does. Gloria strives daily in her business so that her family can move forward. She is proud that her son is studying for his college degree in computer science. Gloria previously worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that she is a punctual and responsible client with her payments. Her greatest wish is to open a restaurant for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed to prepare more dishes

loans.name: Carlos Efrain

texts.es:
Carlos P. de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es profesora ellos tienen 2 hijos uno de 13 y 14 años son estudiantes de una escuela fiscal. 

Debido a la falta de ingresos en su familia y no tener una profesión para defenderse decidió hace ya unos años atrás vender frutas en una carreta en todos los sectores de Guayaquil. 

Carlos obtuvo ingresos suficientes en la venta de frutas y decidió ubicar su puesto en un local estable, surtió aun más su negocio con arroz, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 18h00 todos los días. La delincuencia que hay en el sector es uno de los impedimentos que el tiene para quedarse más horas atendiendo. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar naranjas, mandarinas, sandias para ampliar con más frutas su negocio. En el futuro quiere ser proveedor de frutas a tiendas y supermercados.
texts.en:
Carlos P. is 42 years old and lives in an urban zone in the Guayaquil suburb. He has a cement home that has all the basic services. His wife is a teacher and they have 2 children who are 13 and 14 years old and attend public school. Because his family needed additional income and he did not have a profession he decided a few years ago to sell fruit from a cart in all the neighborhoods of Guayaquil. Carlos obtained a sufficient amount of profits from his sale of fruits and decided to open his business in a stall. He stocked his business with more products such as rice, drinks, etc. He works from 6am to 6pm. He does not keep longer hours because of the crime in the neighborhood. With the loan he is requesting, Carlos wants to buy oranges, tangerines and watermelons to expand his business with more fruit. In the future he wants to supply fruits to stores and super markets.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, tangerines and watermelons.

loans.name: B & B Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'B & B Group'. They are small-scale businesswomen from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to help them expand their businesses. 

Isatu K. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old was born in Makeni; she is married to a mechanic and they have 5 children. Two of her children are attending secondary school and three are in primary school. Isatu sells firewood and 'gara lappers' (locally dyed cloth). She has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. With this loan, she will buy piles of firewood and 'gara lapper'-making materials.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood and 'gara lapper'-making materials

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs calls their group 'Jesus is Lord Group'. Hawa K. is the group’s leader. She is 30 years old and was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have three children – two in secondary school and one in primary school. 

Hawa sells fried cakes and ginger beer (a local drink). She has been a businesswoman for 15 years. With this loan, she will buy groundnuts, rice, and palm oil to start a new business.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice, and palm oil to start a new business

loans.name: Matal United Group

texts.en: Amie L. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the township of Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. Amie L. sells locally produced items like palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassava roots, and ground-nuts/peanuts. She also sells clothes. She has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. 36-year-old Amie was born in Matal village; she is married to a worker at the Ministry of Agriculture and they have 7 children. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy local produce like palm oil and clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Tabethsu Finoh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Tabethsu Finoh Group'. They are small-scale businesspeople in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person to invest in their businesses. 

Fatu K. is the leader of this group. Fatu was born in a village call Mashocorg. She is 32 years of age, married with 3 children. Fatu owns a telephone booth where she makes calls for a fee of SLL 1,000 per minute and also sells top-up cards for all 4 mobile phone networks. She also sells mobile phone accessories like spare batteries. She will use this loan to buy top-up cards and spare batteries to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy top-up cards and spare phone batteries

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Koloneh K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the township of Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. They have named their group 'Believe in God'. 

Koloneh sells market food like rice and beans.  She has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. The 51-year-old Koloneh was born in Rowalla village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have five children. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying bags of rice and beans to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and beans to add to her current stock

loans.name: Future Planners Group

texts.en: Issa B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs from the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have named their group 'Future Planners'. The leader of the group, Issa B., is an Okada driver (motor-bikes used as taxis). He has been in the Okada business for three years now.  The 34-year-old Issa was born in Matotoka village, about 8 miles from Magburaka. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. With this loan, the members of the 'Future Planners' group will buy a new motor-bike.

loans.use: Buy a new motor-bike

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Trust Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of entrepreneurs has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member in the group in order to improve their businesses in size and quality. In this way, they can better support their school-going children in terms of feeding, providing clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Thirty-seven-year-old Ramatu K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni, is married to a gold miner, and they have four children. One of her children is in secondary school and the others are in primary school. For 7 years now, Ramatu K. has been selling baby clothing such as napkins (diapers), and other baby materials like pins, Vaseline, powder, etc. With her share of the loan, she will buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy baby clothes and cosmetics for babies to add to her business

loans.name: Wan Word Mabureh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Wan Word Mabureh' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. Kadiatu B., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 24-year-old is married to a police officer and they have two children. 

For two years now, Kadiatu has been selling rice, fish, vegetable oil and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, fish, oil and palm oil to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando es casado con la señora María del Pilar y con ellos vive un hijo de nombre Erik Martínez quien los apoya económicamente ya que labora para una empresa ecológica como recolector desde hace un año, y Don Fernando trabaja para una empresa de recursos y servicios empresariales como oficial, contando con una antigüedad de 13 años. Su esposa se encarga del cuidado del hogar. Ellos como una familia muy unida y establecida están tramitando este crédito para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa, ya que con la temporada de lluvias su techo se daño interior y exteriormente. (No se encontraba el solicitante por lo tanto se le tomo la fotografia del conyuge).
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is married to Mrs. María del Pilar and they have a son named Erik Martínez who lives with them. He supports them financially now that he has worked for an environmental services business as a collector for a year. Fernando has worked for a business service and resource company for 13 years. His wife takes care of the house. They are a very close and stable family. They are requesting this loan in order to waterproof the house’s roof. Now that it’s rainy season, the roof is in danger internally and externally. (The applicant was unavailable for the picture, so the picture is of his wife.)

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: waterproofing the home's roof

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La Sra. Shirley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Decididas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto,  Región San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que aun estudia y esta en la universidad.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, por idea de una amiga tiene por actividad el trabajo de Tapicería ubicada en su casa con la ayuda de su maquina de coser, trabaja juntamente con su esposo.

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio, con pedidos anticipadamente de sus clientes que a diario acuden a su casa y con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, ampliara su negocio comprando, tela en rollos, hilos para coser los tapizados ya sea de muebles, motokar y vehículos motorizados, esta orgullosa por su trabajo.

Se siente una mujer realizada  por lo que agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido para desarrollarse como mujer y empresaria
texts.en:
Ms. Shirley belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Decididas II” in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Region and the San Martín Department. She is married and she is 57 years old. She is the mother of 2 children, 1 child is still studying and is attending university.

With the first loan of de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, based on a friend’s idea, she now works on upholstery in her home with the help of her sewing machine. She works with her husband.

Currently they work in the same business and the clients’ requests come to the home daily. With this loan of S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will expand her business by buying rolls of fabric, thread for sewing the upholstery for the furniture, a moto-taxi and motorized vehicles. She is proud of her work.

She feels like an accomplished woman therefore she is grateful for the opportunity offered by the Manuela Ramos Movement, so she can develop as a woman and businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, different colors of thread to make the upholstery

loans.name: Servando

texts.es: El señor Servando es casado con la señora Sara y son una familia muy estable y joven, ellos son propietarios de un negocio que establecieron hace 5 años de nombre “Los 4 Vientos” donde venden tacos, hamburguesas, lonches etc. Negocio que es preferido por sus clientes. Ellos anteriormente tuvieron un crédito con nosotros para la inversión en su negocio y sus pagos siempre se registraron puntualmente ahora nuevamente están tramitando para la inversión en compra de mas mercancía y mesas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Servando is married to Sara; they are a young, stable family. They have owned a fast-food sales business, called "Los 4 Vientos," where they sell tacos, hamburgers, lunches, etc. for the last 5 years. Their business is highly preferred by their customers. They had a previous loan with us that they used to invest in their business; they always repaid on time. Now, they are agin negotiating funds to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and tables for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and tables.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo M. tiene 41 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Acahay  está casado hace más de 12 años con la señora. Felicia de 38 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos juntos, uno en edad escolar y el otro esta cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de análisis de sistema en una de la universidades de la zona.          
El señor  Hugo es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos hace  15 años recorriendo por toda las ciudades en busca de clientes, gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta actividad pudo construir su casa propia en el centro mismo de la ciudad en un terreno que heredó de su padre, frente a un colegio. Viendo la necesidad de ampliar su negocio y contar con artículos de librería y  una fotocopiadora, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya a solicitar el préstamo para realizar la compra de los mismos.
texts.en:
Hugo M., 41, is from the city of Acahay; he's been married for the last 12 years to Felicia, 38. They have two children, one who is school-aged and one who is in fourth year of college, majoring in Systems Analysis. Hugo is a merchant; he sells home appliances. He has been in this line of work for 15 years traveling to several cities seeking customers. Thanks to his efforts and to this commercial activities, he managed to build his own home across from a school downtown on a lot that he inherited from his father. He called upon Fundación Paraguaya to request funds because he wants to add the sale of stationery supplies and a photocopy machine to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, sheets of paper and assorted school supplies.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín es casado con la señora Ana María y son padres de familia de 2 niños aun pequeños, pero a pesar de ser una familia muy joven son muy responsables, anteriormente se les otorgo un crédito para la colocación de las protecciones de su vivienda, ahora nuevamente esta tramitando pero para la colocación de un techo y algunas otras mejoras que desea realizarle a su hogar.
texts.en:
Agustín is married to Ana María; they have two small children. Despite being a very young family, they are very responsible. Previously, he was granted a loan to install protective devices to his home; now, he is negotiating funds to install a roof and to do some other home improvements he wants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his house and install tile flooring.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto Martínez es casado con la señora Laura Esther y son una familia ya establecida y con sus hijos ya casados, ellos iniciaron un  negocio desde hace un año, que es un restaurante de nombre “El lugar del dialogo” donde venden tacos, hamburguesas, burritos, papas con queso, etc. Y además obtienen ingresos extras ya que el señor Ernesto es albañil, desde hace 15 años, y realiza varios trabajos en el transcurso de la semana ya que tiene varios clientes. Están tramitando este crédito para la ampliación del local de su negocio ya que desean agregar mas mesas, además de baños para damas y caballeros. (El solicitante no se encontraba ya que andaba trabajando por lo tanto se le tomo la fotografia a su esposa).
texts.en:
Ernesto Martínez is married to Laura Esther; they are an established family with two children, who are already married. They opened a restaurant, called "El Lugar del Dialogo" (The Dialogue Place) a year ago where they sell tacos, hamburgers, burritos, potatoes with cheese, etc. They also earn additional income because Ernesto has been a bricklayer for 15 years and he does various construction jobs for customers during the week. They are negotiating funding to enlarge their restaurant; they want to add space for more tables as well as install restrooms for men and women.
