El grupo tiene experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan ya que por este motivo son conocidos por sus clientes, en cuanto a L.  competencia es granD.  pero L. gente del grupo pone todo D. su parte para salir adelante. El crédito será utilizado para incrementar su capital D. operación y algunos utilizaran el mismo para construcción D. sus viviendas o puestos D. venta, como por ejemplo Mariano Casimiro utilizará el financiamiento para poder continuar con parte D. L. construcción D. su vivienda que tiene pendiente. El historial D. este grupo indica que ya tiene experiencia y que van por su sexto ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Los Ceibos” ("The Ceibo Trees") is represented by Mariano Casimiro and maD. up of 13 members, of whom 8 are women and 5 men. This bank is characterized by solidarity and unity. The president is Mariano Casimiro, who is separated from his wife and has 4 children who are already independent. He works in the field of transportation and lives in a rented dwelling in the northern zone. His greatest desire is to finish building his home. The rest of the group members pursue a range of activities; most sell retail merchandise as traveling vendors, offering detergents, groceries, plastic products, costume jewelry, phone cards, food, or underwear; others are tailors. The group's members have experience in the businesses they pursue, and because of this, they are well-known among their customers. With regard to competition, there is a lot of it, but the people of this group make every effort to be successful. The loan will be used to increase their working capital, and some will use it for the construction of their homes or sales stands. For example, Mariano will use the loan to do some construction work on his home. The group's history indicates that they have already gained experience and that they are entering their sixth loan cycle demonstrating punctuality, responsibility and the desire to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos tiene 40 años, el se dedica a una pulpería. Por lo que tiene la necesidad de ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos le soliciten. Pues el siempre tiene el espíritu de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia, pues siempre está al pendiente de sus hijos. Carlos tiene muchos clientes que recurren a su pulpería porque ofrece los productos más necesarios, para el hogar. Por lo que el financiamiento será utilizado para la compra de materia prima que es necesario para la buena inversión de su negocio. el sueña con mejorar cada día su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, 40, has a grocery store. He needs to be able to have everything his customers ask for in stock. He is always seeking ways to get ahead and offer better conditions for his family because he is always watchful of the wellbeing of his children. Carlos has many customers who come to his store because he has al the basic household items in stock. The funds will be used to buy stock inventory merchandise that is required for the good investment in his store; he dreams with improving his home daily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Manuel Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Emilio G. O., tiene la edad de 26 años vive en el Barrio de Santa Lucia es casado y su esposa vende frutas y verduras, ellos tienen dos hijos de las edades de 5 años y 8 meses de edad, el desde hace 7 años es despachador y dentro de los propositos de vida de la familia esta la mejoría continua de las condiciones de vida.

Uno de los principales inconvenientes a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido el nacimiento de su hijo, el sufre de una seria enfermedad y por él se han hecho gastos económicos que les ha obstaculizado la inversion hacia nuevas fuentes de ingresos, es por el bebe que él solicita un prestamo par la compra de materiales de construcción y poco a poco ir reconstruyendo su vivienda para brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel Emilio G. O., 26, lives in the Santa Lucia neighborhood; he's married and his wife is a fruit vendor. They have two children, who are 5 years and 8 months of age, respectively. For the last 7 years he has worked as a dispatcher. Among his life goals is to continue to make improvements to his home. One of the main challenges he faces stemms from the birth of his son; he has a serious illness, which has caused the family to incurr significant medical expenses and has prevented investment into new sources of income. It is because of the baby that he is asking for funding to buy building materials and supplies so that he can gradually rebuild his home thereby offering better living conditions to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maricela Charo

texts.es: Maricela tiene  35 años, vive  con sus 2 hijas en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 1 año vende cervezas, con la ayuda de su  ex pareja que le brinda  mercadería de esta bebida  para que continúe con el  negocio. Ella comercializa en  los diferentes  eventos sociales que se festejan por la zona donde vive, y también durante  los fines de semana pues  dice que durante esos momentos se obtiene mayores  ganancias que le permiten  brindar a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Paralelamente a este negocio se dedica, de vez en cuando, al lavado de autos  que también le genera un dinero adicional. Su deseo en el futuro es convertirse en  una gran distribuidora de cervezas al por mayor.Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible el préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Maricela tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cervezas, pues ya tiene las  cajas, solo le falta los envases para trabajar con su propio capital en la venta de cervezas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Maricela is 35 years old and lives with her 2 daughters in her own house. For the past year, she has worked selling beer, with the help of her former partner, who provides supplies of this beverage so she can continue with her business. She sells her product at various social events celebrated in the area where she lives, and also during weekends, since she says that at these times she obtains greater profits, allowing her to provide a good quality of life for her family. Parallel to this business, she also sometimes works washing cars, which also generates additional money for her. Her desire for the future is to become a large wholesale beer distributor. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who make this loan possible, which will permit her to continue working. Maricela plans to invest the funds she is requesting in buying beer, since she already has the cases; she only needs the bottles in order to work with her own capital to sell beer on a wholesale basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a larger quantity of beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Lorenza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza L. se dedica a la venta de refresco, gaseosas en el mercado la terminal. Elabora su refresco en su casa de 8 a 9 Am. Luego se traslada al mercado a su puesto de venta para ofertar su producto concluye su Trabajo a las 6:00pm.

 Este crédito que solicito es  para  comprar por mayor cantidad los  productos que vende  tales como: gaseosas, jugos, agua botella, y cacao, payana, azúcar, canela, frutas para elaboración de refrescos. Y  así tener mayor ganancia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora L. esta agradecida por que sus créditos con ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lorenza L. sells refreshments and sodas at the terminal market. She prepares the refreshments at home from 8-9am and later goes to her vending post at the market to sell her products until she is done working at 6pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk that she will sell such as sodas, juices, and bottled water. She will also purchase cacao, soybeans, sugar, cinnamon, and fruit for preparing refreshments so that she can generate more revenue. It should be mentioned that Sra. L. is grateful for the loans from CEPRODEL which have helped her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, bottled water, and ingredients for making refreshments

loans.name: Miriam Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Miriam Auxiliadora G. L., tiene la edad de 42 años, vive en el Barrio la Borgoña es madre soltera de 2 hijos de las edades de 24 y 18 años de edad, el mayor es casado y el de 18 años estudia en la universidad, ella es cocinera de un restaurante desde hace 13 años.

Dentro de sus limitaciones económicas, ha trabajado para poder mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar, el cual es una vivienda muy humilde, es por esta razon que ella solicita de un prestamo, para la compra de materiales de costrucción y terminar con las remodelaciones que ya se encuentran avanzadas, ella ha tenido mucho apoyo de sus suegros y sus hijos son muchachos de muy buena conducta, que aportan económicamente a su madre, espera se le brinde un apoyo económico que le favorezca a sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam Auxiliadora G. L., 42, lives in the Borgoña neighborhood. She is a single mother of two sons. The oldest, 24, is married and the youngest, 18, is a university student. She has been a cook in a restaurant for 13 years. Even within her financial limitations, she has managed to improve her home's infrastructure though it remains quite humble, nonetheless. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies to finish the home improvements that are already underway. She has had much support from her in-laws and her sons have good moral principles; they contribute financially to help their mother. She hopes that the loan will be granted in order to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel C. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos pequeños bajo su responsabilidad y a quines les quiere dar lo mejor.
A su vivienda le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para empezar la construcción de la recamara que será para sus hijos. 
Doña Isabel trabaja de limpieza en una casa particular, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel C. is a single mother with two small children in her care, and she wants to provide them with the best she can. Her house needs one more room, but she does not have the necessary funds to begin constructing this space, which will be for her children. Isabel works as a cleaner in a private home, and she plans to repay the loan with this income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding on to the front of her home

loans.name: J. Jesus

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor J. Jesus C. le está haciendo falta el portón al frente de su vivienda. Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar el portón, es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo.
Don J. Jesus es divorciado y tiene bajo su responsabilidad un hijo a quien le quiere dar la seguridad en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que percibe de su empleo como vendedor de muebles en una mueblería.
texts.en:
J. Jesus C.' house lacks a front gate. At present, however, he lacks funds to pay for the manufacture of the gate. For this reason, he is asking for funding. J. Jesus is divorced and he has a son under his care; he wants to provide better security for his home. He plans to repay the loan with his salary as a furniture salesman in a furniture store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a front gate.

loans.name: Elsa Gioconda

texts.es: Elsa tiene varios financiamientos que le ha sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en la casa de habitación de su mama y de anteriormente trabajaba como profesora y por problemas de salud tomo la decisión de  establecer este negocio para brindar siempre ayuda a su hogar.  Su compañero de vida trabaja como técnico en refrigeración de manera ambulante por lo que juntos buscan la forma de generar más ingresos a sus familias. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña con alcanzar muchos objetivos este año como es obtener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elsa has had various loans, which have been a great help for her business. Her business is a general store located in her mother's home. Previously, she worked as a teacher, but for health reasons, she decided to start this business to provide a constant source of support for her household. Her life partner works as a mobile refrigeration technician, so that together they are trying to find ways to generate more income for their families. For this reason, she is requesting the current financing for working capital, which will be dedicated to buying supplies. Elsa dreams of achieving many goals this year, such as obtaining her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia L., se dedica a la Venta de Ropa, todos los días se ubica en puesto fijo en el mercado la terminal – León, oferta su producto desde las 6:00am hasta las 12:00Pm, pòr la tarde se está dedicando a vender frutas implemento el nuevo negocio de las ganancias que le está produciendo la venta de ropa con el objetivo de obtener mayor ganancia. 
Este crédito que solicito es  para aumentar su  inventario de ropa y poder ofertar a su clientela variedad de productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de  sus clientes.
Cabe mencionar que se siente muy agradecida con los créditos de Ceprodel ya que ha logrado incrementar su negocio además de tener una nueva opción de obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia L. sells clothing every day from an established post at the terminal market in León. She offers her products from 6am until 12pm. In the evenings, she sells fruit. Ofelia started this new business using her earnings from selling clothes so that she could obtain a better income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her inventory of clothing so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. With this goal, she hopes to satisfy the needs of her customers. It is worth mentioning that Rita is very grateful for the loans from CEPRODEL. She has already succeeded in increasing her business as well as created a new option for generating more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Juan Leobardo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Leobardo C. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales han sido para su vivienda. 
Nuevamente está solicitando un crédito para poder terminar la recamara que esta construyendo para sus tres pequeños hijos.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo de chofer de camión de carga. 
En la foto aparece la familia del señor Juan Leobardo ya que se encontraba en su trabajo y quienes nos atendieron fue su esposa y sus tres pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Leobardo C. has already had 3 loans with FVP, which have been used for his house. Now he requests a new loan so that he can finish the bedroom that he is building for his 3 small children. He plans to pay off the loan with income he earns as a truck driver. In the photo you see the family of Juan Leobardo, since he had to work so his wife and three small children came in his place.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to finish construction on a room in the front of the house

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia A.,   se dedica a la venta de  pollo frito empacado vende en el mercado la terminal.
 
 Este crédito lo solicita para  compra de una cocina industrial, y productos por mayor tales como: arroz, aceite, papel fil mito, pollo, plátano así obtener mayor ganancia para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora A.   esta agradecida con ceprodel por que los crédito que le ha brindado le han ayudado a crecer su negocio con nuevos productos como venta de chinela, bolsas plásticas, caramelos y cigarro.
texts.en:
Sra. María Eugenia A. sells packaged fried chicken at the terminal market. This loan she requested will be used to buy an industrial stove and products in bulk such as rice, sugar, cellophane, chicken, and bananas so that she can generate more revenue to have a higher standard of living.

It is worth mentioning that Sra. A. is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loans that have been provided because they have helped her grow her business with new products to sell such as slippers, plastic bags, candy, and cigarettes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove and supplies for her food business

loans.name: Fransisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Fransisco Javier C. R., tiene la edad de 393 años vive en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla es casado y su esposa es comerciante, y le apoya a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 15 y 11 años de edad los dos estan estudiando y él labora como guarda de seguridad desde hace aproximadamente 15 meses.

Dentro de los problemas a los que se ha enfrentado, esta la falta de financiamiento para poder remodelar su vivienda la cual ya se encuentra bien avanzada tal y como lo muestra la foto, esto ha sido producto de su empeño diario, ahora él solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, y la culminacion del proyecto de reconstruccion, que aporte una ayuda económica y mejores condiciones de vida para la familia.
texts.en:
Fransisco Javier C. R. is 39 years old and lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla housing development. He is married and his wife is a merchant who helps him with the household expenses. They have 2 children, ages 15 and 11, who are both in school. He has worked as a security guard for about 15 months. Among the problems that he has faced is a lack of credit to be able to complete the renovation of his home, which, as you can see in the photo, is in the final stages due to his daily efforts. Now he requests a loan to buy construction materials. The completion of this construction project will help his family economically and will provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz es propietaria de un negocio como es la venta de quesillos de manera ambulante, la señora sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto. Su esposo trabaja en una bicicleta de tres ruedas transportando gente de un lugar a otro. Pues esta Alba se gana la vida de la manera más humilde que puede. Ella tiene tres hijos los cuales asisten al colegio público ellos le ayudan en los que más pueden. Esta  solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Alba Luz has a small business preparing cheese snacks called quesillos which she sells around the area. Her husband earns money by taking people from place to place on his 3 wheel bicycle. Alba lives as humble a life as she can. They have 3 children who attend school and help their parents however they can. Alba is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity of products so she can increase her sales. Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her small food business and increase her sales

loans.name: Asuncion De La Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Asunción de la Concepción  S.,   se dedica a la venta de platanitos y yuca frita entrega en las los colegio y universidades por mayor.
 
 Este crédito lo solicita para  compra de  productos por mayor tales como: plátanos, yuca, leña, aceite vinagre y  así obtener mayor ganancia para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora S.  esta agradecida con los créditos que ceprodel le ha brindado por que  le han ayudado a crecer su negocio con entregas por mayor.
texts.en:
Asunción sells fried plantains and yucca, mainly in the schools and universities. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients, such as plantains, yucca, firewood, cooking oil, and vinegar, in order to be able to increase her income and have a better life. She is very grateful for the loans that Ceprodel has helped her obtain because they have helped her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Domingo José

texts.es:
El señor Domingo José R. D., es trabajador de la escuela Frank Cortez, se desempaña como profesor de educación física des desde hace 5 años, es soltero pero tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

El señor Domingo José R. D. tiene un vehículo Volkswagen que actualmente lo tiene en el taller pero no contaba con fondos para comprar repuestos de dicho vehículo, por esta razón el señor R. solicito financiamiento a ceprodel.
texts.en:
Domingo works in at the Frank Cortez School. He has been teaching physical education for the past five years. He is single but has five school-aged children. He has a Volkswagen, which is currently in the repair shop, but he did not have the money to buy the replacement parts he needed, so he has requested financing through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts to repair his car

loans.name: Herminia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Herminia O. venda ropa en general  en la plaza metropolitana dando inicio a sus ventas  a las 8:00 Am donde recibe a su clientela para ofertar su mercadería.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de ropa de verano y formal como: chores, camisetas, bóxer, pantalones, blusas, faldas, y otros.
texts.en:
Herminia sells general clothing items in the metropolitan plaza. Here she begins serving her customers at 8:00 am. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in summer clothing and formal items, such as briefs, t-shirts, boxers, pants, blouses, skirts, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Marcia Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Marcia se dedica a la venta de refresco, de forma ambulante desplazándose por todo el centro de la ciudad de León. Elabora su refresco en su casa de 6 a 8:00 Am. Luego se traslada a ofertar su producto hasta las 2:00 pm, el resto de la tarde se lo dedica a su familia y a efectuar las compras de los productos para la elaboración de refresco del día siguiente. 

 Este crédito que solicito es  para  comprar por mayor cantidad los  productos que vende  tales como: cacao, payana, azúcar, canela, frutas para elaboración de refrescos. Y  así tener mayor ganancia.

Cabe mencionar que la Señora López esta agradecida con los créditos que ha obtenido con ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar su nivel de vida..
texts.en:
Marcia sells refreshments by travelling around all of the city centre of León. She makes the drinks at home between 6 and 8 and later travels around to offer her product until 2pm. The rest of the afternoon she dedicates to her family and to buying the products to make the following day's drinks. The loan she is seeking is to purchase a larger quantity of the produces she sells, such as cocoa, pecans, sugar, cinnamon, and fruit to make the drinks, and in this way earn more. It rates a mention that Señora López is thankful for the loans that she has obtained as they have helped her to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa, pecans, sugar, cinnamon, fruits and confectionery.

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi KilL. que significa Luna Alegre en quechua, inicia su sexto ciclo con 19 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. frutas, lácteos, artesanía, abarrotes en general, cosméticos, panes, tubérculos, quesos, ropa, servicio D. transporte y tejido D. chompas.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Vilma que es presidenta D. su banco Comunal, Vilma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Vilma venD. ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos, familiares sus ventas son al crédito, además Vilma venD. comida en una feria, Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, ropa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 10,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, verduras, frutas, lanas, leche, artesanía, papa y panes.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un restaurante, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Kusi KilL., which means "happy moon" in the local quechua language, is beginning its sixth cycle with 19 members. The members all work at different businesses, such as sales of fruit, dairy products, handicrafts, grocery and every day household items, cosmetics, breads, cheeses, clothing, and transportation.

Such is the case of Vilma, the president of her communal bank. Vilma is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Vilma sells clothing to her friends and acquaintances on credit. She also sells food at the local market. Vilma needs her portion of the loan to purchase rice, sugar and clothing.

The members each need different amounts from the total loaned by the bank. They will use the money to purchase fruits and vegetables, rice, dairy products, handicrafts, potatoes and bread. The members share the dream of growing their respective businesses so that their children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to help each of the members grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa D. S., vive en la colonia Gerardo lindo, trabaja en la escuela Frank Cortez de Chinandega, es maestra de primaria, es casada tiene tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella.

Ella solicito crédito en Ceprodel por que necesita realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda  para brindar seguridad a su familia
texts.en:
Señora Josefa D. S. lives in the district of Gerardo Lindo. She works in the Frank Cortez de Chinandega school where she is a primary school teacher. Josefa is married and has 3 children, however none of them depend on her. She is seeking a loan with Ceprodel because she needs to do some home improvements to give her family security.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Karla Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Karla Verónica C. V. es trabajadora de la escuela Fran Cortez de Chinandega, se desempeña como maestra de pre-escolar en el turno de la tarde, además da clases por la mañana en el colegio Hogar Paulo VI como maestra de primaria.

La señora Karla C. es casada con un hijo de dos años de edad y vive en el barrio el Rosario, Ella solicito crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines, clavos, mano de obra
texts.en:
Karla Verónica C. V. works in the Fran Cortez de Chinandega school as a pre-school teacher in the afternoons. She also works in the mornings as a primary school teacher at the Hogar Paulo VI college. Karla is married with 1 son, 2 years of age, and lives in the suburb of Rosario. She is seeking a loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc, tiles, nails, and to pay for labour.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Isabel tiene 44 años, Tiene 3 hijos y estudian para ser muy buenos profesionales. La actividad económica de Reyna es brindar el servicio de Gimnasio, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio por sus hijos que le ayudaron y poyaron con esta idea, pues no tiene mucha competencia y ella se preocupa por proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por eso que solicito ayuda a Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar ciertas maquinas y reparar ciertos equipos. Sus deseos son de ampliar su establecimiento para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 44 years old. Her three children study at school so they will have good professions. For more than 3 years now, Reyna has run a small gym. She started this business with the help of her children. They don't have a lot of competition, and Reyna worries about managing all of the clients who come to her. She is requesting a loan to purchase new machines and repair equipment. She would like to grow her establishment and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her small gym and grow her income by purchasing new machines and making repairs

loans.name: Elvira Carmela

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, de quienes recibe apoyo en cuanto a la vivienda, en el distrito de Reque, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace mas de un año se dedica a la venta de comida en el frontis de la casa en donde vive: por las mañanas ofrece ceviche (plato típico del país) acompañado de papitas, humitas y tortitas, mientras que por las tardes, vende postres típicos del país (arroz con leche y mazamorra) en el parque que queda a una cuadra de su vivienda. Este negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos.

Este negocio también es de mucha ayuda para su economía y la de su familia, sus padres ya son de edad avanzada y dependen de los ingresos que ella perciba para vivir. Por este motivo Elvira desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas platos para ofrecer a sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Elvira es una mujer responsable y que dia a dia se esfuerza para salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus padres una mejor calidad vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elvira is 57 years old and lives in the home of her parents, from whom she receives support in terms of housing. She lives in the Reque district, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year she has sold food from the front of the house where she lives. In the mornings she offers ceviche (a typical dish of the country), along with chips, tamales and pancakes, while in the evenings she sells traditional Peruvian desserts (arroz con leche -rice custard, mazamorra - purple corn pudding) in the park that is a block from her house. This business enjoys a very good reception due to the flavorful food that she prepares. This business is also a big help to her and her family economically, as her parents are of an advanced age and they depend on the income that she earns to survive. For this reason Elvira wants to expand her business with the purchase of more supplies that will allow her to prepare more food to offer her customers. To do this she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,600 Peruvian soles that she will use to achieve this goal. Elvira is a responsible woman who, day by day, works hard to get ahead. Her main wish is to offer her parents a better quality of life. She has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to expand her food sales business

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
La señora P.,   se dedica a la venta de  Comida y refresco encontrándose su puesto fijo en el mercado la Estación donde inicia su trabajo diario para la elaboración de desayunos a las 5:00 Am. Para luego elaborar los Almuerzos todo este procedimiento es efectuado en su tramo ya que presta las condiciones para desarrollar su actividad.
 
 Este crédito lo solicita para  compra de  productos por mayor tales como: arroz,  Frijoles, Carne, azúcar aceite, pollo, plátano Condimentos y Verduras etc.  Ya que de esta manera podrá obtener mayor ganancia con el objetivo tener un mejor nivel de vida.
 
Cabe mencionar que la Señora P.  esta agradecida con ceprodel por que los crédito que le ha brindado le han ayudado a crecer su negocio dar mejores condiciones al mismo así como la de su casa.
texts.en:
Señora P. works selling food and refreshments. You will find her in her permanent stall in the market la Estación, where she starts work daily at 5am to make the breakfasts. Later she makes lunches. This process is carried out as she now has the conditions to develop her activity. The loan she is seeking is to purchase large quantities of products such as rice, beans, mean, sugar, oil, chicken, plantain, condiments and vegetables. In this way she can generate better earnings, with the objective of having a better standard of living. It rates a mention that Señora P. is thankful to Ceprodel for the loans that they have given her, as they have helped her grow her business and give better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as rice, oil, chicken, beans, meat, eggs, vegetables, fruit, and soft drinks

loans.name: 28 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 28 D. Noviembre, inicia su octavo ciclo con 17 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Acosvinchos.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, comida, tara, carnes, animales menores, cereales.

Como es el caso D. la señora Rosa que es casada, tiene 4 hijos y 47 años, Rosa tiene un restaurante en su casa ubicada en la plaza principal del Distrito, actividad que realiza todos los días, Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 12,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, tara, trigo, cebada, carne, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, hacer crecer su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank 28 of November began its 8th cycle with 17 members from the District of Acosvinchos. The members all work in different businesses such as sales of grocery items, meat, food, small animals and grains.

This is the case of Rosa, 47 years old and married with 4 children. Rosa has a restaurant in her house, located in the main plaza of the district. She runs her restaurant every day, and she needs her portion of the loan to purchase ingredients such as rice and sugar.

Each member needs a different amount from the total loan, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, etc. They will use their portion of the loan to invest in rice, sugar, flour, meat and small animals. The members share the dream of owning their own homes, growing their businesses and providing a good education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various ingredients and products to help grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Jesenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jesenia del Socorro U. Cuadra, es  una joven  de 33 años quien  Labora como conserje en la planta gerencial en las oficinas del  Mercado Mayoreo Managua, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado tres crédito con CEPRODEL durante tres  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y mano de obra para reforzar más las paredes de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Jesenia dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesenia del Socorro U. Cuadra is a young woman of 33 years od age. She works as a receptionist on the management floor in the offices of the Mayoreo Managua market. She has 2 children in her care, who are of school age, and she is married. Jesenia has worked with loans from Ceprodel for 3 years, and in this period she has invested the three loans in improving her house, thanks to the finances granted by Ceprodel. She is seeking this loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement and labour hire, to reinforce the walls of her home. All this is to give better security and a better standing of living to her chidren. Jesenia said that the loans have been to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Lilliam María

texts.es:
La señora Lilliam María L. A., se desempeña como docente en la escuela  Jesús de Nazareth en el turno de la tarde, es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con sus familiares.

La señora L.  A. utilizo el crédito para ayudar con gastos de la casa a sus padres, es primer crédito que obtiene con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Lilliam works in the evenings as a teacher in the Jesús de Nazareth School. She is single and has no children. She used the money from this loan to assist her parents with their household expenses. This is her first loan through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household expenses

loans.name: Luisa Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa del Pilar T. Pérez , es profesora de primaria en la escuela Fran Cortez, es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos en el barrio el calvario 
La señora Luisa del Pilar T.,  es primera vez que solicito crédito para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Luisa is an elementary school teacher in the Fran Cortez School. She is a single mother and lives with her two children in the Calvario neighborhood. This will be her first loan, which she needs in order to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building supplies

loans.name: Sheila Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Sheila María S. R., es  una persona de 34 años quien  Labora como Jefe de Despacho B en la Decana Tura de la facultad de Ciencias y Sistema en la universidad de ingenieria , ella tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura para el cambio de techo de su casa de habitación, por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Sheyla dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sheila is 34 years old and works as the chief of dispatch B in the science and engineering department of the University of Engineering. She is married and has one school-aged son. She has had one loan through CEPRODEL within the last year, which she used to make some improvements to her home. She was able to do this thanks to CEPRODEL. She is asking for this loan in order to buy building materials, such as zinc sheet metal, beams, and paint in order to fix the roof on her house because it is in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sodas in large quantities for his restaurant, as well as make improvements.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen G. V., es maestra de la escuela Fran Cortez, habita en el barrio Roberto González, vive junto con sus dos hijos y su esposo.

La señora María G. V., solicito el crédito para realizar reparaciones en su casa ya que se acerca el invierno y tiene bastante malo el zinc y hacer un medio baño ya que el que tenia era letrina y   era forrado con plástico, además ocupara para cubrir otros gastos personales.
texts.en:
Maria is a teacher at the Fran Cortez School. She lives in the Roberto González neighborhood with her husband and two children. Maria requested this loan in order to make repairs to her house, now that winter is approaching and the sheet metal is in bad shape. She also wants to add a half bath, because the one there now is just a latrine covered with plastic. It will also help with some of her personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Ligia Mercedes

texts.es:
La  Señora Ligia Mercedes Solís Larga espada, Labora como Inspectora en turno Sabatino y Dominical en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de  Managua, ella tiene un   hijo a su cargo,  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, arena, cemento, hierro y bloques  para la construcción de un anexo en su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Ligia dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ligia Mercedes Solís L. works as an inspector on the weekend shift at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute of Managua. She has a school-age son in her care and is a single mother. She has had three loans with CEPRODEL over three years and over this period of time she has used the three loans for the improvement of the house in which she lives, thanks to the financing given by CEPRODEL. The requested loan is to be used for the purchase of building materials such as sand, cement, iron and blocks to build an annex in her home. This is all for the aim of providing them greater security and a better quality of life for her children. Ligia said that the loans provided have been for the improvement of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: HOME IMPROVEMENT AND EXTENSION

loans.name: Noel Rene

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Rene R. Rodrigues, es  una persona de 56 años quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, el tiene dos   hijo a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado diez créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido diez créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, arena, cemento, piso y alambres Nuevos para el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Noel dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Noel Rene R. R. is 56 years old and works as a guard in the Ivan Montenegro de Managua Market. He is married and has two children, who are of school age. He has received ten loans through CEPRODEL in the last seven years, and during this time period he has invested in improving his home, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL. This loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement, flooring, and new wires for his house's electric system. All of this is for the purpose of providing greater safety and better living conditions to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Qatun Llaqta Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Qatun Llaqta que significa Pueblo GranD. en quechua, inicia su séptimo ciclo con 16 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Socos.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. lácteos, leña, cereales, artesanía, animales menores, abarrotes en general y frutas.

Como es el caso D. la señora Adela que es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Adela junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta D. leña, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Adela es presidenta por 4 oportunidades en su Banco Comunal. Adela necesita un préstamo D. 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. árboles.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 10,750 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. árboles, trigo, cebada, lana, arroz, azúcar, animales menores.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Qatun Llaqta” (which means “Large Village” in Quechua) starts its seventh loan cycle with 16 members who are from the District of Socos.

The members engage in different businesses selling milk, firewood, grain, handicrafts, small animals, groceries, and fruit. Such is the case of Sra. Adela. She is 48 years old, married, and has one child. Together with her husband she sells firewood in the city of Ayacucho. Adela has served as President of the Communal Bank on four separate opportunities. She needs a loan of 1750 PEN to invest in the purchase of trees.

The members need different loan amounts including 300 PEN, 450 PEN, and 600 PEN, for a grand total of 10,750 PEN in loans to the entire Communal Bank. These loans will be invested in the purchase of trees, wheat, barley, wool, sugar, and small animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trees

loans.name: María  Irene

texts.es:
La  señora María Irene Vanegas H., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña en el cargo de operaria de limpieza, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, ella solicito el crédito por que desea comprar un poco de ropa y zapatos y utensilios de estudio para sus hijos.

La señora María Irene Vanegas H. habita en el barrio san Agustín en casa de sus padres, mientras ella realiza su trabajo de limpieza por las calles de Chinandega sus familiares cuidan de sus hijos uno de 4 años y el otro de 12 años de edad, durante el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con ceprodel ha demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora y de buenas costumbres pues lleva ya 6 créditos con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Irene Vanegas H. is an employee of the municipality of Chinandega where she works as part of the cleaning crew. She is a single mother with two school-age children. She is asking for a loan to purchase clothes, shoes, and school supplies for her children. Mrs. María Irene Vanegas H. lives in the neighborhood of San Agustín, in her parents' house. While she cleans the streets of Chinandega, her relatives take care of her children, aged 4 and 12. During the time she has worked with Ceprodel, she has shown to be an enterprising woman and with good habits as she already has six credits with this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal purchase for her sons

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos Manuel Solórzano E., es  una persona de 53 años quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cinco hijos a su cargo,  y tres de ellos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: alambres de corriente eléctrica para el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Carlos dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel Solórzano E. is 53, and works as a guard in the Wholesale Market of Managua. He is married and has five children that he supports, three who are school aged. He has been working with a loan from CEPRODEL for a year. In this period thanks to the loan with CEPRODEL, he has been able to improve his home. The current loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials such as electrical wire for the electrical system in his house. All of this is to offer greater security and a better standard of living for his children. Carlos said that the loans he has received have been for the improvement of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his house

loans.name: Nohemí Justina

texts.es:
La señora Nohemí Justina H. M., es de profesión maestra de primaria ocupando el cargo de sub-directora de la escuela Fran Cortez, habita en el barrio Julio Cesar Tinoco, vive junto a su hijita de dos años y su esposo, 
La señora Nohemí H. M. es primer ves que  solicito  crédito para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación esto con el fin de brindar seguridad a su familia ya que se acerca el invierno y tiene el techo bastante dañado
texts.en:
Nohemí is a teacher and vice principal at the Fran Cortez School. She lives in the Julio Cesar Tinoco neighborhood, along with her husband and two year-old daughter. This will be her first loan and she will use the money to make some improvements to her home. The roof is badly damaged and repairing it will help to provide better security to her family as winter approaches.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials for roof repair

loans.name: Rosario Fabiola

texts.es: Rosario tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos,  en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (corazón de res condimentado cocinado  a la parrila). Cada día muy temprano prepara sus platillos y ya en la tarde los vende, su negocio se ubica  en la esquina de la casa de su madre porque es una zona muy transitada. Vende todos los días hasta altas horas de la noche  y esta muy satisfecha ya que obtiene ganancias regulares, además cuenta con  su principal  herramienta de trabajo que es una parrilla pequeña fácil de transportar. De esta manera  consigue tener los ingresos  que ayudan a sostener la economía de su hogar, y su deseo para el futuro es mejorar su negocio ofreciendo mayor  variedad de platillos.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir progresando.Rosario tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes que  necesita para la preparación de sus platillos como  carne, salchichas, palitos,  carbón y aceite.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children. They live in the house of her mother-in-law. For the past two years, she has been selling “anticuchos” (pieces of spicy beef that are cooked on a grill). Each day she wakes up early to prepare her dishes and them sells them in the afternoon. Her business is located at the corner of her mother-in-law’s house because it is a busy area. She sells every day until the late hours of the evening and is very pleased to obtain a regular income. Her main piece of equipment is her small grill because it is easy to transport. This helps her to have income to financially support her household. Her wish for the future is to improve her business by offering a greater variety of dishes.

This is her first loan with MFP. Rosario is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan so that she could continue progressing. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of ingredients and supplies in quantity that she needs for preparing her dishes such as meat, sausages, skewers, charcoal, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies to continue her food business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto C. López, es  una persona de 58 años quien  Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, el tiene cinco   hijos a su cargo,  y tres de ellos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es acompañado, ha trabajado once créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido once créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura para el cambio de techo de su casa de habitación, por lo que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Ernesto dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ernesto C. López is 58 years old. He works as a security guard in the Iván Montenegro de Managua market. Ernesto has 5 children in his care, 3 of them school-aged, and has a partner. Ernesto has worked with 11 loans from CEPRODEL in 8 years. In this period of time he has invested 11 loans in improving his home where he lives, thanks to the finance granted by CEPRODEL. The loan he is seeking is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, tiles, and paint, to change the roof of his house as it is in bad condition. The objective of improving his house is to give better security and standards of living to his children. Ernesto said that the loans granted to him have been to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Osmar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Osmar Antonio C. es trabajador de  la alcaldía de Chinandega, desempeña el cargo de vigilante, es acompañado con dos hijos en edades escolares, su compañera es ama de casa, pero también muy luchadora para salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios.
El señor C. habita en San José del Obraje, aparte de trabajar para la Alcaldía se dedica a la  Agricultura  
Lleva 6 créditos con ceprodel, y ha demostrado ser muy responsable
texts.en:
Osmar works as a security guard for the city of Chinandega. He has two school-aged children. His wife works as a housekeeper, but she also works hard to get ahead with God’s help. Osmar lives in San José del Obraje. Besides working for the city, he is also a farmer. He has had six loans through Ceprodel and he has demonstrated great responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Francklin Felix

texts.es:
Franklin Félix P., es  un joven  de 35 años quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado tres crédito con CEPRODEL durante tres  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y piso  de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Franklin dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Franklin Félix P. is a young man of 35 years old age. He works as a hygienist in the Oriental market in Managua. Franklin has 3 children in his care, all school-aged. He was worked with 3 loans from CEPRODEL during 3 years, and has invested all 3 in home improvements, thanks to this finance granted by CEPRODEL. The loan he is seeking is to invest in the purchase of contruction materials such as sand, cement and flooring for his house. Improving his house is to give his family better security and give his children a better standard of living. Franklin said that the granted loans have all been for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
El señor Marvin José G. M. es soltero tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el barrio santa Ana es trabajador de la alcaldía desde hace cinco años como vigilante de el cementerio municipal. 
El señor Marvin G. tiene cuatro años que trabaja con créditos lo que ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable con sus obligaciones. Todos los créditos que ha obtenido los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda brindando mayor seguridad a su familia,
texts.en:
Marvin José G. M. is a single dad of three and lives with his family in the Santa Ana neighborhood, he works for the municipality and has been a graveyard guard for five years. Marvin Gutierrez has been working with loans for four years and has demonstrated to be an honest and responsible person with his commitments. All of the loans obtained have been used to make improvements to his house; providing more security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for children's tuition

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
La  Señora Luisa Amanda C. Velásquez, Labora como conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua, ella tiene tres  hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como, zinc y perlines para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que las que este se encontraba en mal estado..
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Luisa dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda C. V. is a caretaker at the Manuel Olivares Rodriguez Institute in Managua. She is a single mother with three school-age children. Luisa has been working with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks to CEPRODEL funding, she has been able to invest in some home improvements. This new loan will help Luisa afford building materials like zinc and shingles, which she can use to repair her roof. The point of all this is to provide her children with more security and a higher standard of living. Luisa says the loan will help her improve the quality of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs and renovation.

loans.name: Roberto Danilo

texts.es:
Roberto Danilo Solórzano C., es  un joven  quien  Labora como Supervisor en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado un crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, piedra y hierro para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación.Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roberto Danilo S. Cuadro is 30 years old. He works as a supervisor at a wholesale market in Managua. He is married and has two school-age children. Roberto has been working with CEPRODEL for one year. Thanks to his first CEPRODEL loan, he was able to do some home renovations. Roberto will use his new loan to buy construction materials: sand, cement, stone and iron. He plans to build a new bathroom in his home. He wants to improve living conditions for his children. Roberto has said that this loan will be used only for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovations.

loans.name: Griselda Amparo

texts.es:
Griselda tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su pequeña hija en casa de sus tios, en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por la elaboración de trabajos de artesanía que se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Griselda trabaja brindando servicios de fotocopiado desde hace mas de dos años. Posee dos máquinas fotocopiadoras con las que presta servicio en dos colegios del distrito donde reside, uno de ellos es el colegio San Carlos, el más grande del distrito (brinda educación primaria y secundaria), allí atiende a todo el alumnado y a los profesores. 

El otro colegio es el 11029 de nivel primario, en esta institución el negocio es atendido por un familiar, a quien Griselda paga un diario por el apoyo que le da. Estos negocios son de utilidad tanto para ella como para la población estudiantil, ya que su servicio es indispensable y ella lo ofrece a precios cómodos.

Griselda desea bridarle mantenimiento a sus máquinas y tambien comprar máquinas anilladoras para implementar el servicio que brinda. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utiulizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo, Griselda no se amilana ante su condición de madre soltera, al contrario, encuentra en su hija la motivación diaria para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Griselda is a 25 year old single mother with a young daughter. She lives in the house of her aunt and uncle in Monsefú District. This area is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo and is known for producing handicrafts.

Griselda has been providing photocopy services for more than two years. She has two photocopy machines with which she provides service to two schools in the district where she lives. One of them is Colegio San Carlos, which is the largest in the district (since it provides both primary and secondary education). Griselda serves all of the students and teachers from that school. The other school is “The 11029”, which is an elementary school. This institution is managed by one of her relatives, who pays Griselda each day for her support services. Her business is useful both to her and to the student population because this service is indispensable and is offered at comfortable prices.

Griselda wants to provide maintenance to her photocopiers and also buy a ring binding machine so that she can start providing this service. For this reason, she decided to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount 2000 PEN so that she can achieve her objective. She is a hardworking woman who knows how to succeed with great effort. Griselda does not shy away from her status as a single mother. On the contrary, she sees her daughter as motivation to excel every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her two photocopiers & purchase a ring binding machine

loans.name: Luz Elvira

texts.es: La Sra. Q. T. Luz Elvira de 48 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Cuenta con un hijo a cargo, ya que sus demas hijos son independientes.Tiene casa propia ubicada en el Sector de Cantoral del Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño a logrado adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Elvira Q. T. is 48 years old and a single mother with one dependent child. Her other children are independent. She has her own home in the Cantoral area in the District of Santiago. Luz works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial business. She is an enterprising person who, thanks to her efforts, was able to acquire her own property.

Luz needs a loan to finish the construction of her house. Her dream is to have her entire house finished so that she can finally achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we have provided through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the construction of her home

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
La Sra. Lleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, del Distrito de Morales, Región y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Lleny se dedica a la Venta de cosméticos sus clientes hacen su pedido de acuerdo al catalogo , vende de varias líneas cómo, unique, Natura y esika.
  
Con este préstamo de S/2,300.00 Nuevos Soles  comprará,  productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas caballeros y niños, desodorantes, esmaltes, lociones y así  tener en stock sus productos para venderlos a  precio de catalogo  generándole una mayor ganancia.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Lleny, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Lleny is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Moralinas” in the District of Morales, Region and Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two dependent children.

Lleny sells cosmetics based on customer orders made through a catalog. She sells from multiple lines, such as Natura and Esika. With this loan of 2300 PEN, she will buy beauty products to offer such as perfumes for women, men, and children; deodorants; enamels; and lotions so that she will have them on stock. She sells these items based on the catalog price so that she can generate better revenue.

Lleny is someone who makes the decisions regarding the earnings from her business. She feels more secure in offering her products and considers herself to be a determined, consistent, and responsible woman when handling her loan payments. She says she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and a small businessperson.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to add to her inventory

loans.name: Máximo Leonel

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo, comarca palo grande el señor Máximo Leonel J. C., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias las que desarrolla en el trayecto del día todos los días de la semana, y cuyas jornadas comprende un promedio de 6 horas diarias, el señor Máximo J. tiene dos hijos los que también contribuyen a los que haceres diarios, dentro de los principales rubros que desarrolla están las siembra de maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar y en menor escala la crianza de peses de forma artesanal todas estas actividades son las que le permiten obtener sus ingresos para el sostén de su familia, el señor Máximo J. ha tenido 4 créditos con los cuales ha comprado la mayoría de su ganado sin embargo quiere seguir aumentado su hato ganadero ya que ha considerado que es un rubro muy prometedor para su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Máximo Leonel J. C. has dedicated most of his life to developing his agricultural business in the locality of Somotillo, in the Palo Grande region. He works every day of the week for an average of six hours a day. Mr. Máximo J. has two children who help out with the daily duties. Some of the work they perform include planting corn, sesame, sorghum; raising cattle and pigs; and on a smaller scale raising fish. These activities allow him to earn the income necessary to support his family. Mr. Máximo J. has previously been granted four loans that he has used to purchase most of his cattle. He would like to purchase more cattle as it’s proven to be a profitable business for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ermicenda

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca san ramón entrada a palo grande, la señora Ermicenda O. C.se dedica a la producción agropecuaria destacándose en varios rubros como son la crianza de ganado bovino y porcino también el establecimiento y producción de granos básicos como son maíz y frijoles.
La señora Ermicenda O. ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a estas actividades las que le proveen lo necesario para el sostén de sus cuatro hijos y su padre, también realiza actividades comerciales como es la venta de cosa de horno que le asegurara otros ingresos adicionales.
El crédito solicitado será empleado en para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes  he insecticidas para el establecimiento de maíz de primera.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo municipatility of San Ramón, Ermicenda O. C.dedicates herself to several farming endeavors such as raising cattle and pigs. She also grows some basic crops such as corn and beans. Ermicenda has been in this type of business for most of her life, and these activities have served to provide the necessary sustenance to care for her four children and her father. She also sells food, which helps her generate additional income. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to establish her corn crop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her crops and a cow.

loans.name: Yimy David

texts.es: El Sr. Yimi David C. J. de  32 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar. Vive en la casa de sus padres en Sector los Mayuries del Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Adicionalmente su conyuge percibe ingresos como obrera de campo con lo que apoya en la canasta familiar. Son personas emprendedoras, que gracias a su empeño lograron adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr de construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Yimi David C. J. is 32 years old and has one school age child. He lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the area of Mayuries in the District of Santiago. Yimi David works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial company. In addition, his wife also works as a farm laborer to help with feeding their family. They are enterprising people who, thanks through their efforts, have been able to acquire their own property.

Yimi David needs a loan to finish the construction of his house, which was impacted by the 2007 earthquake. His dream is to have his house completely built so that he can achieve a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the support that we have provided through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Mr. Lina L., age 40 and his wife, Mrs. Net Neang, 38, have been married for twelve years and have three children: two sons and one daughter, two of whom attend school. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Lina was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Lina has just started his business selling coffee and tea six months ago. He buys it from Vietnam and distributes it to sell in other provinces. He hopes to expand his business to make it bigger so that he will be able to generate income to support his family as well. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand his coffee and tea business

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom S., age 26, and her husband, Mr. Chek Hom, 29, have been married since 2005 and just have a young son. Besides her son, Sreymom also has her sister and grandmother living with her on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreymom has been a silk weaver for ten years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction contractor for five years. He works in his village and in the nearby districts.

He husband doesn’t have enough materials to operate his business and so it’s difficult for him when he works. Hence Sreymom is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s business

loans.name: Mirtha Gladys

texts.es:
Mirtha es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Posope Alto del distrito de Patapo, una zona conocida por ser netamente productora de caña de azúcar y que se encuentra ubicado a treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Debido a que la mayoría de pobladores de la zona son trabajadores dependientes de la empresa agroindustrial del lugar, su negocio de venta de ropa la realiza principalmente al crédito para ser cobrado quincenalmente (en algunos casos mensualmente). En el caso de la venta de cosméticos, ésta se hace a través de catálogos y directamente de su stock de mercadería.

Su negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su hogar, su esposo trabaja como chofer de combi de la ruta Pátapo – Chiclayo. Con el dinero que ambos perciben, salen adelante y actualmente se encuentran ahorrando dinero para poder adquirir su casa propia.

Mirtha desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 31 year old mother who lives with her husband and young son in the home of her parents, which is located in the area of Posope Alto in the District of Patapo. This region is located 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo and distinctly known for its sugar cane production.

Mirtha has been selling clothing and cosmetics for two years. Since most of the local residents are workers who are dependent on the agro-industrial businesses in the area, her clothing sales are made on credit and she collects payments biweekly (and sometimes monthly). With her cosmetics sales, her customers order through catalogs or buy directly from her stock of merchandise.

Her business has been a great help to her household finances. Her husband works as a driver of a van that travels along the route between Pátapo and Chiclayo. With the money they both earn, Mirtha and her husband are able to get ahead and are now saving money so that they can acquire their own home.

Mirtha wants to expand her business by purchasing more products. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 2000 PEN. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances have great respect for her and consider her to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Andres Arnaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Andres Arnaldo S. J. de  25 años de edad, es padre soltero tiene 1 hijo menor. Tiene casa propia ubicada en el Caserio de la Venta Alta. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño a logrado adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda ya que se encuentra en construcción. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Andres Arnaldo S. J. is a 25 year old single father with one dependent child. He has his own house in the village of Venta Alta and works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial company. Andres is an enterprising person who, thanks to his efforts, has been able to acquire his own property.

His house is in the middle of construction, so Andres is requesting a loan to bring this process to completion. His dream is to have his entire house finished so that he can achieve a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the support that we have provided through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeng C., 51, and her husband, Mr. Saroem Ros, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, and two assist their parents with the farming business. 

Yeng and her husband have been farming since they were married. The couple wants to purchase a water pumping machine to spray their farm, but they don’t have the money. So, Yeng is requesting a loan of $350 in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda A. has been buying and selling rice and frozen foods for almost three years to supply additional income for her family. She is 41 years old and married with two minor children. She lives in the province of Rizal with her husband, Angelito. He is a laborer who works closely with her. Imelda would like to receive a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to increase her inventory of rice, tocino (sweetened cured pork), hot dogs, ham, skinless chicken, pork, embutido (meat loaf) and other frozen food products. Imelda believes that this loan will help to grow her business and drive increased revenue. Imelda has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2005. She is a devoted member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and stable repayments on previous loans. Her long-term goals are to maintain the profitability of her business and support the education of her children.
