Imelda is hopeful that her buying and selling business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy rice, tocino, hot dogs, ham, skinless chicken, pork, embutido and other frozen foods products

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan C., shown in the photo, is a widow with six children: two sons and four daughters. One of her children is married and lives in a separate home, one is a fisherman, and another one attends school. The other three have full time employment in Phnom Penh. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yan has been a silk weaver since 1983. She sells her finished products to a middleman who takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and sewing machine spare parts

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B., age 43, is married with five children: two are in high school and three are attending elementary school. Lilibeth lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband works long hours as a taho vendor to support the family. To supply additional income, Lilibeth wants to expand the family variety store business through obtaining additional working capital. 

Lilibeth would like to receive a loan of 19,000 PHP to purchase an inventory of rice, liquors, cases of beers, canned goods, and other supplies for her variety store. Lilibeth believes that offering a wider assortment of goods to her customers will increase traffic to her variety store and maintain customer loyalty in the community.

Since the course of her membership in ASHI, Lilibeth has achieved strong performance with regular attendance to group meetings and solid repayments.  Lilibeth is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that their expanded business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s college education.

About ASHI: 

Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of rice, liquors, cases of beers, canned goods, and other supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Pakita

texts.en:
Pakita M., age 49, is married with four grown children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband, Secero, works a carpenter. To supply additional income for her family, Pakita is starting a business direct selling of Avon products and rice in the neighborhood.  She is ambitious and determined to launch a successful business venture of her own.

Pakita would like to receive a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase an inventory of lotion, Windscape, cologne, lipstick, underwear, powder, and supplies of rice. A dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Pakita is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to build a sustainable business, fund her children’s college education, and to construct a more durable home that can withstand the flooding so common in her town. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

About ASHI: 

Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of lotion, Windscape, cologne, lipstick, underwear, powder, and supplies of rice

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina C. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. Gina has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: To earn a living, Susana D. buys and sells chicken. She is a 40-year-old married woman from Antipolo, Rizal. She and her husband are blessed to have five children. She has been in her business for three years. Susana is a very industrious woman, determined to achieve a better life. Despite hardships caused by poverty, Susana remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her husband makes her life quite meaningful. Susana joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008. She is a member of the Lower Buhanginan Center of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal West Branch. During the course of her membership, she has been noted to be an excellent performer with respect to regular attendance at meetings, loan repayment and projects. She is now seeking her third loan in the amount of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional inventory. With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, Susana is hopeful that her dreams of sending her children to university to complete degrees will be achieved. She also hopes to finish the building of their own house made of concrete. Susana’s desire to give her children a brighter future fuels her dedication to her business. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of chicken

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang S. (pictured with his daughter), 44, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthoeun Norn, 44, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1983 and have one daughter. Samnang has been a security guard since 2008, while his wife has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

Samnang is requesting his first loan of $500 to pay fees for his daughter who is learning wedding planning/decoration skills.

loans.use: To pay fees for his daughter who is learning wedding planning/decoration skills

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. When she got married, she started making and selling peanut butter. Their income is not enough to support the needs of their growing children. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to acquire secured capital to continue expanding her business. For her, the business is important, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center. 

Josephine applied for this loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more inventory of peanut butter and ingredients. She also wants to save money from her business to meet their daily needs. She hopes that through her loans from ASHI in partnership with Kiva, someday she will be able to discover her talent and engage in a more productive business.

Josephine dreams that her children will finish college. Additionally, she hopes to continue her business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family and provide them with a better life that is far away from poverty.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the photo. The camera internal date was not set on the correct date.

About ASHI
Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of peanut butter and ingredients

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie Y. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Annie is married and has 4 school-aged children. Annie owns & operates a  sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. Annie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita R. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Carlita is married and has 3 adult children. Carlita owns & operates a retail store where she sells longganiza (pork sausage flavored with local spices), charcoal and hypo (calcium hypochlorite - a disinfectant). Carlita has been engaged in her business for more that a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Carlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the needs of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is from the village of  Palao, Iligan City. She is 57 years old. Lucia is a widow with 2 adult children. Lucia owns & operates a store where she sells processed food like longganiza (pork suasage with local spices) and dried fish. Lucia has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 61 years old. Norma is married and has 3 adult children. Norma owns & operates a  sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Mr. Benito A. is from the village of Locus, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old. He is a farmer and a Barangay Kagawad (an elected government official) in the local community. His income of 9,000 per month comes primarily from his barangay honorarium (payment for government duties) and from his agriculture business. Benito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to pay for his motorcycle.




About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for his motorcycle

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Mr. Elias D. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 43, married and is blessed with 2 school-aged children. His income of 6,000 comes primarily from his salary and from his SSS (social security system) pension. In 2009, he joined PMPC to access the programs and services of this co-op. He is requesting a  loan of 7,000 which will be used for educational purposes. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for his children

loans.name: Mrs. Sopha Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eleven people who live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sopha K. is the village bank president, selected by the members of the team.  The members will use the loan for different purposes.  Mrs. Sopha K. is a farmer who rents a piece of land to cultivate rice in order to support her family.  She also sells fish on the side. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sopha K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish.  She will also use some of the loan to buy gasoline for resale, a new business venture. She is a widow with one child who is an iron welder.

loans.use: To buy fish and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Noav Peang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for ten people who live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Noav P. is the village bank president, and was selected by all the members of the team.  They will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Noav P. and her husband, Mr. Vanney Toem, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for selling to support their family living. Although they try to work hard in their field, they do not earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve the living conditions for their family, Mrs. Sopha Koem has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding to start a new business. This couple has two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other is enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Muhabbat Karabaeva's Group

texts.ru:
Мухаббат 50 лет. Она замужем и мать 4 детей. В данное время она проживает со своим мужем  и младшей дочерью- студенткой факультета бухгалтерского учета.  Ее супруг работает водителем пассажирского буса, также активно участвует в семейном бизнесе. Они занимаются выращиванием и реализацией сельхозпродукции. Этим бизнесом они занимаются на протяжении 20 лет, за счет дохода от бизнеса купили пассажирский бус. Этот кредит будет использован для закупа одного бычка для откорма.
Кадыров Шарабидин, 50, женат. Его супруга работает в школе учителем начальных классов. У него двое детей:дочь и сын. Шарабидин занимается разведением поголовья МРС. Еще отец клиента занимался этим делом и с малых лет он был обучен разведению скота. Кредит будет использован для закупа МРС.
Сейдахан замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее супруг работает техмастером. Совместно с супругом она занимается разведением и откормом МРС и КРС. Бизнес был начат с 2006 году с двух овец. В данное время  у нее имеются корова, теленок и 2 овцы, также на прибыль они смогли купить авто. Кредит будет использован для закупа теленка. 
Шахназа, 22 года, замужем и воспитывается одного 3 сына. Ее супруг на заработках в РФ. Шахназа занимается реализацией детской одежды на рынке ХАлмион. Кредит будет использован для расширения ассортимента продукции, а именно одежды для взрослых.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 50 years old. She is married and is a mother of four children. She lives with her husband and youngest daughter who is a college student majoring in accounting. Her husband works as a bus driver and also takes an active part in their family business. They grow and sell agricultural produce. They have been doing this business for twenty years and used the profit from it to buy the passenger bus. They will use this loan to buy one calf for feeding. Sharabidin K. is 50 years old, he is married. His wife works as an elementary school teacher. They have two children: a son and a daughter. Sharabidin breeds small cattle. His father has been in this business and Sharabidin has learned to breed cattle since a very young age. The loan will be used to buy small cattle. Seydahan is married and is a mother of two children. Her husband works as a technician. Together with her husband they breed large and small cattle. They started this business in 2006 with just two sheep. Right now they own a cow, a calf and two sheep and have also purchased a car using the profits from the business. They will use the loan to buy a calf. Shahnaza is 22 years old, she is married and is raising a three year old son. Her husband is now working in the Russian Federation. Shahnaza sells children's clothing on the Khalimon market. She will use the loan to expand the variety of her inventory by including clothing for grown ups.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small cattle, calfs and clothing

loans.name: Mr. Sophy Sros Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people who live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province will receive this village bank loan. Mr. Sophy S. is the village bank president and was selected by all the members of the group, who will each use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Sophy S. and his wife, Mrs. Champea Chan, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family. In the rice field, they have some problems because their field has infertile soil and is located far from an irrigation system. Thus, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to improve the productivity of the rice field in this current year. Mr. Sophy S. is the father of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, another does farming, and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en: Ni Komang R. (0) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pigy Lestari (MUK-0013). Ni Komang is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Komang joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from MUK. Ni Komang is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** NI KOMANG R. (0) merupakan 46 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA - BALI. NI KOMANG adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah PIGY LESTARI (MUK-0013). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI KOMANG sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI KOMANG menghasilkan sekitar 100,000 IDR. Dalam 2009, NI KOMANG bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI KOMANG telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidée J. O. tiene 53 años y vive en el barrio Carrizal de Barranquilla, descrito por Aidé como un barrio muy alegre donde en cada esquina, es escuchada la música con ritmos champetas a través de enormes y resonantes  cajas de maderas llamados pickup, que al ser escuchadas en esta zona,   hace que niños y adultos se muevan al son de la música.  
Aidé vive con su esposo y tiene 9 hijos entre los 25 y 39 años;  se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y algunas veces vende mercancía,  negocio  en el que  quiere incursionar  gradualmente, cambiando poco a poco  su actividad de vender almuerzos y es justamente su gran desafío; esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $1.000.000 para comprar sabanas toallas, vestidos  para niños  ropa y calzado.
Inició su negocio con la ayuda de un amigo que tenía la experiencia de comprar mercancía en el  departamento de la Guajira   con muy  buena acogida de sus clientes, pero luego  Aidé  realizó sus propios viajes, comprando electrodomésticos, ropas, toallas, con buenos resultados.  Ella aún recuerda, cuando llegó de 9 años a Barranquilla desde Arenal, en el departamento de  Bolívar   y no pudo  terminar sus estudios de bachiller por muchas dificultades, por eso se dedicó a la venta de mercancías  y posteriormente a la venta de almuerzos  entre los vecinos de su barrio  y de     sectores aledaños a su negocio. En la actualidad los hijos la apoyan, este es precisamente uno de sus logros: el  haberlos sacado adelante, porque han realizado carreras técnicas y ahora son su gran soporte.
Para Aidé tener un negocio  ha sido su mejor empleo, este es su segundo créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la acogió, cuando en otras había sido rechazada porque su edad no se ajustaba a los parámetros establecidos por esas empresas;   su negocio ha progresado pero sueña con ser exitosa en la venta de mercancías, actividad que conoce por su propia experiencia.
texts.en:
Aidée J. O. is 53 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Carrizal in Barranquilla. She describes her neighborhood as being cheerful on every corner. One can hear the music containing rhythms of “champeta” that resonate from wooden boxes called “pickup” throughout the area. Children and adults can’t help but move to the sound of the music.

Aidée lives with her husband and has nine children between the ages of 25 and 39. She sells lunches and occasionally merchandise. She wants to gradually transition into her second business and is trying to make changes gradually away from selling lunches, but this process has been a great challenge. For this reason, she is applying for a loan worth 1,000,000 COP to purchase bed sheets, towels, children’s clothing, and shoes.

Aidée started her business with the help of a friend who has experience in buying merchandise from the Department of Guajira. These products were well-received by her customers, but later Aidée started traveling on her own to acquire appliances, clothing, and towels with good results. She still remembers moving to Barranquilla at the age of 9 from Arenal, in the Department of Bolivar. Aidée was not able to finish high school due to several difficulties, so she decided to sell merchandise and eventually lunches to people in her neighborhood and from the surrounding areas. Her children currently help her since they represent one of her successes. She helped them get ahead since they were able to earn technical degrees and are now a great support.

For Aidée, having a business is the best form of employment. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that welcomed her when others rejected her because her age was not consistent with the parameters they established for these types of enterprises. She has made progress in her business, but she still dreams of being successful in her merchandise sales because she knows she has the experience.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, towels, children’s clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Hudoydod

texts.ru: Гулмадов Худойдод проживает в городе Куляб. Возрат, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Худойдод занимается торговлей. Он покупает и продает горючее. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Худойдод хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hudoydod G. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Hudoydod is involved in sales. He buys and sells fuel and has been involved in this type of business for over 15 years. Hudoydod wants to expand his business and improve his family's financial situation. He is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos G. V. vende comidas rápidas en su negocio llamado Rapi JuanK, que se ubica en la terraza de su casa donde vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 años y 8 meses de edad. Es habitante del barrio El Bosque en el suroccidente de Barranquilla, barrio grande que se extiende a lo largo de La Cordialidad, carretera que une la ciudad de Barranquilla con Cartagena.
En su negocio elabora perros calientes, hamburguesas y alimentos típicos de la ciudad, tales como patacones rellenos (un tipo de frito elaborado con plátano) y salchipapas (papas con salchichas aderezadas con salsa de tomate). Inicialmente Juan Carlos fue empleado de un negocio igual al que tiene hoy y con los ahorros reunidos, logró comprar un carrito de perros calientes, con el cual se pudo independizar y utilizó su experiencia para comenzar su propio negocio. Acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para desarrollar su microempresa y con sus créditos anteriores, logró mejorar parte de su infraestructura y compró una vitrina térmica que le permite mantener la temperatura adecuada de sus productos. Ahora solicita su segundo crédito con un monto de $ 2.000.000 y con este crédito comprará una carpa, para proteger su negocio en la temporada de la lluvia, que ya pronto empiezan, para hacer el mantenimiento de su carrito en el que elabora comidas y para adquirir algunas sillas y mesas adicionales y atender una mayor cantidad de clientes.
Juan Carlos ya tiene planes para el futuro de su negocio: con su esposa está pensando en enrejar su negocio para aumentar su seguridad, adecuar un baño para prestar mejor servicio a los clientes y  colocar un reflector que le dé una buena iluminación. En relación a sus hijos, sueña con darles una buena educación con el fin de que tengan oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos sells fast food from his business, called Rapi JuanK, which is located on the terrace of his house where he lives with his wife and two children, who are 6 years and 8 months old. He lives in the neighborhood called El Bosque in the southwest of Barranquilla. It is a big neighborhood that runs beside the highway, called La Cordialidad, that connects the city of Barranquilla with Cartagena.

At his business, he makes hot dogs, hamburgers, and typical dishes of the city such as "patacones rellonos" (a fried snack made of plantain) and salchipapas (potatoes with sausage seasoned with a tomato sauce.) Initially, Juan Carlos was employed by a business just like the one he has today, and with the savings from his job he was able to buy a hot dog stall, which enabled him to be independent and he used his experience to start his own business. He came to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to develop his small business and with his previous loans he was able to improve part of his infrastructure and he bought a heated display unit that lets him keep his products at the proper temperature. Now he is requesting his second loan of a total of $1,050 and with this loan he will buy a canopy to protect his business when it rains, and the rainy season is nearly here. He will also use the loan for the maintenance of his stall in which he makes the food and to add some additional chairs and tables so that he can serve more clients.

Juan Carlos already has plans for the future of his business: with his wife, he is thinking of adding bars to his business to increase its security, adapting a restroom to offer a better facilities to the customers, and putting in a spotlight so things will be better lit. In relation to his children, he dreams of giving them a good education so that they can have a life of opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a canopy, chairs and tables, and to maintain his stall where he makes the food he sells

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han S. (pictured in her grocery store), age 39, and her husband Mr. Dara Run, age 44, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. One of them works full-time and the other three attend school. 

Han has been selling grocery for three years. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh to resell in her store in front of her house. Han hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional grocery items to respond her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To continue expanding her grocery business.

loans.name: Sichat

texts.en: Sichat, age 38, is single and lives with her brother and elderly father on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been a silk weaver for more than 20 years. She sells her finished products to middleman in the village, who then sell the products in Phnom Penh market. Sichat has borrowed through Kiva one time already, and she now is asking for another loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Ismailova Gulshair's Group

texts.ru:
Исмаилова Гулшаир является лидером данной группы. Ей 40 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Ее супруг работает рабочим в  горводоканале города Ош. Клиент занимается выращиванием, переработкой и перепродажей картофеля и пшеницы. Этим бизнесом они занимается с 1995 года. Кредит будет использован для закупа саженцев груш для посадки. В будущем клиент планирует построить новый дом для своих детей. 

Гулмира, 45, замужем. Она мать двух детей, старшая дочь учится в школе, а сын дошкольного возраста. Ее супруг является главой сельского совета. Клиент занимается кройкой и пошивом национального мужского головного убора - калпак. Пошивом она занимается дома и имеет свою постоянную клиентуру. Кредит будет использован для закупа войлока и материи.

Анаргул замужем и мать 4 детей. Она занимается выращиванием картофеля. Кредит будет использован для закупа семян и удобрений. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 120 долларов. 

Азамату 27 лет. Он также женат и воспитывает двоих детей. Клиент занимается розничной реализацией продуктов питания и ТНП с собственного ларька. Кредит будеи использован на увеличение оборотного капитала т.е. закуп продуктов питания

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulshair I. is a leader of this group. She is 40 years old, she is married and raising three children. Her husband works at the town water supply station in the town of Osh. She grows, processes and resells potatoes and wheat. They have been in this business since 1995. The loan will be used to buy pear seedlings for planting. In the future she plans to build a new house for their children. Gulmira is 45, she is married. She is a mother of two children. Her oldest daughter goes to school and her son is in preschool age. Her husband is a head of their village board. She makes and sews the traditional national men's head garment called "kolpak" (cap). She does this at home and has regular clientele. She will use the loan to buy felt and fabric. Anargul is married and is a mother of four children. She grows potatoes. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Her monthly income is around $120US. Azamat is 27 years old. He is also married and has two children. He sells in retail food products and other household goods from his own stall. He will use the loan to increase his working capital to buy more products for sale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pear seedlings

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyroth S. (pictured with her children), age 39, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap I, age 41, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for 16 years and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are still young.  

Sreyroth has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a construction worker. He works in his village. In addition, Sreyroth hopes to create another new business, selling lotus, but she doesn’t have enough capital. So she is requesting a loan of 500 USD to help her to purchase lotus under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase lotus under contract for resale.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn C. (pictured here), 50, and her husband, Mr. Ny Chhum, 57, have been married since 1979 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers, four attend school and one is still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthorn and her husband are rice farmers. Besides farming, Chanthorn also sells porridge in front of her house and her husband is a wooden house builder. 

Chanthorn is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$1,000. She will use $400 to purchase a water pumping machine and $600 of the loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru:
Нурматов Джамшед проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Более 4 лет занимается растениеводством. У него земельный участок, где он сажает деревья. Кредит берет для приобретения саженцев.
Он хочет посадить фруктовые деревья.
texts.en:
Djamshed N. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 49 years old, married and has 6 children. He has been involved in horticulture for over 4 years. He has a plot of land, where he plants trees. Djamshed is requesting the loan for the purchase of tree seedlings. He wants to plant fruit trees.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tree seedlings

loans.name: Kunduzkan Eratova's Group

texts.ru:
Кундузкан работает преподавателем в средней школе. Ей 41 год. Ее супруг в данное время находится на заработках в РФ. У нее 4 детей и все школьники. После работы в свободное время клиент присматривает за домашним скотом, ей помогают ее старшие дети. У нее имеется дойная корова, с которой она получает молоко и реализует в городе Ноокат. Кредит будет использован для закупа еще одной дойной коровы.

Гулчехра, 44, замужем и мать 4 детей:по 2 сына и дочери. Два сына уже работают отдельно и таким образом поддерживают семейный бюджет. Она также работает учителем в школе, как и предыдущая участница  группы. Кредит будет использован для закупа 3 баранов для откорма и перепродажи.

Замире 47 лет. Она занимается животноводством. Ее супруг  Сабиров Шакир работает в России. Перед тем как заняться животноводством, она достаточно долгое время занималась торговлей. Кредит будет использован для закуп бычка и отправки его на пастбище.

Максуда, 48, замужем. У нее 5 детей, самой старшей 22 года, а младшей всего 2 годика. Клиент является завучом в школе. Как дополнительный источник дохода, она несколько лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Сейчас у нее есть 4 овца. Также она собирается приобрести корову и отправить на пастбище.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kunduzkan works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is 41 years old. Her husband is working in the Russian Federation at this time. She has four children and they all go to school. After work during her free time she looks after the cattle at home and her children help her. She has a milk cow from which she gets the milk and sells it in the town of Nookat. She will use the loan to buy one more milk cow. Gulchehra is 44, she is married and is a mother of four children: two sons and daughters. Two sons are already working and by that support the family budget. She also works as a teacher in school as the other participant of this group. The loan will be used to buy three sheep for feeding and resale. Zamira is 47 years old. She does animal husbandry. Her husband, Shakir Sabirov, works in Russia. Before she started animal husbandry business, she has been in the retail business for a long time. The loan will be used to buy a calf and send it to the pastures. Maksuda is 48 years old, she is married. She has five children. Her oldest daughter is 22 years old and the youngest one is only two years old. She works as an assistant principle in school. She has started an animal husbandry business several years ago as an additional source of income. Right now she has four sheep. She also plans to buy a cow and send it to the pastures.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To muy one milk cow, sheep, calf

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Рахмонов Сафарали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сафарали имеет средне- специальное образование. Более 15 лет занимается ремесленничеством. У него мастерская, где он занимается изготовлением национальных тарелок и других вещей. Кредит берет для закупа генератора, так как свет у них часто отключают.
texts.en:
Safarali R. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Safarali has a secondary-specialized education. He has been involved in craftsmanship for over 15 years. He has a shop, where he makes national dishware and other things. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a generator because he is often left without electricity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a generator

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak T. is 22 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area with his jobless father. Spartak has а higher education and he works as an agronomist at Tsovagyugh village administration. At the same time, he has his own businesses: lavash (Armenian bread) production and food shop managing. Also, he has farm animals and his father helps Spartak in cattle breeding. Now Spartak needs an 800,000 AMD loan to increase his lavash production’s circulating assets, especially to buy flour.

loans.use: To increase his lavash production’s circulating assets

loans.name: Tabither Moraa

texts.en:
Tabither is married to Godfrey and has two children: Brighty and Bravin.

Tabither joined KADET through existing clients. Tabither has been running a retail shop business for two years and with the loan she has applied for, she intends to add more stock of things like tea leaves, sugar, margarine, soap and others. Tabither's clients live along the railway line and therefore she has many customers. With the extra profits, she plans to open up a wholesale shop as she hopes to become a serious saleswoman in the supermarket with all the commodities.

Tabither describes herself as polite and objective.

loans.use: Expand her retail business by adding items like tea leaves, sugar and others

loans.name: Karen Rose

texts.en:
Karen Rose M. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 31 years old. Karen Rose is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Karen Rose owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Karen Rose has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Karen Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen Rose is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Karen Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 30-year-old married mother of four children ages four months to 10 years old.  All of her older children go to school.  She rents a one-room house where she lives with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Harriet takes care of additional family members.  She has a ladies salon in Busega Kiribedda and pays for transport costs to and from shopping to buy her cosmetics from shops in Kampala City. On average she serves about 10 customers each day. She works on the outskirts of Kampala and has been in business for five years.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, accommodation, and medication. Her business challenges include transportation during the rainy season which hinders her customers from coming to her salon because it is in a muddy place. She has been with MCDT for four years and is now requesting her ninth loan which she will use to buy more boxes of relaxers and cosmetics. She aspires to grow her business and start buying directly from manufacturers.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of relaxers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.en:
Petronilo A. is from the village of Digkilaan in Iligan City. He is 46 years old and married. To make a living, Petronilo runs a sari-sari (variety) shop where he sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Petronilo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Petronilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petronilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Petronilo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Petronilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zaynudin

texts.ru: Умаров Зайнудин проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Зайнудин имеет средне- специальное образование. Более 14 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку рядом с домом. Он в основном продает лекарства и препораты для животных. До этого работал ветеринаром. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть аптеку.
texts.en:
Zaynudin U. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. Zaynudin has a secondary-specialized education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 14 years and has a retail outlet near his house. He primarily sells medicines and veterinary supplies. He previously worked as a veterinarian. Zaynudin is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover. He wants to expand his business and open a pharmacy.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Teo Kato ‘S Group

texts.en: Teo is a 49-year-old widow with five children ages 10-30. Three of her children go to school and the other two are working. She rents a four-room house in a semi-urban area with electricity and piped water and she lives there with twelve people, and her family gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs because she both buys and sells from her place of work. She sells the local brew and gin to an average of twenty customers a day. Teo sells to mature people only and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for six years. Teo has been with MCDT for five years and is requesting her eleventh loan with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local brew and gin. Teo hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin and brew.

loans.name: J.cortez' Group

texts.en:
Josie C. is from the village of Ibabao. She is 50 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is J C. Group.  Josie is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josie provides food services to local community members. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Josie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Josie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Josie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow her food service business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en: Benny is a 60-year-old widow with no children because she gave birth to six children but all of them died of AIDS. Benny owns a four-room house with electricity and piped water, where she lives with four people.  Benny takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala and she works seven days a week.  She serves about fifteen customers a day. Benny is a fashion designer of ladies clothing and works in shops in Kampala City. She incurs transport costs to and from the shops. The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly rent, defaulters, medication, thieves, and feeding the family. Benny has been with MCDT for five years and is requesting her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of clothing materials and other accompanying accessories. Benny hopes to grow her business and own a  bridal shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and other accessories.

loans.name: R.agudo's Group

texts.en:
Rosa A. is from the village of Aloran. She is 45 years old and the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Rosa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the graduation fees of her children. 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a templA. to automA. the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this templA. for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurA. information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Evans Bogongo

texts.en: Evans is a married father who has been operating a general store for five years now. His business is within an estate and his clients are residents who buy basic goods from his shop on a daily basis.  Evans joined KADET at the suggestion of existing KADET clients.  He has applied for a loan which he intends to use to stock up the second shop that he has opened with items like sugar, soap, rice, cooking fat, biscuits, soft drinks and other items. With the extra profits, Evans will purchase a motor bicycle and start up another retail shop.  Someday Evans hopes to own a supermarket and a number of motor bicycles. He describes himself as diligent, faithful, and humble.

loans.use: To stock up a new retail shop he has opened.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 60-year-old widow with five children ages 8-25. Three of her children go to school and the other two have died. Teopista owns a four-room house with electricity and piped water where she lives with eight people.  Teopista takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala and she works seven days a week.  She serves about 20 customers a day selling charcoal.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family, and increasing prices of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she also sells bananas and roasted maize.  Teopista has been with MCDT for six and a half years and is requesting her eleventh loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas. Teopista hopes her business will grow bigger and she aims to own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 37-year-old married mother of five children ages 4-11 and who all go to school. She owns a five-room house where she lives with seven people. Sarah also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication. 

Sarah works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a charcoal store in Kisaasi in Nsimbi Ziwoome zone where she sells both retail and wholesale. Sarah works seven days a week and receives an average of 25 customers a day. She buys from delivery vans that pick up the charcoal from the villages and then deliver it directly to her home. Besides her charcoal business, she also sells airtime. Her major business challenges include thieves, ever-increasing charcoal prices, the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her, and even the delivery cost of transporting the charcoal.  She has been in this business for over fifteen years and with MCDT for twelve years.  She is now requesting her fourteenth loan. Sarah joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of being able to borrow in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  She hopes to grow her business and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: B.iniego's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz I. is from the village of Senote. She is 69 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Beatriz is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Beatriz runs a "sari-sari" store and also sells coconuts. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. In 2001, Beatriz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC and is now requesting her 15th loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Peter Mbugua

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married father of three children who are all in school. Peter sells CDs and DVDs around town, earning a total profit of KES 12,500 per month. He sells to residents in the Mwiki and Kasarani areas, which are densely populated with people of middle income.  He was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is his first loan with KADET. He has no previous credit history.  He plans to but more inventory and also to open a store.  He hopes to grow his business and open a big music store. He also has plans to buy a motorbike to operate as a taxi business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 37-year-old single mother of four children. Three of her children go to school while one has finished the secondary level of schooling and wants to set up his own business.

Veronica runs a salon in Naivasha town and this she has done for the last thirteen years.

Veronica was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her first loan of Ksh 25,000 well and on time. She plans to buy more cosmetics and hair products to stock her salon.

Veronica plans to grow her salon and open a hairdressing school in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda is 30 years old and married to Monicah Wanjiru. He has been employed as a motorcycle taxi operator in Naivasha for the last two years. He now wants to buy his own motorbike which will give him a higher return.

Mutinda was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy another motorcycle in a year’s time and to employ someone else to run it for him. The purchase of another motorcycle will increase his income tremendously.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
These four people, who make up this group loan, live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sovann P. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Eth, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they grow vegetables to sell to support their family.

In the vegetable field, they have some problems because their field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve their vegetable production, Mrs. Sovann P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mrs. Sovann P. has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: James Kipngetich

texts.en:
James K., who was born in 1943, is the husband of Kabon Ngetich who is a 65-year-old businesswoman. They have eight children between them aged between 21 and 35 years old.

James runs a retail shop in which he sells foodstuffs like sugar, rice, margarine, cooking fat, matches and other items. He earns a profit of Ksh 8,000 per month from this business. He also earns Ksh 6,000 from selling milk. His shop is in Kabarnet Town near the stage. This is a very busy place since his customers are not only travelers but also residents of Kabarnet Town.

James has never borrowed from any other source other than KADET. This is his fourth loan since he was introduced to KADET by a friend. If this loan boosts his business, he plans to expand his shop from retail to wholesale. He hopes and dreams of opening a supermarket in future. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his store

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van T. is 28 years old and is a resident of Siem Reap province. She was married but divorced her husband when her child was very young.

To operate her business, Van T. always wakes every day early in the morning to go to where there are many crops grown in order to buy vegetable from the farmers. She hurries to bring the vegetables to sell retail at the market and starts selling at 7:00 a.m., finishing at 5:00 p.m. She is able to generate at least $4 each day.

Up until now, Van T. needed to pay lot of money to hire a motor taxi to deliver her vegetable to the market. Now, she hopes to reduce this fee by asking for a loan from Kiva to buy a new motorcycle. With any remaining cash from the loan she will add to her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to transport her vegetables

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Ашуров Тохиржон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Занимется животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот.
texts.en:
Tohirjon A. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives together with his parents. Tohirjon is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock. Tohirjon primarily raises and sells livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mr. Koemsean Snourn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people, who are villagers in Prek Pang village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. Mr. Koemsean S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members.

Mr. Koemsean S. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Noeurn Oreng, is an embroiderer in the local village.

In the crop field, they have some problems because their field has infertile soil, is far from the irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve the crop, Mr. Koemsean S. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

Mr. Koemsean S. is the father of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school, and the others are too young to work or go to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for his rice farm

loans.name: Mrs. Sophon Kim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people that live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sophon K. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She owns a general store in the local village and her husband, Mr. Pouv YE., is a rice and corn seller.

Since, their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sophon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice and corn to sell.

Mrs. Sophon K. is the mother of six children, three of whom are married, and the others help their parents to sell corn, rice, and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more rice and corn to sell

loans.name: Toktorova Mayra`s Group

texts.ru:
Представляем на ваше рассмотрение нащу очередную группу солидарности. В этой группе собрались люди достаточно преклонного возраста, но очень активные и всегда работающие на благо своих семей, и которые знают друг друга вот уже несколько десятков лет. Это их второй кредит в МБФ. 

Майра, ей 67 лет. Она вдова. У нее есть один взрослый сын, который работает в России. Вместе с Майрой проживают невестка и 3 внуков. Она занимается полеводством, в основном выращивает картофель и пшеницу. Майра начала заниматься данным видом бизнеса с 1993 года, сразу после развала СССР. Этот кредит позволит ей закупить азот и мочевину. 

Суюмкан 29 лет. Она является самой молодой участницей группы. у нее трое детей, а супруг занимается перепродажей автомобилей, а также таксует на своей машине. Сама же Суюмкан занимается реализацией продуктов питания с собственного магазина. Кредит будет использован для закупа сахар и муку. 

Саломат 76 лет. Она вдова и мать одного взрослого сына. Она проживает вместе с сыном, невесткой и внуком. Сын работает частным строителем. А наш клиент занимается разведением птицы и полеводством. В данное время они сеят картофель. Этот кредит позволит ей закупить минеральные удобрения.

Барниса, 58, замужем и мать 2 детей. Супруг пенсионер и помогает по домашнему хозяйству. Кредит позволит им арендовать дополнительную землю, где они собираются посеять картофель.   

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Presenting for your review, our next solidarity group. This group consists of people of fairly old age; however all are very active, always working for the benefit of their families and have known each other for several dozen years. This is their second loan with MBF. Mayra is 67 years old. She is a widow. She has one grown son, who works in Russia. Mayra’s daughter-in-law and three grandchildren live together with her. Mayra is involved in agriculture and primarily grows potatoes and wheat. She started this business in 1993, right after the fall of the USSR. This loan will allow her to buy mineral fertilizers. Suyumkan is 29 years old. She is the youngest participant in this group. She has three children. Her husband is involved in car sales and also provides taxi service. Suyumkan is involved in sales of food products at her own store. The loan will be used for the purchase of sugar and flour. Salomat is 76 years old. She is a widow and a mother of one grown son. She lives together with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandchild. Salomat’s son works a construction worker. And our client is involved in breeding birds and agriculture. She is currently planting potatoes. This loan will allow her to purchase mineral fertilizers. Barnisa is 58 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband is retired and helps with the household. The loan will allow them to lease additional land, where they plan to plant potatoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: In 2005, Jenny S. joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. which means "To rise up from poverty”), a micro-finance institute and Kiva partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in selling of RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes), and soon hopes to expand the business with more stock. Now on her 6th loan, Jenny requested PHP 25,000 to purchase an inventory of clothes, including jeans, shorts, and other supplies. She is optimistic that her business will grow because she already has regular customers requesting orders from her. Jenny dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her products. She also dreams of building a durable, concrete house and having a successful businesses that can provide them with a good life that is far away from poverty. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, Jenny is hopeful that her expanded business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s college education. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, shorts, and other supplies

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en:
Altanhuyag is 49 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Dulmaa, manufactures Mongolian traditional dress (deel) and apparel for horse racing at their home. His daughter attends university in Ulaanbaatar.

Altanhuyag graduated from vocational school in 1980, having studied to be a veterinary technician. Between 1980 and 1994, he worked as a veterinarian and statistician in his home province of Uvs. Between 1994 and 2002, he lived in Bayanolgii province, working as a signaller in the border guard of that area. In 2002, he moved to Ulaanbaatar to enroll his daughter in the university.

Presently, Altanhuyag operates a grocery store in the yard which belongs to his sibling. Besides this business, he works as a sentry at Buyan LLC and Urgoo public housing.

Altanhuyag is a very hardworking person and he would like to purchase a sewing machine for his wife and expand their clothing manufacturing business into a full sewing workshop. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to increase his working capital and to purchase materials for the clothing manufacturing business and also purchase more inventory for their grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials for his wife's clothing business and more inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, called a ger. His 23-year-old son trains race horses and his daughter works for her parents' business. They have been living in their current home for twenty-six years and have purchased two cars with the profits from their business.

Bat-Erdene started his grocery store in 1999, and his family helps him run the business. Their grocery store has many customers because it is the only grocery store in their province. He has signed a contract to supply consumer products to local organizations, from which he receives payment every month.

Bat-Erdene is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. He says, “I would like to expand my business and purchase an apartment for my family.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to increase his working capital and purchase additional inventory for his grocery store business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Su's Group

texts.en:
Su T. H. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Su T. H. (id:010114060001) was born in 1963 and lives in Tien Kha village with her husband and her children. Her husband is a builder. She is a farmer: she grows vegetables and goes to the market to sell. She raises pigs, too. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

Su T. H. has borrowed from SEDA for three years. This time, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 270 USD) for her pig-raising and vegetable businesses.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Dong T. T. (id:010114060002) was born in 1969. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy scrap iron to resell.

Hang T. N. (id:010114060003) was born in 1970. She wants to borrow 5,014.000 VND to invest in her store.
