Vilma is a woman who struggles day after day to get ahead. She is 54 years old, married, and has three children (ages 27, 16, and 14). Her oldest child is already married.

Vilma has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for eight years. She sells condiments and merchandise (stuffed animals and toys). Vilma started her business fourteen years ago because of the needs of her household. Through her hard work every day, she was able to furnish her home. Her greatest dream is to add more floors to her house. This recent loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. Vilma is grateful for all of the support that has been provided because it has helped her improve the quality of life for herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jacintha

texts.fr:
Madame Jacintha M. est âgée de 58 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants au quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Jacintha débuta le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des friandises (patate et aloco) dès son jeune âge. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, près de 10 ans, elle   commença à évoluer seule mais le domaine du vestimentaire, des chaussures, depuis maintenant 15 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété.
Dans le souci d’agrandir son activité,  elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 36 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels, tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 30 couvertures draps et 5 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso. Madame Jacintha M. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA qui  sera utilisé  pour  la  finition  de sa maison à usage d’habitation et d’assurer le quotidien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jacintha M. is 58 years old, and lives with her husband and six children in the Médine area of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). At an early age, Jacintha began the retail business alongside her mother, who sold snack food (made from sweet potatoes and plantain bananas) After nearly ten years of apprenticeship, she started out on her own, specialising in clothes and shoewear. After 15 years’ experience, she is now renowned and enjoys a large number of clients. Wanting to expand her business, she approached Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been cooperating for the past three years. After three group and two individual loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is now requesting a third personal loan which will be used to buy 30 sheet-blankets and five pairs of shoes. Mrs. Jacintha M. gets her supplies from Burkina Faso, and sells against cash or credit to a customer base of both men and women. With this loan, she hopes to attain monthly earnings of 55,000 FCFA, which will be used to bring finishing touches to her home and to handle daily expenditures.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For various items

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
La Sra. Teolith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años, es madre de 02 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Gracias a su anhelo y esfuerzo motivador Teolith emprendió su negocio de Costura,  lleva años  dedicándose a este rubro, poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida y ahora cuenta con  clientela sofisticada que a diario acuden a su casa a pedirle su servicio, nos cuenta que tiene bastante trabajo por la etapa escolar que se aproxima, también cose vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, pantalones de vestir y mucho más, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les atiende con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones.
Teolith, sueña con tener su máquina de coser último modelo, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que siempre esperaba, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Teolith, 57, is a member of the “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Valiant Women II) communal bank, which is located in Tarapoto district, San Martín province and department. She is married and has two children, both of whom are already independent. Thanks to her drive and motivating efforts, Teolith set up a sewing shop. She has been in this line of work for several years and has gradually become better known; she now has a sophisticated client base that come by her house daily to request her services. She tells us that she has quite a bit of work due to the approaching start of the new school term. She also makes clothing for women, men and children, dresses, dressy trousers, and much more; her business is located in her home. She tells us that she does well with her items; she works based on prior orders that her customers place with her. She tends to her customers with kindness and characteristic charisma. She will use this, 2500 new sol, loan to buy meters of fabric of assorted type and color, tools like scissors, large spools of thread in assorted colors, sewing needles and sewing machine needles, pins and buttons. Teolith dreams with having the latest model sewing machine. She is a fulfilled woman, with still more desire for making her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving her the opportunity she always awaited as well as to other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted fabric and thread.

loans.name: Louise Dite Yadègnè

texts.fr:
Madame  Louise dite Yadègnè D.  est âgée de 45 ans, mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une grande famille au quartier Sébougou  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école en classe de 5 ème  année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle commença le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des céréales. Après des années d’apprentissage, elle finit par évoluer de ses propres ailes. Elle opta pour l’achat et la vente des condiments alimentaires. Elle jouit d’une forte clientèle et notoriété.     
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires correctement remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1barrique d’huile, 2 sacs de choux et  1 sac de courge. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et effectue sa  vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…). 
Son ambition est de participer aux foires de Konobougou et Loulouni.
texts.en:
Mrs. Louise (known as Yadègnè) D. is 45 years old, married and mother of six children. She lives in her husband’s extended family home, in the Sébougou neighborhood of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school in the 5th primary grade (Mali educational system), she began retail activities alongside her mother who sold grain cereals. Following years of apprenticeship she finally developed her own activity, opting for the retail commerce of food condiments. She has acquired a solid reputation with a large customer base. Wanting to increase her working capital, she approached Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After correctly reimbursing four group loans, she is now requesting her first individual loan. She will use it to buy one barrel of vegetable oil, two bags of cabbages and one bag of squash. She gets her supplies locally in Segou and sells against cash or credit to a customer base of both men and women. She hopes to reach monthly earnings of 80,000 FCFA thanks to this loan. The earnings will allow her to assist her husband and participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, etc.). Her ambition is to do business at the Konobougou and Loulouni market fairs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es una mujer luchadora, tiene 50 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 30, 25 y 18 años (conviviente), trabaja con EDAPROSPO desD. hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta D. pescados y mariscos (choros, cangrejos, machas), desD. hace 13 años, se inicio a raíz D. que vio la necesidad que había en su hogar y  ubicó un mercado el cual no tenía mucha competencia, con sus ingresos cubre los gastos D. pago D. servicios, apoya a su hija con su nieto e invierte en su negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado la educación D. sus hijos y la construcción D. su vivienda. Dentro D. los planes que Angélica  tiene para el futuro es terminar D. construir su vivienda. 
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para la compra D. mercadería y comprar los útiles escolares D. su nieto quien es huérfano D. padre y madre. Angélica agradece el apoyo brindado a los inversionistas, ya que le ha sido D. mucha ayuda para implementar su negocio y así mejorar  su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica is a determined woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children (ages 30, 25, and 18). Her youngest child is in a common law relationship. Angélica has been working with EDAPROSPO for three years and has been selling fish and shellfish (mussels, crabs, and clams) for thirteen years. She started her business so that she could meet the needs of her household. Angélica’s business is located at a market where she does not have much competition. With her earnings, she is able to cover her expenses, pay for services, and support her daughter and grandson. She also invests in her business, and because of the effort she puts into her work, Angélica has been able to proviD. her children with an eduation and build a home. Among her plans for the future are to complete the construction of her house.

This recent loan will be used to purchase merchandise and acquire school supplies for her orphaned grandson. Angélica appreciates the support that has been provided by her investors, since it has been very helpful in implementing her business and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & acquire school supplies for her grandson

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
La Sra. Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y tiene 03 hijos que aun depende de ella y están estudiando.
Dany, es una persona que a tenido muchas dificultades en su vida, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de salchipapas y salchipollo, ubicado en una esquina de su casa  donde hay bastante movimiento, lleva 05 años dedicándose al negocio .Con su primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles y siempre con el apoyo de su pareja comprarón su carrito salchipapero.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 
Dany, se siente muy contenta y feliz por el trabajo que realiza día a día y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de crecer cómo pequeña empresaria, su sueño es tener su propio local y seguir con la venta de salchipapa y salchipollo.
texts.en:
La Sra. Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y tiene 03 hijos que aun depende de ella y están estudiando. Dany, es una persona que a tenido muchas dificultades en su vida, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de salchipapas y salchipollo, ubicado en una esquina de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento, lleva 05 años dedicándose al negocio .Con su primer préstamo de 300.00 Nuevos Soles y siempre con el apoyo de su pareja comprarón su carrito salchipapero. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y parte del dinero lo invertirá en comprar utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. Dany, se siente muy contenta y feliz por el trabajo que realiza día a día y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de crecer cómo pequeña empresaria, su sueño es tener su propio local y seguir con la venta de salchipapa y salchipollo.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprarà ingredientes para la preparación de sus alimentos.

loans.name: Julissa Maricel

texts.es: Julissa Maricel tiene 27 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo como es azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes, jabón y jugos. Por lo que busca la forma de ganarse la vida tiene 1 hijo de 3 años que está a su cargo pues siempre está luchando para mejorar los servicios en su pulpería. Es así que solicita este financiamiento que será necesario para materia prima y ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos. Ella sueña con obtener otro medio de ingreso que le genere más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julissa Maricel is 27 years old and manages a store. She has been in this business for more than four years and offers all types of consumer products such as sugar, beans, oil, candy, natural sodas, detergents, soaps, and juices. Julissa works to earn a living for her three year old son, but she is always striving to improve the services in her store.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan that is needed to acquire materials and a wide variety of products. She hopes to find another form of income that will generate more revenue so that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Chinarkul's Group

texts.en: There is a saying that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself. Being the eldest of the family, Chinarkul B., the leader of this group, should have been a spoiled one, but her character, which was framed by life and some problems which she faced in her childhood, made her a determined, strong woman. At the age of about sixteen Chinarkul lost her mother and life seemed to be nonsense. However, the unity of the family and the promise which she gave to her mother, to be always near her father and brothers, let her to go on. It is the best explanation of how and why she achieved her place under the sun. Now Chinarkul is a forty-three-year-old married woman and the marvelous mother of her son. Her son attends the local school and her husband is a shoemaker. At present, Chinarkul is at home and looking after cattle. She is planning to increase her number of livestock and build a new house, so she wants to obtain a loan to buy more cattle for fattening and resale. Anisa S. is a thirty-three-year-old married young lady. She has two children: a daughter and a son, both attending school. Her husband works as a loader. Anisa has a plan to buy a car and furniture, but now she is at home and looks after her children and livestock. She wants to obtain a loan to buy calves to raise. Sanjar M. is a twenty-eight-year-old young gentleman. He is married and has two children who are too little to attend school and that’s why they are at home with their terrific grandma. In the near future he plans to buy a car and renew his furniture. Now, he works at two jobs: in the service center and in The Ministry of Emergency. He wants to get a loan to buy a car. Salkynay U. is a widow. She is seventy two but, despite of her age, she works in a newsstand. She wants to obtain a loan to work the land and buy cattle for breeding. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to fatten and sell

loans.name: Maria Adali

texts.es:
Doña María Adali E. R. tiene un terreno donde ella se dedica a la actividad de trabajo agrícola y ganadera como pequeña productora, el financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de 4 toretes para desarrollarlos y una vez estos tengan un mayor peso venderlos a mejor precio. Ella quiere comprar estos toretes para tener otra actividad de trabajo que le genere otros ingresos ya que ella se dedicaba únicamente a la siembra de granos básicos (cultivo de Frijol y Maíz), en épocas de invierno. Esta forma de trabajo lo inicio con esfuerzo propio ella trabajaba en una finca y las personas dueñas de esta propiedad le permitieron que ella utilizara 4 manzanas áreas de la propiedad para que sembrara granos básicos como frijol y maíz y con la venta de la cosecha de estos granos ella tuviera más ingresos, de esta forma estas personas dueñas de la propiedad le ayudaron, ella ahora para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a esta otra actividad de trabajo comprando y vendiendo ganado, la expectativa que ella tiene con este tipo de negocio comprando y vendiendo ganado, ella espera aumentar su operatividad de trabajo teniendo otra alternativa y otra forma de ingresos ya que antes ella solo tenía  ingresos en épocas de cosecha y ahora tiene mayor operatividad y más trabajo en todo el año.
Doña María Adali E. es casada y tiene 3 hijos estos niños estudian la primaria en una escuela cerca de la comunidad donde ella vive. Doña María Adali tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel desde el año 2006 y se le han otorgado 5 créditos para apoyarla en esta actividad de trabajo. Cuando se le comenzó a dar financiamientos a doña María ella tenía únicamente 3 vacas y ahora con este apoyo que se le dado en estos 4 años ha venido mejorando y aumentando su unidad productiva ósea ella ahora tiene 9 vacas paridas y 5 toretes, el beneficio que ella ha tenido ha sido notable esto le permite tener una mejor forma de trabajo y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. María Adali E. R. has a plot of land where she does farm work and raises cattle. She will use the financing to purchase 4 young bulls to raise. Once they have more weight, she will sell them at a higher price. She wants to buy these bulls to have another work activity that generates income. She used to work by only growing basic grains (bean and corn crops) during the winter. She started this type of work on her own initiative. She used to work on a farm and the owners of the property allowed her to use an area of four blocks on the property to plant basic grains such as beans and corn. With the sale of the crop, she had more income. In this way, the owners of the property helped her. Now, in order to improve her income, she works at the other activity buying and selling cattle. The expectation she has with buying and selling cattle is to grow her operations and have another type of income. Before, she only had income during harvest time and now she has more operations and more work all year. . Ms. María Adali E. is married and has 3 children. The children are in primary school in a school in the community where she lives. Ms. María Adali has been working with Ceprodel for four years, since 2006. They have given her 5 loans to support her in this work activity. When they started giving financing to María she only had 3 cows. Now, with the support they have given her these last four years, she has improved and increased her production. Now she has 9 calved cows and 5 young bulls. The benefit to her has been notable. It has allowed her to have better work and a better lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 4 young bulls to raise

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is married and has five dependents. She has received junior high education.

Doris sells smoked cow hide, locally called “wele” or “coat”. Wele is eaten in most African homes, and it is normally used in soups and sauces of any kind. Most people like it for its nice taste and the flavor it gives the food. She has been selling the wele for some time now at Elmina. She actually carries it on her head and moves from place to place searching for customers.

To get her wele, Doris goes to the butcher and orders the skin of the animal to be reserved for her. She comes home with it, washes it thoroughly to remove any dirt or unwanted particles that may be found on it and later re-sells it to her customers. In front of her in the photo are a few pieces left yet to be sold.

Doris’s husband is a teacher and Doris uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the children. She will use the loan to purchase more wele and other meat to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to enhance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more wele and other meat to sell

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Agnès T. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3ans et demi. Elle est détentrice d'un dépôt de boissons ou elle vend de la bière, du vin, de la boisson sucrée et des liqueurs. Son prêt lui a permis d'augmenter son approvisionnement en marchandises. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Agnès T. is 50 years old, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of a “Banc Villageois” loan group for 3 ½ years. She owns a beverage store where she sells beer, wine, soft drinks and liqueurs. Her loan will allow her to increase her stock supply. She assists her husband in taking care of family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Liliana Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana esta casada y tiene hijos algunos independientes y otros que se encuentran en edad escolar, tiene como actividad econonica la venta de desayunos y sandwich en el mercado yungas (El Mercado Modelo Yungas está ubicado en la calle del mismo nombre y según datos ediles, es el primer centro de abasto modelo de la urbe paceña ya que cuenta con los servicios básicos, sectores de venta divididos por pisos, una guardería infantil y áreas de esparcimiento.) de la ciudad de La Paz convirtiendose de esta manera en su fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la señora Liliana es una persona muy buena y de buen carater en la atencion a sus clientes, el destino del credito sera la isntalacion de gas natural en el puesto en el que vende para asi bajar sus costos de trabajo y de esta manera tener un mayor ingreso y asi mejorar su calidad de vida, esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Liliana is married and has some independent children and others of school age. Her business is the sale of breakfasts and sandwiches in the Yungas market in the city of La Paz. (The Yungas Model Market is located on the street of the same name, and, according to the information given by the city, it is the first model public market in the city of La Paz, since it has basic services, sales sectors divided by floors, a childcare service, and a recreation area.) This is her source of income for her and her family.

Sra. Liliana is a very good person and of good character in attending to her customers. The loan will be destined for the installation of natural gas in her market stall, to thus lower her costs and in this way increase her income and improve her quality of life. She is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install natural gas in her market stall

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad, es viuda y vive con una hija en el distrito D. Pátapo, un distrito agrícola ubicado a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

La necesidad D. salir adelante y obtener ingresos que le permitan solventar los gastos familiares a raiz D. su viudez, hizo que tuviera la iniciativa D. instalar una pequeña bodega en el domicilio en donD. vive. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y verduras.

El negocio goza D. buena acogida debido a la calidad D. productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda a los clientes, Luz desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más productos que le permitan satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luz es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. las difucultades que le ha puesto la vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luz is a 52 year old mother. She is a widow who lives with a daughter in the District of Pátapo, an agricultural district that is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Luz needed to get ahead and obtain income to meet her family expenses as a result of becoming a widow. She took the initiative to open a small grocery store in home where she offers her customers all types of basic necessity products (rice, sugar, and oil), groceries, and vegetables.

Her business has been well received because of the quality of her products and the good service that she provides to her customers. Luz wants to expand her business buy purchasing more products to meet the demand of her customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help meet her objective.

Luz is an extremely hardworking woman who has managed to get ahead despite the difficulties she has faced in life. She has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated that she is a punctual and responsible client when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Doña Josefa de edad de 48 años es muy esforzada a su trabajo, desde horas temprano se levanta para atender su negocio una pequeña pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner producto de sus ahorros y apoyo de su esposo. El cual se desempeña como fontanero, doña Josefa procreo cuatro hijos, dos trabajan y dos estudian, para ella se le hace difícil cuando las ventas se le ponen bajas el cual es su medio de apoyar a su familia para saldar los gastos. Con esta solicitud invertirá en productos para mejorar las ventas el cual comprara: granos básicos, cereales, golosinas. Huevos, lácteos, carne, pollo, producto de sardinas para la temporada de este verano. Con esto espera aumentar las ventas. Sus planes es seguir ayudando a sus hijos que terminen de estudiar para que logren mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Doña Josefa is 48 years old and extremely vigorous in her work. She wakes up in the early hours to attend to her small grocery store that she has been managing for several years. Josefa has been able to set aside some savings so that she could help her husband, who works as a plumber. Doña Josefa has given birth to four children, two of them are working and the other two are students. Things become difficult for her when sales are low, since this is the means by which she supports her family with the expenses.

With this loan, she will invest in products to improve her sales such as dry goods, grain, candy, eggs, dairy products, meat, chicken, sardines, and other products for the summer season. She hopes to increase her sales because she has plans to help her children finish their studies so that they can have better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D. est une femme de 50ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis 3ans et demi, elle a 7 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, elle vend des tissus teintés, des pagnes en couleur et des grands boubous cousus avec du tissu léger. Avec les revenus générés par son activité de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Coumba D. is a 50 year-old married mother, with one child. She has been a member of the Darou-Koudoss Banc Villageois (credit association) for three and a half years and has successfully received seven loans. She operates a small fabric business, selling dyed fabrics, coloured pagnes (West African cloths) and large boubous (flowing robes for men or women) made of light fabric. She would use the revenues generated by her business in order to support her husband in seeing to the family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her revenue-generating business

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en: Bokonbaevo is a village which is located at the shore of Lake Issyk-Kyl. It is one of the most visited places by tourists from all over the world. The villagers are very hospitable and well-wishing people. One of them is Mira B., the leader of this group. When Mira’s husband died, only her newborn son gave her the strength to go ahead. She totally dedicated herself to her son. Still, a wound that has never healed sometimes cuts the ground from under her feet but, looking at how her son is growing up and how he just looks like his father, she understands that life is terrific. Also, Mira has understood that wishes do not wash dishes, so she has had to do something for a living. With 500 KGS ($12) in her pocket, she started her little business selling a particular sort of potatoes, which later on turned out to be big business. Now Mira deals with the harvest of potatoes and sells them in the market. Her revenue is 3,450 KGS ($80) and she gets a pension of about 716 KGS ($16). She is planning to provide education for her son and to buy a house. Mira decided to buy 500kg of potatoes with the loan which she wants to obtain from Mol Bulak Finance. Anarkul K. is a forty-seven-year-old married woman with three children. Her eldest daughter is a student and the rest are schoolboys. Her husband is a driver for a company and earns 8,000 KGS ($180). She makes national items and sells them. She started her business with 2,000 KGS ($45) and her revenue is now 4,000 KGS ($90). She plans to provide education for her children, marry off her eldest son and finish building a shed. She wants to obtain a loan for sowing wheat. Kurmanbubu T. is a fifty-year-old woman who is married and has a daughter. Her husband works for a company and his salary is from 3,000 KGS ($70) to 7,000 KGS ($160). She makes national items to sell and her profit is 2,000 KGS ($45) per month. She wants to obtain a loan to buy materials for making more items. Aynura S. is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman. She has a husband and two children. Her husband is a worker and earns 15,000 KGS ($340) in the summer. She has a shop where she sells daily foodstuffs and her revenue is 10,000 KGS ($227) per month. By obtaining a loan she wants to buy a refrigerator for ice cream. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy 500kg of potatoes to sell

loans.name: Edda María

texts.es: La señora Edda P. trabaja como Responsable de la Biblioteca Pública de Niquinohomo en el cual se gana un salario que le permite mantener a sus 2 hijos menores y así poder pagarle el estudio a uno de ellos, es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo a logrado sacarlos adelante, ella se acercó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y poder comprarles sus útiles escolares a su hija y el uniforme.
texts.en:
Edda P. works as the administrator of the Niquinohomo Public Library, where she earns a salary that allows her to support her 2 young children and also pay school fees for one of them. She is a single mother and through much effort she has been able to provide for her children. She approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy her daughter’s school supplies and uniform.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies

loans.name: Mulyungi

texts.en:
Mulyungi a is 43-year-old married father of eight children who are in school. He has been running a hardware shop for fifteen years and also owns a quarry for mining building stones.

Mulyungi is a hardworking man who plans to buy a lorry (truck) to transport hardware goods to his store. He hopes to open other outlets in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy building materials to sell.

loans.use: To add to his stock of building materials

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia E. is married with three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a teacher.

Cecelia operates a provisions shop and sells things such as cooking oil, cups of sugar, toffees, mints and other groceries at Elmina. She uses her income to support her husband to pay for the children’s tuition and the utility bills.

Cecelia will use the loan to add to her initial capital to purchase a more spacious store where more of the groceries can be stocked for sale. She also wants to acquire an oil palm plantation.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecelia plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to purchase a more spacious store

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
La Sra. Elda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella y están en etapa escolar.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le  ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de productos de belleza de la línea Unique, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, Elda implemento más su negocio, comprando productos para su stock cómo, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, cremas de manos y cuerpo, lápices labiales y mucho más y así satisfacer a su clientela. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles comprará; Productos para su stock, cómo, colonias para bebes, talco de cuerpo y pies, etc. Cuenta con clientela sofisticada que a diario acuden a su casa a realizar sus pedidos.

Elda, se siente una mujer feliz, por su trabajo que a diario lo realiza  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elda, 35, is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) communal bank, which is in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has two children, both of whom are school-aged and still dependent on her. Her tenacious spirit and wish to get ahead through her own efforts led her to start selling Unique brand beauty products. Gradually she became better known among her customers and residents of the community. Today she tells us that she does well with this type of commercial activity. She used her initial, 300 new sol, loan to stock her business; she bought such items as: perfumes for women, men and children, hand and body creams, lipsticks, and much more to satisfy her customer demand. She will use this 1,300.00 new sol loan to buy stock items, such as: colognes for infants, body and feet powder, etc. She has a sophisticated client base that come by her house daily to place orders. Elda is a woman that is happy with the work she does every day and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and having her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana Milena M. M. (en la fotografia con Christina del equipo de trabajo de Kiva) tiene 26 años, está casada, tiene un hijo de 4 meses y vive en el corregimiento La Playa, zona rural de Barranquilla, en una casa arrendada con sus padres. En una habitación de la casa está ubicado su negocio que lleva por nombre “Sala de belleza Milena M.”, donde ofrece entre otros, servicios de peinados, manicure, pedicura y corte de cabello. Empezó motilando hace 6 años, e inició su peluquería independiente hace 4 años con el apoyo de sus padres. Ahora tiene 120 clientes fijos y otros ocasionales que vienen a su local y también le presta su servicio a  domicilio. Está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde el año 2.008 y con su crédito anterior ha podido comprar herramientas con las que trabaja y siente que ha sido un apoyo para ella. Es más, ha realizado varias capacitaciones administrativas para estar al día y asiste a seminarios para actualizar sus conocimientos. Ahora solicita un crédito de $2.300.000 para comprar una lavacabezas, sillas de peluquería para adultos y niños y un minisplit.
Con el desarrollo de su negocio espera cumplir sus sueños: montar su propia peluquería en Barranquilla y comprar una casa porque la actual  es arrendaron por sus padres.
texts.en:
Ana Milena M. M. (pictured with Christina from the Kiva team) is 26 years old, married, has a four month old son, and resides in the subdivision of La Playa, which is a rural area of Barranquilla. She lives in a rented house with her parents, where she also has a space set aside for her business called “Sala de Belleza Milena M.” (Milena M.’s Beauty Parlor). There she offers a variety of services such as hairstyling, manicures, pedicures, and haircuts. Milena began cutting hair six years ago and started her own beauty salon four years ago with the help of her parents. She now has 120 established clients and several others who come to her shop occasionally. Milena also provides home services. She has been affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo since 2008 and her previous loan was used to buy equipment for her work, which was a great help to her. In addition, she has different administration skills she desires to keep up to date so she attends seminars to refresh her knowledge. Milena is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 COP to buy a backwash station (for shampooing hair), salon chairs for adults and children, and a minisplit (a small air conditioning unit). With the development of her business, she hopes to fulfill her dreams: open her own beauty salon in Barranquilla and purchase the house that is being rented by her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a backwash station, salon chairs for adults and children, and a small air conditioning unit

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 26 years old and is married with one child who goes to school. He runs a video production shop where he edits and does video coverage. He records music and also takes videos at weddings and parties for his customers. He also has a dairy cow on his farm.

Francis was previously involved in a brick-making business before he ventured into his video business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his video business has grown. He hopes to improve his business and provide his family with a high standard of living.

Francis has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to restore his brick-making business. He describes himself as hardworking and optimistic.

loans.use: To restore his brick-making business

loans.name: Khotte

texts.fr: Khotte N. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants et a la responsabilité de 4 autres enfants qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 2ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle est détentrice d'un petit restaurant où elle ne vend que le petit déjeuner. Cette activité lui un permis d'équiper sa chambre à couché en achetant un lit en bois, elle lui permet aussi de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khotte N. is a 45 year-old mother of 8, who has another four children in her care. She has been a member of the Darou-Khoudoss Banc Villageois (credit association) for the past two and a half years, and has received five loans that she repaid successfully. Khotte is the owner of a small restaurant which serves breakfast only. This business has enabled her to equip her bedroom with a wooden bed, and has allowed her to maintain her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her restaurant business

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 52-year-old married father of four children.  He does metal fabrication to earn a living and uses part of his profits to pay his two employees.   William is a hardworking man who is determined to improve his business and open other outlets. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for training him how to keep business records. His dream is to provide quality education for his children. Therefore, he has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To educate his children

loans.name: Eleuterio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	
Don Eleuterio Gómez R. tiene una propiedad donde él se dedica a las actividades de trabajo agropecuarias específicamente a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos como frijol y maíz, y a la ganadería como pequeño productor. Este financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de dos toretes para desarrollo o engorde,  la razón por la cual este cliente  quiere este crédito es para comprar ganado y después venderlos,  de esta forma el obtendrá una ganancia por  la venta de estos, lo que le permitirá mantener una forma de trabajo que le genere otros ingresos en todo el año. Don Eleuterio Gómez comenzó este tipo de actividad de trabajo sembrando únicamente  granos, frijol y maíz desde su infancia adquiriendo bastante experiencia en este rubro,  
El señor Eleuterio Gómez antes de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado el todo el tiempo se dedicaba a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos ya que esto se practica de forma tradicional en el campo y a la vez es un rubro bastante importante, que se utiliza  para el comercio de estos  y en nuestra economía tiene mucha importancia, debido a que estos granos son un producto de vital  consumo en nuestra dieta alimenticia. Con este crédito el espera mantener una actividad de trabajo permanente en todo el año, esto le generara los ingresos que necesita para poder mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos que ellos necesitan, ya que él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de él. El Señor Eleuterio Gómez lleva 9 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y 8 créditos que se le han otorgado. El impacto y beneficio que ha tenido este cliente en todo el tiempo que lleva de trabajar con Ceprodel es bastante notable ya que ha incrementado su unidad productiva lo que le generado mayores ingresos no solamente en épocas de invierno con la cosecha, con la compra venta de ganado este cliente obtiene otros ingresos en épocas de verano, esto le ha impactado de forma positiva en su economía mejorando sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Borrower Profile Eleuterio Gómez R. has land where he works in agriculture; specifically, he plants basic grains such as beans and corn. He also raises cattle on a small scale. He will use this loan to buy two young bulls for fattening. He wants this loan to buy the animals and later sell them so that he can make a profit from them. This will allow him to have work that will generate income for him during the whole year. Eleuterio Gómez began by planting only beans and corn, which he has done since he was a child so he has a lot of experience in this work. Eleuterio Gómez, used to work at planting basic grains before he started buying and selling cattle year-round. Planting basic grains is done in a traditional manner in the countryside and it is a very important business because basic grains are traded commercially and in our economy this is very important. These products are of vital importance in our diet. With this loan he hopes to continue an economic activity during the whole year. This will generate the income that he needs to provide for his family and cover their expenses. He is married and has four children who depend on him. Eleuterio Gómez has been working with Ceprodel for 9 years and it has granted him 8 loans. The impact and benefit to this borrower during the time he has worked with Ceprodel is notable. He has increased his productivity, which has generated improved income, and not only during the winter harvest. With the buying and selling of cattle, this borrower obtains income during the summer, as well. This has had a positive impact for him, improving his economic situation, his income, and his living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two young bulls

loans.name: Jeffer Omar

texts.es: Jeffer es un joven de mucha iniciativa, de edad de 23 años, se dedica  ala venta de ropa y zapatos,  su esposa le tiene una niña la cual cuida su mama ya que comenzó a trabajar para cubrir gastos y ahorrar dinero para lograr hacer su propia casa. Jeffer lleva varios años en la venta de ropa el cual comenzó con la ayuda de su mama ya que también vende ropa ambulante. Para el es difícil cuando da al crédito y los clientes le retrasan el pago lo que viene a desequilibrar sus ingresos. Con este préstamo invertirá en ropa, zapatos, trajes de verano y vender en esta época el cual espera mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder lograr tener una tienda de ropa en lugar fijo. A si como lograr hacer su casa, para el estos financiamiento han sido el comienzo de una mejor oportunidad de inversión para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jeffer is a young man with plenty of initiative. He is 23 years old and sells clothing and shoes. Jeffer and his wife have a daughter who is looked after by his mother. He began working in order to cover expenses and save money so that he could have his own house. Jeffer has spent several years selling clothes and began with the help of his mother, who also sold clothes as a traveling merchant.

It is difficult to issue credit when customers delay their payments, causing imbalances in his earnings. With this loan, he will invest in clothing, shoes, and summer dresses. He expects his sales during this time of year to result in better earnings. His plans include acquiring a fixed location for opening a clothing store. In addition to supporting his household, this loan will also be the beginning of better investment opportunities to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more clothing & shoes to improve his sales

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang D. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3ans et demi et a bénéficié de 7 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés sans difficulté. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits halieutiques tels que du poisson séchés et du poisson fumé, de l'huile de palme et des balais traditionnels.
texts.en:
Mbayang D. is a 49 year-old married mother of eight. She has been a member of a Banc Villageois (credit association) for three and a half years, and has received seven loans which have all been successfully repaid. She operates a small business selling fish products such as dried fish, smoked fish, and other products, such as palm oil and traditional brooms.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her financial prospects

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is married and lives with her husband and three children. She has a junior high education. Mary sells panties and underwear in Elmina. When this picture was taken, she had run out of stock and so had only these items to show. She has been in this business for some time now. Her husband is a carpenter. Mary uses her income to buy foodstuffs for the family whilst her husband takes care of other payments.  Mary will use this loan to purchase more panties, underwear and other women's wear to sell. Mary plans to use the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase panties, underwear and other women's wear for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 33-year-old married man with one child who attends school. He has been running a retail shop for nine years in the town of Machakos. He has one employee to help him in the business and has another shop on the outskirts of town.  Peter is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him business management. He dreams of building his family a house to improve their standard of living. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy various types of cereals. Peter is a jovial and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy different types of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase young chickens and feed

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora M. tiene un tramo ubicado en el Mercado Ernesto Fernández el cual le permite que tenga ingresos para poder subsistir junto con su familia, ella tiene tres hijos menores los que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella visito las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y comprar ropa de bebé, pantaloncitos de niños y niñas, blusitas y camisetas, una paca mixta de niños e insumos de costura, esto para surtir un poco más su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos con la ganancia que obtenga.
texts.en:
Señora M. has a stall in the Ernesto Fernández Market, which permits her to have income to enable her and her family to have a means of support. She has three young children of school age. She visited the offices of Ceprodel to apply for a loan to buy baby clothes, boys' and girls' pants, blouses and shirts, a bale of mixed children's clothes, and sewing supplies. This will stock her business a little more, and the earnings that she will obtain will offer her and her children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby clothes, boys' and girls' pants, blouses and shirts, a bale of mixed children's clothes, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el sector Laguna Chica una zona rural del distrito de Santa Rosa, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino para sobrevivir, empezó trabajando como obrero agrícola y poco a poco pudo adquirir una pequeña parcela en donde usualmente siembra forraje (alfalfa)y tubérculos. El nos comenta que no puede sembrar toda la extensión de terreno que posee ya que, por la cercanía al mar, sus terrenos son salinos y los cultivos no sobreviven en ese tipo de suelos.

Por ello es de mucha importancia su negocio de crianza y venta de ganado ovino, ya que este le brinda los ingresos que necesita para mantener a su familia. El cría las ovejas en un corral instalado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las vende a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. El forraje que siembra lo utiliza en la crianza de sus ovejas.

Sebatian desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de alfalfa para asegurarle a sus ovejas una buena alimentación, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de foliares para abonar el cultivo que tiene instalado.

El es una hombre bastante honrado y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es poder tener más exito como agricultor y seguir adelante con su cria de ovejas.
texts.en:
Sebastian is a 60 year old husband and father. He lives with his wife in the Laguna Chica secotor, a rural area of the Santa Rosa district, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was very young, he has worked in agriculture and the raising and selling sheep to survive. He started working as an farm worker and little by little was able to acquire a small land parcel where he usually plants forage (alfalfa) and tubers. He tells us that he can't plant the whole lot because of its closeness to the sea. Its land is salinated and the crops don't survive in that type of soil. That is why his business of raising and selling sheep is so important. It supplies the income he needs to support his family. He raises the sheep in a corral installed in the back of his house and sells them to dealers who usually visit the area where he lives. The forage he plants is used to raise the sheep. Sebastian wants to maintain his alfalfa crop to assure good feed for his sheep. This is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles. He plans on using it to buy foliar fertilizer to fertilize he crop he has planted. He is a very honest and hardworking man. His greatest wish is to be able to be more successful as a farmer and to get ahead with raising his sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase foliar fertilizer to maintain his alfalfa crop.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza del Carmen H. T. tiene una propiedad ubicada en una comunidad que se llama la labranza a unos 20 km del municipio  de Condega ella se dedica a actividades de trabajo agrícolas por las condiciones y características de la finca que son aptas para el cultivo de granos básicos y cultivos de riego.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas 4 quintales de abono 4 quintales de urea y pago de mano de obra ya que estos productos son los más caros que ella tiene que comprar, ella quiere comprar estos productos para aplicarlos y darle la asistencia en insumos a su cultivo y así poder sembrar y asegurar la cosecha de este cultivo del tomate, doña Esperanza del Carmen H. comenzó su actividad de trabajo sembrando únicamente granos básicos 2 manzanas de frijol y 2 manzanas de maíz, con la ganancia de esto ella ha venido invirtiendo para poder realizar esta otra actividad de cultivos de riego que es más costosa pero como es semi tecnificado se garantiza mas la cosecha. Antes y ahora ósea todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo ya que ella vive en el campo y es la única alternativa de trabajo que tiene en el lugar donde ella vive, en lo que ella ha venido mejorando es que antes solamente sembraba granos básicos frijol y maíz en épocas de invierno y ahora siempre continua sembrando este mismo tipo de cultivo y también cultivos de riegos semi tecnificado como es el cultivo del tomate. Con la siembra de este cultivo de riego ella espera mejorar su actividad de trabajo hasta llegar  alcanzar y tener una actividad  más diversificada y tecnificada de sus  cultivos, para poder asegurar más sus cosechas. Doña esperanza es una señora que trabaja con la ayuda de su familia ella es casada y su marido le ayuda en la labores del campo y siembra de estos cultivos, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando la primaria y le ayudan también a trabajar ya que a estos sus padres les enseñan tradicionalmente desde la infancia a los trabajos agrícolas de campo. Doña Esperanza tiene 4 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y en todo ese tiempo se le han otorgado 5 créditos para este mismo rubro de trabajo. 
El impacto que ella ha tenido con estos créditos que se le han dado es bastante considerable y de mucha importancia ya que esto le ha permitido mejorar su forma de trabajo y a la vez esto le genera más ingresos a ella y su familia mejorando su nivel de vida o permitiéndole al menos tener un poco de condiciones mas dignas para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Esperanza del Carmen H. T. has a parcel of land in a community called La Labranza, 20 kilometers from the town of Condega. She works in agriculture, since the conditions and features of her farm are suitable for the cultivation of staple grains and irrigated crops. She will use her financing to buy agricultural supplies--400 pounds of fertilizer and 400 pounds of urea--as well as to pay for labor, since these are the most expensive products she has to buy. She wants to buy them in order to enrich her crops and guarantee the harvest of the tomatoes she sows. At first, Doña Esperanza del Carmen H. grew staple crops like beans and corn, but as her profits increased, she's invested in order to be able to grow irrigated crops. Those crops are more expensive but, since they're semi-technified, their harvests are more reliable. Up to this point she has put all her efforts into this business, since she lives in the country and it's the only work option she has in her area. She has made good progress, since at first she only grew staple crops like beans and corn during the rainy season, and now in addition to those crops she sows irrigated crops like tomatoes. By cultivating irrigated crops, she hopes to improve her business and be able to grow a wider variety of produce, using more technology to make her harvests more reliable. Doña Esperanza depends on her family's help with the business. She is married and her husband works with her in the fields and sows the crops. Her three children also help her when they're not in school, since she and her husband have been teaching them about cultivating crops since they were very young. Doña Esperanza has been working with Ceprodel for four years, during which time she's received five loans for the same purpose. The difference these loans has made has been considerable and very important, since they've permitted her to improve her business and generate more income for her family, raising their standard of living or at least allowing them more decent living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies: 400 pounds of fertilizer and 400 pounds of urea, plus manpower, for growing tomatoes

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 28 años, a pesar de ser una madre tan joven pues tiene su actividad económica como es la venta de cosméticos y ropa para salir adelante. Pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el apoyo de su familia, por lo que tiene que poner de mucho empeño para salir adelante con su hijo, por lo que se levanta muy temprano para realizar las tareas del hogar y también realizar las compras de sus productos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo como es pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, cremas y colonias.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old. Despite her being such a young mother she has her own business selling cosmetics and clothing. This helps her to get ahead. It was not easy for her to get started because she did not have her family’s support. She has to put in a lot of effort in order to get ahead with her son. She must rise early every morning to do her household chores and then buy her products. She hopes to have a better home someday. She is requesting this loan to provide working capital so that she can invest in products such as lipsticks, nail polish, creams, and colognes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 33-year-old ambitious married lady who has been running an electronic shop for ten years, assisted by one employee.  Previously, she   farmed and sold clothes.  Grace feels great gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping her save her money, and now she wants to take her first loan of Kes.20,000 to add a stock of spare parts for sale.  She hopes to buy a car and a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Eliovina

texts.es:
La Sra. Eliovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos todos ya independientes.

Gracias a su optimismo y valentía le motivo por iniciativa propia dedicarse a dar servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo juntamente con su esposo, el se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad para realizar carreras. Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, compró, repuestos para su motokar. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará repuestos y aceites cómo: lubricantes, bujías, pistones, bielas; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.

Eliovina se siente orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por brindarle el apoyo que necesitaba, su meta es llegar a tener su Concesionario de Motos y Motokares.
texts.en:
La Sra. Eliovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos todos ya independientes. Gracias a su optimismo y valentía le motivo por iniciativa propia dedicarse a dar servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo juntamente con su esposo, el se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad para realizar carreras. Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, compró, repuestos para su motokar. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará repuestos y aceites cómo: lubricantes, bujías, pistones, bielas; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Eliovina se siente orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por brindarle el apoyo que necesitaba, su meta es llegar a tener su Concesionario de Motos y Motokares.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprarà repuestos para su motokares.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald tiene la actividad de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi actividad que desarrolla con su automovil, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia que esta compuesta por su esposa y su hijo de tres años el llega a emprender por recomendacion de su compañero de trabajo que tambien es cliente nuestro, el destino del credito  es para reparar y realizar un mantenimiento general de su automovil y asi poder trabajar sin ningun problema. El Sr. Ronald es una persona responsable dinamica, esta muy agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ronald works for a radio taxi service, which he does with his car. This is the main source of income for him and his family, which is made up of his wife and three year-old son. He came to Emprender [Kiva Field Partner] at the recommendation of a co-worker who is also a client of ours. The loan will be used to make repairs and do general maintenance work on his car so that it will function without problems. Ronald is a responsible and dynamic person and he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs and do general maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 34-year-old hardworking man who has been running a retail shop for three years, assisted by one employee.  His wife is a tailor and they are blessed with two children. Simon saves his money weekly with Faulu Kenya, and he now hopes to take a loan of Kes.10,000 in order to add a stock of handkerchiefs, belts and slippers to his store.  He sees himself having a well-stocked shop in a few years' time, and also aspires to owning a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To add stocks of handerchiefs, slippers and keyholders to his store

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en el Barrio San Blas distante a 200m de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos cononciendo el programa y con el apoyo de una asesora formaron su comité que hasta la actualidades funciona muy bien con todas las señoras en sus actividades.
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a diversos trabajos. Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos así como la señora Mirian quien destino su crédito a la compra de los productos que ella vende como cacerolas, ropas, herramientas y otros, ella es vendedora ambulante, recorre varias ciudades ofreciendo sus producto y se traslada en bus en cada lugar que visita.
Su Trabajo es muy sacrificado y riesgoso ya que recorre sola con sus mercaderías en bolsas de plásticos. Ella esta conforme con su trabajo ya mediante ella puedo ayudar a mi familia que necesita mucho de este ingreso comenta la señora Mirian.
texts.en:
In the San Blas neighborhood of the city of Carapeguá, 200 meters (650 feet) from our Carapeguá office, a group of women of limited resources learned about our program. They formed their committee, with the help of a facilitator. The group works very well with their individual businesses. These ladies are active workers and perform different types of work. They are looking for a little more support in the form of loans to supplement their own investments and improve their quality of life. They need this loan in order to invest in their businesses. Mirian used the money from this loan to buy the things that she sells, such as strollers, clothing, tools, and other things. She sells on foot, travelling by bus to various cities, to offer her products. Her work is very rigorous and demanding, as she carries her merchandise herself in plastic bags. She is content with her work. She says, “It allows me to help my family, who is in need of this income.”

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old married man with two school-aged children. He is a humble, hardworking man who is employed and also has a business selling clothes. He has been running this business for nine years and uses part of his profits to pay his seven employees. He was previously earning his living by farming.
Richard appreciates Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for giving him a loan to help buy a property. He has now requested a new loan of 70,000 KES to buy clothes to add to his shop's stock. He dreams of owning ten other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for his shop

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Miguel Antonio Z. A. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Maria Leonarda Rodriguez con quien tiene 5 hijos,  todos estan pequeños.
su mujer le ayuda a los trabajos del hogar, cuidar sus hijos y el se dedica a trabajar en el taller de ladrillos y tejas que tiene desde hace 3 años. 
 
el transporta los materiales en un carro de su propiedad y tambien hace los trabajos de transportar su producto terminado cuando el cliente no tiene como llevarselos.
 
tiene dos empleados que le fabrican el ladrillo y la teja, el proceso es que los fabrican, los secan y luego proceden a la cocion del producto terminado en un horno de adobe en donde lo queman con leña o aserrin
 
esta solicitando el credito para compra de materia prima tierra,leña y barro.
texts.en:
Miguel is 37 years old and lives with Maria. Together they have five young children. [Maria] helps with the household chores and cares for the children, while he works in his brick and roof tile mill, which he has had for three years. He transports his materials in his car and also delivers the finished items to his customers when they don’t have their own means. He has two employees who make bricks and roofing tiles for him. First they make the items, and then they dry them, and fire the finished items in an adobe kiln, which they heat with a wood or sawdust fire. He is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials, firewood, and clay.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilian Maria

texts.es: Doña Lilian Maria se dedica al negocio de una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de ella. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 4 años, inicio primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, sin embargo este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pueden tener la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de mercancías principalmente desea invertir en los granos básicos, pues vende más al crédito y de contado. La señora posee el sueño de tener un negocio grande en el mercado que brinde mayores ingresos a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Lilian has a small grocery store that she runs out of her home. She has two children who depend on her for support. She started this business four years ago, starting out by selling snacks for children and little by little she reinvested into her business and began selling basic grains, which is what people mostly buy. She tells us that her main motivation for starting this business was to find another way to support her children. This business has helped them very much to get ahead, and has provided her children with the opportunity to get an education. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in merchandise, mainly basic grains, which she sells most of both for credit and for cash. She hopes to one day have a large business in a marketplace, which will bring an income to her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Italo es el presidente del grupo “LA BUENA AMISTAD” conformado por 13 socios,  amigos y compañeros D. trabajo en un mercado D. la zona, todos se dedican al comercio minorista y  con mucho esfuerzo tratan D. surgir cada uno en su negocio.
Italo es vendedor D. pan empezó en este negocio hace 15 años, al principio lo hizo como ayudante D. panadería fue un amigo que le dio la idea D. dedicarse a la venta D. pan por que se ganaba un poco mas.el empezó vendiendo pan en una canasta al principio le daba  vergüenza por que era muy joven pero su habilidad le ayudo a tener buenas ventas es así que el dueño D. la panadería le facilita un triciclo para que venda D. casa en casa,le fue tan bien que con el producto D. su trabajo pudo ahorrar y comprarse su propio triciclo actualmente venD. pan por su cuenta y reparte pan  por la zona D. los Olivos D. Pro, ahi es muy conocido y querido por sus clientes, por  otro lado también tiene un puesto D. venta D. abarrotes en el mercado esto le  genera otros ingresos,  su préstamo actual lo usara para pagar su cuenta en la panadería que le da crédito.  
En un futuro cercano Italo quiere tener su propia panadería el sueño del negocio propio sabe que lo lograra para eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo.

* Italo  aparece en la foto  con camisa blanca .
texts.en:
Italo is the president of the “LA BUENA AMISTAD” (Good Friendship) group maD. up of 13 members who are friends and co-workers in a local market. All are very small merchants and are trying, with a lot of effort, to succeed in each of their businesses.

Italo sells bread. He began this business 15 years ago. At first, he maD. bread as an assistant in a bakery. A friend gave him the idea of selling bread because he could earn a little more. He began selling bread on an itinerant basis from a basket. At first, he was bashful because he was very young, but his ability helped him to have good sales; so the owner of the bakery provided him with a tricycle equipped to carry bread so that he could sell from door to door. He did so well with his work that he was able to save and purchase his own tricycle.

Currently he sells bread on his own and distributes it throughout the Olivos D. Pro zone. He is very well known there and well liked by his customers. He also has a stall in the market selling groceries. This generates additional income.

He will use the current loan for paying his bill at the bakery that supplies him bread on credit. In the near future, Italo wants to have his own bakery. He dreams of having his own business and knows he will achieve this dream because he works very hard.

Italo appears in the photo with a white shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying a bakery which supplies bread

loans.name: Dorian Danilo

texts.es: El señor S. tiene una panadería en el Municipio de Catarina, en el ofrece diferentes tipos de panes, con la ganancia de este negocio provee de alimentos, educación y recreo a sus menores hijos junto a su esposa, el esta solicitando crédito con CEPRODEL para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca, aceite y sartenes, esto con el fin de obtener un poco más de utilidad y así poder brindarle una estabilidad económica a su hogar y que no les falte nada a su familia
texts.en:
Mr. S. has a bread shop in the municipality of Catarina. He sells different types of bread. With the earnings from this business he provides food, education, and recreation for his young children and his wife. He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy flour, sugar, yeast, shortening, cooking oil, and bread pans. His goal is to get more use out of his business and thereby be able to provide economic stability to his household so that his family will not lack for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, shortening, cooking oil, and bread pans

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el sector Chacupe, una zona rural dedicada a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que era muy joven a trabajar en la agricultura, empezó trabajando como obrero agrícola y hace diez años pudo adquirir un terreno de 1.5 herctareas en donde viene sembrando arroz para ganarse la vida. Este cultivo es de mucha importancia para su familia ya que sus ingresos económicos dependen de su correcto desarrollo.

Pedro desea brindarle mantenimiento constante a su cultivo para asegurarse una buena producción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de foliares para abonar su cultivo de arroz.

El es un hombre bastante honrado y que es muy entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es tener exito en esta campaña para asegurarle a su familia la estabilidad que necesita. Pedro ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 62, is the head of a family. He lives with his wife in the Chacupe sector, a rural agricultural area located in the La Victoria district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Since he was very young he has worked in agriculture. He began working as an agricultural laborer, and ten years ago he was able to acquire 1.5 hectares of land where he plants rice in order to earn a living. This crop is very important for his family since they depend on his earnings for their continued development.

Pedro wants to offer consistent maintenance to his crops in order to assure good production. That’s why he is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles that he plans on investing in the purchase of nutrients for fertilizing his rice crop.

He is a very honest man and is very dedicated to his work. His greatest wish is to have success in this field in order to assure his family the stability that it needs. Pedro has worked with our institution previously and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of nutrients for fertilizing a rice crop.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Miguel Antonio M. F. tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la colonia suiza de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
 
el se dedica a la venta de pescado en zona de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, se transporta en una moto, coloca el pescado en una hielera y lo vende de casa en casa en los barrios y colonias que visita. muchas personas lo prefieren por el tamaño y lo fresco que vende el pescado, ademas a sus clientes se les hace mas facil ya que el lleva los pescados a la puerta de la casa y sus clientes no se tienen que desplazar para comprar dicho producto.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de pescado blanco y rojo. En la epoca de semana santa es cuando el pescado se vende mejor.
texts.en:
