Young Miguel Antonio M. F. is 23 years old, is single and lives with his parents in the Swiss neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. He sells fish in the area of San Lorenzo and Nacaome. He travels by motorcycle, carrying the fish in a cooler, and he sells it house to house in the neighborhoods he visits. Many people prefer his fish because of its size and freshness. He also makes it easier for his customers by bringing the fish to the door of the house so they don't have to go out to buy it. He is asking for this loan to buy white and red fish. Around the time of Holy Week is when fish sells best.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos independientes y con profesión.

Las ganas de salir adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo y anhelo por iniciativa propia, emprendió su negocio de venta de Salchipapas, ubicada en las afueras de su casa un espacio amplio y limpio, exclusivamente para sus clientes, vende a partir de las 6.30 Pm, ella les atiende con el carisma y sonrisa que le caracteriza  . Con su primer préstamo de 300 Nuevos Soles compró su carrito salchipapero, platos descartables y otros.  

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para sus preparados cómo: Sacos de papa, hot dog (Salchicha),  verduras cómo, repollo y tomate,   plátanos en racimos y frutas regionales para sus refrescos, así mismo utensilios de cocina para brindar  un servicio de calidad a sus clientes. 

Juanita como le dicen  de cariño, Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Juana, 45, is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) communal bank, which is in Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She’s married and has three children, all of whom are independent and with their own professions. Her wish to get ahead in life through her own efforts and initiative led her to into Salchipapa (a dish made of fried potatoes with hotdog sausage) sales. Her food stand is located outside her home in a spacious, clean area that is for the exclusive use of her customers. She opens for business at 6:30pm; she tends to her customers with her characteristic charisma and a smile for everyone. She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to buy a salchipapa cart, disposable dishes and other items. With this, 3,000.00 new sol, loan she will buy necessary ingredients for their preparation, like: sacks of potatoes, hotdogs (sausages), vegetables like cabbage and tomato, bunches of bananas, regional fruits for her beverages, as well as kitchen utensils in order to provide good customer service. Juanita, as she is affectionately called, feels strong to continue working. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and making her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah B. is married to a teacher and has one child. She received a junior high education.
Sarah is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Elmina. For a reasonable time now, she has been selling wigs, pomade, hair relaxers and other hair products. She is able to support her husband in paying school fees and utility bills.
Sarah will use her loan to buy wigs, pomade and other hair products, both to sell and use in her salon. She hopes to use the new profits that may come as a result of the loan to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy wigs, pomade and other hair products, both to sell and use in her salon

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
El señor José Luís C. A. tiene ya más de nueve años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de piñatas, también vende cascaron de huevo para la temporada de pascua.
Don José Luís tiene un problema que se le descompuso el vehiculo que utiliza para trasportar la mercancía, y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder repararla. Es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo, y así poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que también es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
José Luís C. A. has been working for more than nine years making and selling piñatas. He also sells eggshells for the Easter season. José Luís has a problem: the vehicle he uses for transporting his merchandise broke down, and for the moment he doesn't have the money to repair it. This is why he is asking for this loan, so he can fill his orders on time. He plans to pay off the loan with the earnings from his business, which is also his family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair car for distribution of piñatas and eggshells

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto tiene 56 años, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta comida. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Anteriormente Mario se dedicaba a la venta de electrodomésticos, pero tenía muchas dificultades por lo que la renta del local era muy cara y no estaba obteniendo ganancias por lo que decide establecer otro tipo de negocio como es el que tiene actualmente .Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra granos básicos, carne, pollo, verduras y frutas para la elaboración de refrescos naturales. Mario tiene el deseo de establecer un restaurante en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto is 56 years old and has 3 children who are all working adults. He sells food. For more than 16 years he has done this humble work. Mario used to sell electrical appliances, but he had many problems because the rent on the shop was very high, and he wasn't earning money, so he decided to establish another type of business, which is what he now has. And this is the reason he is asking for this loan--for working capital to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, vegetables, and fruits for making natural drinks. Mario wants to establish a restaurant in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. is married to a farmer and has one child. She has received junior high education.
Agnes travels from house to house in Elmina selling pieces of cloth and ladies underwear. She has been in this business for some time now. At the time of our visit, she was yet to receive another consignment. She supports her husband in paying for their accommodation (rent) and providing food for the family. Her loan will serve as additional capital for traveling to buy more cloth to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: As additional capital for traveling to buy more cloth to resell

loans.name: Leydith

texts.es:
La Sra. Leydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años y es madre de 01 bebe.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las fueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 6:00pm. Lleva aun poco tiempo trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos cómo arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Leydith, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Leydith, 32, is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) communal bank, which is located in Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is single and has a baby. Her tenacious spirit and desire to get ahead in life through her own efforts and initiative have led her to set up an anticuchos (skewered grilled meat) sales stand outside her home. She has gradually become better known among her customers and today she tells us that she does quite well with her business. She opens for business at 6:00pm every day. She has been in this line of work for a short time and is very happy with what she does. She will use this, 1,000.00 new sol, loan to buy ingredients, like: sacks of rice, eggs, chickens for her Juanes (a rice, chicken, olive and cooked egg dish), dressed chickens for her anticuchos, as well as kitchen utensils to provide better service. Leydith is tranquil and happy with what she does and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her meet her goals and helping to make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Carlos Adán

texts.es: El señor C. N. es dueño de una Jardinería en la que ofrece diferentes variedades de plantas así como árboles frutales, con este negocio el mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y 3 hijos, los cuales están en la escuela, en esta visitando las oficinas de  Ceprodel para comprar plantas de cocos, palmeras grandes, frutales injertos, cactus, araucarias, plátanos de jardín y juanitas, esto para poder tener mas variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes y de esta forma poder cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. C. N. is the owner of a nursery that sells different kinds of plants, such as fruit trees. With this business he supports his family, which is made up of his wife and 3 children. His children are in school. He visited the offices of CEPRODEL for a loan to buy coconut trees, large palm trees, grafted fruit trees, cacti, monkey-puzzle trees, garden-type banana trees, and juanitas [type of plant]. He wants to have more variety to offer to his clients so that he will be able to cover his family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coconut trees, large palm trees, grafted fruit trees, cacti, monkey-puzzle trees, garden-type banana trees, and juanitas [type of plant]

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya principal actividad es la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la pesca desde que era muy joven, trabaja en embarcaciones que efectuan extracciones indutriales de anchoveta (pescado que se extrae en abundancia del litoral) y, cuando no trabaja en este rubro, tambien trabaja en pesca artesanal, el pescado que logra extraer lo vende en el muelle del distrito. El depende de estas actividades para solventar los gastos familiares por lo que siempre se esfuerza por trabajar lo mas arduamente posible.

Nicolas ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que necesita para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, ya que la brisa marina esta llenando de salitre sus paredes y estas necesitan de mantenimiento para que no se dañen las estructuras.

El es un padre muy responsable y entregado a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 52 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the district of Santa Rosa, a district whose principle activity is fishing and which is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, He has been dedicated to fishing since he was young. He works on vessels that are engaged in the commercial fishing of anchovy (a fish that is found in abundance on the coast) and, when not working at this, he also works in fishing on his own: The fish that he catches is sold at the district's wharf. He is dependent on these activities to pay for the family's expenses and so he always strives to work as hard as possible. Nicolas has approached Edpyme Alternativa to solicit a loan of 1500 new soles, which he needs to makes some improvements to his home since the sea breeze fills his walls with salt and they need maintenance so that it doesn't damage the structure. He is a very responsible father, dedicated to his family. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be a trustworthy person. He has already worked previously with our institution and has proved to be a responsible client who is punctual at payment time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for maintenance and repairs to his home.

loans.name: Yenny Giovana

texts.es:
Yenny Giovana es una señora que está casada y cuenta con 31 años de edad, su esposo tiene 30 años de edad respectivamente, esta pareja cuenta con 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, los niños se encuentran en edad escolar y actualmente están cursando el nivel de primaria. Toda la familia vive en una casa que se encuentra en alquiler. 
El negocio principal  de Yenny Giovana  su familia es la fabricación de cojines y almohadas, estos productos los comercializa en las tiendas del mercado, por otra parte percibe renta por dos vagonetas y su esposo es empleado en un taller. Ambos cuentan con más de 3 años en sus respectivos rubros. Existe competencia en sus rubros pero su actividad diversificada hace que los precios se mantengan estables  de forma que es viable su negocio. El crédito lo destino para realizar arreglos en su vagoneta de forma que se mantenga buen tiempo en perfecto estado de trabajo. Cuentan con 4 operaciones en nuestra institución  con buen comportamiento de pagos, también tiene crédito en otras instituciones financieras con buena experiencia crediticia.
texts.en:
Yenny Giovana is a woman who is married and is 31 years old. Her husband is 30. This couple has two children who are 8 and 5 years old. The children are school age and currently are in elementary school. The whole family lives in a house that is rented. Yenny Giovana's main business is fabricating cushions and pillows. She sells these products in the shops at the market. She also receives rent for two cars and her husband is employed in a shop. Both have more than three years experience in their respective jobs. There is competition in their jobs but their varied business makes prices stable so that their business is viable. The loan is destined for repairs to her car so as to keep good time at work. They have four operations with our institution with a good history of payments. She also has loans with other financial institutions with good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For repairs to her car.

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
Este será su tercer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecido por su cooperación ya que le han ayudad a mejorar su taller y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar una maquinaria que le está haciendo falta. 
 Pagar el crédito con una parte de sus ganancias del taller, ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus dos hijos adolescentes y desea que tenga un buen estudio.
texts.en:
This will be his third loan with Kiva and he is very thankful for their cooperation since they have helped him to improve his shop and give better service to his customers. He is requesting another loan to be able to buy machinery that he is lacking. He will pay the loan with a part of his shop's earnings since he has under his responsibility his two adolescent children and he wishes that they get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine and a manometer.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Ana Lucía C. F., tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, un varón y una mujercita, el mayor que es el varón ya está cursando la secundaria en una escuela técnica, y la niña en escuela primaria, 

Ella se dedica  a la venta todo tipo de dulces que son propios de nuestro país.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte créditos, los cuales le han servido para invertir en el negocio, gastos personales,  a si también para mejoramiento de vivienda, vale mencionar que en todos los créditos otorgados a esta cliente, ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This woman is named Ana Lucía C. F.. She is 37 years old and a single mother of two children, a boy and a little girl. The boy is older and already attending a technical high school, while the girl is in elementary school. She sells all sorts of sweets typical of this country. She has received 20 loans from this institution, which she has used to invest in her business, cover personal expenses, and to improve her home. It should be noted that the client has been very responsible in fulfilling her obligations with every loan she's been offered.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, flour, spoons)

loans.name: Bellavista Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado Bellavista, y está conformado por 16 socias y un socio, ubicados en la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente a tejer y vender tejidos a crochet y palillos, venta de alimentos preparados como papas rellenas y empanadas y repostería.
La socia entrevistada fue Mercedes, quien es la tesorera de este banco comunal. En la foto está ubicada en 2º fila, es la cuarta señora de izquierda a derecha. .Ella se dedica a hacer repostería (tortas, pasteles, entre otros), que vende mayormente a pedido y también hace composturas de ropa en su casa. Invertirá este préstamo en una máquina de coser, ya que la que tiene es muy antigua y tiene muchas fallas. Su motivación es lograr una estabilidad económica y su sueño es tener una panadería establecida en el centro de la ciudad. Mercedes comenta que le ha sido muy útil la educación emprendedora recibida de Fondo Esperanza, en lo que se refiere a los cálculos de inversión y ganancias, ya que ahora se siente más segura, al  saber con anticipación con cuanto capital cuenta para poder organizarse con sus gastos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país. Si bien esta zona fue dañada por el reciente terremoto que afectó a Chile, este Banco Comunal no sufrió graves efectos por el mismo.
texts.en:
This community bank is named Bellavista and is made up of 16 female members and one male member, located in the city of Temuco. They are mainly dedicated to weaving and selling crocheted items, chopsticks, prepared dishes such as stuffed potatoes, empanadas and pastries. The interviewed member was Mercedes who is the treasurer of this community bank. In the photo, she is located in the second row and is the fourth woman from left to right. She is dedicated to baking (cakes, pastries, among other items), and sells mostly from orders and also repairs clothes in her house. She will invest this loan in a sewing machine since the one she has is very old and fails a lot. Her motivation is to achieve economic stability and her dream is to have an established bakery in the center of the city. Mercedes commented that the entrepreneurial education received from Fondo Esperanza has been very useful in terms of the calculations of profit and investment because she now feels more secure knowing in advance how much capital is needed to be able to pay her expenses. Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and has a number of lake resorts and striking native flora and fauna. Note that in this region live 50% of the mapuches, an indigenous people existing in our country. Although this area was damaged by the recent earthquake that affected Chile, this community bank did not suffer grave effects.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine.

loans.name: Stella Maris

texts.es:
La señora Stella Bogarin  vive en casa propia, es casada. La misma se dedica a la compra de tabaco y elabora de ellas cigarros  tradicionales que la vende a señoras y señoras de avanzada edad quienes consumen este tipo de cigarros. 
Sus ventas las realiza por la ciudad de Luque y en el mercado municipal donde provee a algunos vendedores. A la fecha la titular ha retirado dicho  préstamo para la compra  tabacos en una buena cantidad ya que encontró una oferta  y la misma le estaría dejando buen margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Stella Bogarin lives in her own house and is married. She is dedicated to buying tobacco and making traditional cigars, which she sells to women and older women who consume these types of cigars. She sells in the city of Luque and in the municipal market where some sellers are found. To date, the owner has requested this loan to purchase tobacco in a good quantity since she found an offer which would give her a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tobacco.

loans.name: Los Centralistas Group

texts.es: El grupo los centralistas está compuesto de 10 personas, es un grupo que está empezando a trabajar con Agrocapital, la característica de este grupo es  que son socias que se dedican a reparar y  venta de  zapatos, Hilda Vanessa que es la presidenta del grupo tiene tres hijos pequeños, su actividad principal es compra y venta de zapatos usados americanos, ella los vende por las noches en la calle y algunas veces viaja a provincias a las ferias, Hilda Vanessa realiza esta actividad desde hace 7 años atrás. El resto de las socias tiene negocios casi de las mismas características como reparación de zapatos, confección de zapatos para los grupos de baile, entre otras cosas también se dedican a la repostería, venta de ropa americana, venta de jugos, venta de refrescos, fotógrafos, filmador de videos. Hilda Vanessa utilizara el préstamo actual como capital de operación, incluso manifestó que quiere aumentar a su negocio venta de Cds, negocio que lo maneja paralelo al de los zapatos usados. El resto de las socias también utilizarán el préstamo como capital de operación ya sea para hacer crecer sus negocios o bien para uso personal. En el banco Centralitas existe bastante experiencia ya que las socias trabajan con bancas comunales en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
The Centralistas group is made up of 10 people and is a group that is beginning to work with Agrocapital. The characteristics of this group is that they are members who work repairing and selling shoes. Hilda Vanessa is the president of the group. She has 3 small children. Her main work is to buy and sell used American shoes. She sells them at night in the street and sometimes travels to markets in the provinces. Hilda Vanessa has done this work for the past 7 years. The rest of the members have very similar businesses such as repairing shoes, making shoes for dance groups, and they also work with baked goods, selling American clothes, juices, soft drinks, photographs, and video filming. Hilda Vanessa will use the current loan as working capital, including her idea of starting a business selling Cds along with selling used shoes. The rest of the group will also use the loan for working capital for either growing their businesses or for personal use. In the Centralistas bank there is plenty of experience since the members have worked with communal banks in other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una señora casada que tiene 3 hijos, vive en una casa que es prestada, la casa donde viven Elizabeth y sus hijos es de sus suegros, actualmente vive sola ya que su esposo se encuentra en España y hace todo esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia. 
Elizabeth se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de pan desde hace bastante tiempo, debido a que el negocio es pequeño quiere explorar nuevos nichos de mercado y se quiere diversificar comprando una máquina de coser para realizar otro tipo de mercaderías. Elizabeth no tiene mucha competencia al contrario quiere ampliar su mercado. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una maquina de costura. Las anteriores operaciones en Agrocapital las cancelo con puntualidad y responsabilidad teniendo buenos promedios en sus 2 anteriores créditos respectivamente.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman who has 3 children. She lives in a rented house. The house where Elizabeth and her children live belongs to her in-laws, but she is currently living alone since her husband is in Spain making every effort to support his family. Elizabeth has been making bread for quite some time. Since the business is small, she wants to explore new markets, and she wants to diversify by buying a sewing machine to make other types of merchandise. Elizabeth does not have much competition; on the contrary, she wants to expand her market. The purpose of this loan is for the purchase of a sewing machine. Her previous loans from Agrocapital were paid off punctually and responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for new business

loans.name: Eduardo Agustín

texts.es:
El crédito lo utilizó para la compra de discos, CD, ya que el titular se dedica a la venta ambulante de dichos productos hace mas de un año , siendo la zona que vende  la ciudad de Luque y el interior del país, para dicho trabajo se moviliza en una motocicleta, ya que posee una  buena clientela formada a la fecha.
Cabe resaltar que la familia de señor Eduardo es muy trabajadora y todos se ayudan con el fin de salir adelante dignamente.
texts.en:
This loan will be used to buy CDs, since this person is a street vendor who has sold these products for more than a year. He sells these items in a neighborhood of the city of Luque and in the interior of the country. For this work he travels by motorcycle. He currently has a good customer base. It should be noted that the family of Eduardo is very hardworking and they all help him with the aim of getting ahead in a respectable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy music CDs

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Teresas de Jesús L., tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera,  tiene dos hijos, las dos son niñas y están en escuela primaria, ella curso hasta el primer año de secundarias, desde muy joven ella comenzó a trabajar en un mercado vendiendo carne de cerdo, el cual lo dejo por que este mercado lo desaparecieron. 

Actualmente el negocio de esta joven es una pequeña pulpería que tiene en su casa de habitación, el negocio lo administra solamente ella. 

Con nuestra institución es el primer crédito que se le esta otorgando.
texts.en:
This young woman is named Teresa de Jesús L.. She is 38 years old and a single mother with two daughters in elementary school. She finished the first year of high school but started working when she was quite young, selling pork in a market. She left that job when the market disappeared. At the moment this young woman runs a small grocery store out of her one-room house. She is receiving her first loan from this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (rice, oil, sugar, eggs, soap, bleach, laundry detergent, tomato sauce, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, instant soups, light bulbs, deodorant, batteries, firewood, toothpaste, juices, cookies, candy, produce)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies: chemical and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Rossio Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Rossio esta casada y tiene tres hijos, tiene como actividad elaboracion de tortas, galletas y masitas de reposteria, actividad que la realiza los fines de semana ya que ella tambien trabaja como secretaria de un consultorio medico; de esta manera ella puede aumentar sus ingresos y el de su familia, ya que Sr. Fernando, su esposo por el momento no vive con ellos ya que trabaja en otro lugar de Bolivia, es por esta razon que ella solicita que se le conceda un credito para poder comprar un horno mas grande y asi desarrollar mejor su actividad, por el momento ella se hace cargo de sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Rossio es una persona responsable y trabajora que saca a su familia adelante y quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rossio is married and has three children. Her work is making cakes, cookies, and pastries, which she does on weekends since she also works as a receptionist at a medical office. Through these activities, she helps to augment the family’s income since Fernando, her husband, is currently working abroad outside of Bolivia. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a larger oven so she can carry out her work better. For the moment, she tends to her school-aged children on her own. Mrs. Rossio is a responsible and hard-working woman who is trying to help her family get ahead, and who wants to improve the standard of living for them all. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they show in her through the granting of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of an industrial oven.

loans.name: Felipa Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Felipa D. vive en casa propia en la cuidad de Luque. La misma cuenta con una despensa ubicada a media cuadra de su domicilio, dicho negocio posee hace 5 años contando con buena clientela formada a la fecha ya que su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico en el barrio.
A la fecha la titular ha retirado un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías  para su despensa y así seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Felipa D. lives in her own home in the city of Luque. She has a store half a block from her home. For 5 years, the business has counted on good customers, from the day that she found a good location at a strategic spot in the neighborhood. Now the owner will put aside the loan for the purchase of merchandise for her store to continue giving good service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baked goods, dairy items, noodles, and sugar for sale

loans.name: Marylena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Marylena del Carmen V. Bulnes, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, es maestra de escuela primaria, tiene  una hija que está en escuela de secundaria, ella da clase en una escuela rural que se llama Reyna Sofía, la cual dista de su casa a unos 10 kilómetros aproximadamente de donde ella vive 

Con nuestra institución es el primer crédito que se le otorga, este crédito es para mejoramiento de su vivienda, de la cual ella es propietaria.
texts.en:
Marylena del Carment V. B.is 48 years old, a single mother, and an elementary school teacher. She has a daughter who is in secondary school, in a rural school called Reyna Sofia, which is about 10 kilometers from where they live. With our institution, this is the first loan that she has requested. It is for making improvements to her home that she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials to improve her house, zinc plates, doors, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, 52, is a borrower who lives in El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She has a perfect repayment record on past loans, and her story is representative of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Kiva partner, Esperanza International.
Rosa is a single mother of one and lives in El Seybo, a small rural town in the heart of the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Rosa has a successful small business making throws, quilts and other home decorations.
With this loan, she will purchase 40 yards of fabrics, lace and other accessories in order to grow her business. This is Rosa’s sixth loan with Esperanza International. With her continued profits, Rosa hopes to keep expanding her business. She dreams of having her own sewing machine eventually. Her profits have contributed to a healthier lifestyle, and Rosa is very grateful to be working with Esperanza. Thank you for your loan to Rosa!

About Esperanza International
Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in 11 offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

loans.use: To buy fabric, lace, thread and other accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth  Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth esta divorsiada y tiene un hijo pequeño, cuenta que la separacion fue muy dificil para ella y su pequeño hijo pero supo salir adelante por el bienestar de su hijo,  tiene como actividad por el momento la venta de ropa y joyas por catalogo venta que realiza en diferentes lugares y oficinas, ella solicita un credito para la compra de muebles y enseres de salon de peluqueria, porque ella abrira proximamente un salon, donde ella atendera el mismo ya que ella es peluquera y asi aumentar sus ingresos de ella y su familia ya que ella sola mantiene el hogar y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su hijo, es una persona trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is divorced and has one small child. She tells us that the separation was very difficult for her and her son, but she forged ahead for her child’s sake. Currently, she is selling clothing and catalog jewelry throughout different locales and offices. She is seeking a loan to buy furniture and supplies because she would like to open a beauty salon next. She would run the business herself, as she is a hairstylist. This activity would help her to augment her family’s income, given she is the sole provider and wants to improve her son’s standard of living. She is a very hard-working person, and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they demonstrate by granting her credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Las Serpentinas Group

texts.es: El banco LAS SERPENTINAS se conformo con 15 socias, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en el domicilio D. Lucy que es la presidenta del grupo, Las Serpentinas se reúnen a las 17:30 p.m. y tienen como norma D. que la asistencia es obligatoria. Lucy que es la más destacada del grupo se dedica a vender en una tienda, ella venD. en su tienda licor y algunos abarrotes desD. hace tres años atrás. El resto del grupo tienen como actividades la venta D. empanadas, venta D. hamburguesas, hay un comerciante, otros venden pan, también venden alimentos balanceados, uno ofrece servicios D. albañilería, otro venD. productos nutricionales, uno es taxista, otro vive D. la renta D. su vehículo, tres señoras se dedican a la venta D. verduras y por último también hay una señora que se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos. En cuanto a la competencia  si bien existe la misma también hay demanda ya que las actividades desarrolladas  les permiten obtener ingresos por los clientes fijos con los que algunos cuentan. Lucy destinó su crédito para abastecer más su tienda al igual que el resto del grupo que destinó el financiamiento para capital D. trabajo D. sus negocios. Las serpentinas cuentan con experiencia crediticia, además D. contar con la experiencia D. trabajo bajo el sistema comunal ya que varias participaron del mismo sistema en otras entidades financieras. Como se pueD. ver en la foto ninguno D. los varones estuvo en la primera reunión por lo que sus esposas tuvieron que representarlos a ellos más.
texts.en:
The “Las Serpentinas” communal bank was formed by 15 associates. Lucy is their president and the members meet at her home at 5:30 pm. Attendance is required. Lucy, who is the most prominent member, has a store where she’s been selling liquor and a few grocery items for the past three years. The rest of the members of the group do different things, such as selling “empanadas,” selling hamburgers, one is a businessman, others sell bread, and balanced food items, one member works as a mason, one drives a taxi, another lives from the rent he receives for his vehicle, three of the ladies sell vegetables, and one lady sells cosmetics. Even though there is competition, there is still a demand and their developed businesses allow them to earn incomes from regular customers, whom they count on. Lucy will use the money from this loan to stock her store, while the others will use it to proviD. working capital for their businesses. “Las Serpentinas” have prior experience with loans and with working under a communal banking system, as some of the members have worked with other communal banks. As the photograph shows, none of the men were at the first meeting so they were represented by their wives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Ma. Dolores H. le está haciendo falta los acabados de exterior y reparar  el techo. En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejorar que desea hacer. 
Doña Ma. Dolores H. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos adolescentes bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor.
Planea pagar el crédito con su sueldo que obtiene de su empleo como supervisora.
texts.en:
The home of Ma. Dolores H. needs exterior finishing roof repairs. At the moment, she does not have the money needed for the improvements that she wants to make. Ma. Dolores H. is a single mother and has two teenage children that she wants to give the best to. She plans to repay the loan with her job as supervisor.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Exterior finishing and slab repairs [for roof]

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is a 61-year-old single mother who lives with her son and sister in Las Magnolias, La Uruca, located in the central valley of Costa Rica.

Marta has a business making and selling decorative bags made out of durable fabric. She plans to use this loan to invest in raw materials necessary for bag making. Her goal is to produce and sell as many bags as she can. Marta dedicates the hours from 2 to 9 p.m. to her productive activity.

This will be Marta’s sixth loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant who has been working with Marta over the past months describes her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a fighting spirit who produces all her products in her house. Marta is applying for this loan to assist her in selling products at an upcoming fair.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making bags

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Gonzalez, poseen cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones, que se encuentran estudiando en el colegio.
Anteriormente la señora contaba con una ferretería, pero con el tiempo el ingreso ya no resultaba suficiente por ese motivo decidió invertir en una despensa.
Le gustaría para el futuro ampliar mas  su negocio ya que es  local propio y posee buena ubicación contando con varios clientes.
En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de mercaderías con el objetivo de llenar las expectativas de los clientes en cuanto a sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Dominga is married to Antonio Gonzalez. They have four children, two girls and two boys who are in college. Previously, she had a hardware store but after some time, the income was not enough. Because of this, she decided to invest in a store. In the future, she would like to increase her business because it has a good location and many customers. At this time, she asks for a loan for the purchase of merchandise, with the objective of fulfilling the expectations of the customers and meeting their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, soap, sugar, and eggs for her store.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married with two grown daughters and lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. She is a small entrepreneur who sells women’s lingerie and swimsuits in the central mall called “Prikarpattya”. Her vending location is famous for its nice selection of merchandise and affordable prices. Tetyana is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in this trade for 14 years. Currently, her monthly income amounts to 8,000 UAH.
Tetyana is requesting a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase assorted women’s lingerie in order to boost sales. She used to work at a factory but she was downsized and had to look for another source of income to support her family, which is how she ended up as a market vendor. Today, her business is the main source of income for the family. Tetyana is hoping to make enough savings to buy an apartment some day for her elder daughter.

loans.use: To purchase assorted women's lingerie

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory, 36, lives in El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She has a perfect repayment record on past loans, and her story is typical of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Sory lives with her husband and four children in El Seybo, a small rural town in the heart of the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be tough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare among other issues. Despite these difficulties, Sory has a successful small business selling clothing to people in her community. With this loan, she will buy underwear, women’s pants, and bedsheets to sell at a small markup.

This is Sory’s eighth loan with Esperanza International. In less than three years, she has been able to increase her loan size by nearly ten times, a true testament to her hard work. With continued profits, Sory hopes to keep the growth of her business going and finish the construction of her home in order to give her family a more comfortable place to live (a common construction technique in the Dominican Republic is to build in stages as one acquires the money to do so). In addition, her profits have given Sory confidence that her children will grow up with a good education and have the opportunity to pursue any profession they desire, a luxury Sory did not have while growing up.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, and that restore self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for your willingness to consider helping Sory!

loans.use: to buy pants, undergarments, and sheets to sell to her customers

loans.name: Silvia Susana

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia realiza trabajos de consultoria y elaboracion de proyectos, ademas de ser profesora universitaria enseñando la materia de publicidad en una universidad de nuestra ciudad, ella solicita el credito para poder comprar materiales para un trabajo que le encargaron realizar. 
La Sra. Silvia es Madre soltera, vive sola con su pequeña hija de cuatro años de edad, es una persona de buen caracter, responsable y trabajadora que saca a su familia adelante sola y desea mejorar su calidad de vida, ella fue recomendada por una amiga que es cliente de Emprender y que tambien obtuvo un financiamiento, la Sra. Silvia esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Silvia works as a consultant and project manager, and also teaches advertising at one of the universities in our city. She is requesting a loan to buy materials for a project she has been given. Silvia is a single mother, and lives alone with her four-year-old daughter. She is a person of good character, responsible and hard working, who supports her family alone and hopes for a better quality of life. A friend of hers, an Emprender client who also obtained financing, recommended her. Silvia is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they show is granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase working materials.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married, has two daughters and lives with his family in the town of Kahovka, in the Kherson region. Viktor is a cobbler who offers shoe-repair services in the local market. He launched his own small enterprise 15 years ago when his family was faced with financial challenges. Ever since that day, he has expanded his business and now produces profits every month.  

Viktor has applied for a 15,000 Grivnya loan to buy supplies. He enjoys his work because it involves helping people and it is easy to see the results of what he does. He hopes that his enterprise will continue to bring him a stable income and allow him to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shoe-repair business

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Josè Francisco T. A.  tiene 44 años, es casado, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Josè trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, trigo papas, mora, habas y también a la cría de chanchos y  borregos.

Vende los productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.
La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Josè le  gusta caminar.
 
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Josè Francisco T. A. is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. He lives in the Guaranda subdivision in the Bolivar province. Josè is a member of the solidarity group "Grupo Enmanuel" which is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda subdivision, capital of the Bolivar province. The solidarity group has a total of 17 members and the community revolves around agriculture and livestock. The members are indigenous and all speak Quechua. Josè works in farming to increase his family's income. The crops that do best are corn, wheat, potatoes, blackberries and lima beans. He also raises pigs and sheep. Josè sells his products at the wholesale market in Guaranda every six months. The principal culture is the carnival that is celebrated in February. Josè enjoys walking. Josè is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for his work especially fertilizers and manures. His goal is to have a good economic activity for his family. The challenges that he faces are problems with the weather and the diseases that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is married, has four children and lives with his family in the town of Kherson. For the last seven years, he has made a living working with sheet metal in his small workshop, which is equipped with advanced machinery. All of the tinsmiths who work for him are skilled and experienced. Presently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas invested in his venture, and his income is about 10,000 Grivnyas a month.      

Andriy is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to buy galvanized sheet and stainless steel to use in metal processing. He works hard to keep his business running successfully and provide for his large family. He hopes to keep his business profitable and expanding in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as galvanized sheet steel and stainless steel

loans.name: Mercedes Concepción

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Mercedes Concepción F. Vergara, tiene 61 años de edad, casado, ella se dedica a la confección de todo típo de ropa vestir y ropa de cama, en el negocio le ayuda su hija que ya es mayor de edad y su marido, quien ya está pensionado, ella tiene de trabajar en este negocio Veinte y Dos Años, y lo comenzó cuando se caso.
Cuando era joven ella trabajo de aprendiz de costurera, y fue así como se inicio en este negocio.
Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Diez créditos, los cuales le han servido en gran medida ya que ha habido momentos en los que le han ofrecido mercadería barata y no ha tenido para la compra de ellos.
Vale la pena mencionar que en los Nueve créditos otorgados esta señora ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones, cancelándolos casi todos antes de tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
Mercedes Concepción F. V.is 61 years old, married, and dedicates herself to making all types of garments and women’s clothing. Her grown daughter and her husband, who is retired, assist her. She has been in the business for twenty-two years, having started out when she got married. When she was young, she worked as a seamstress’ apprentice, which is how she got into the business. She has had ten loans with our institution, which have helped her greatly as there have been times when she’s been offered supplies at good prices and she didn’t have enough funds for a purchase. It’s worth mentioning that, in the nine loans she’s been granted, this lady has been very responsible in her obligations and paid almost all of them off before the term was up.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina Z. está casada con el señor Luciano Gamarra.
Catalina desde desde hace aproximadamente 10 años decidió abrir un pequeño almacén de ventas de artículos de primera necesidad. 
En la actualidad es la única despensa en la zona por lo que la citada cliente le vende sus productos a todo el barrio.
La señora Catalina como siempre hizo, todos los créditos que retira de la Fundación los destina a la compra de mercaderías y así poder satisfacer la demanda y obtener una mayor ganancia.
Para fines de este año Catalina quiere ampliar mas su local de ventas ya que le es pequeño su salón por la cantidad de mercaderías que posee.
texts.en:
Catalina is married to Luciano. About ten years ago she decided to open a small shop to sell basic need items. Now she has the only shop in the zone and she sells to the entire neighborhood. Catalina has used all of the loans she has received through the foundation to buy merchandise to be able to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her income. By the end of this year, Catalina would like to be able to expand her store, since it’s too small, given the quantity of merchandise that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
Maria Agustina Ramírez R. tiene 35 años, es casada, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, trigo y también a la cría de chanchos y  borregos.  Vende los productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria le  gusta caminar.
 
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Agustina Ramírez R. is 35, married, and has five children. She lives in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the Grupo Enmanuel Communal Bank. It is in an area that is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda Canton, the capital of the Bolívar province. There are 17 members in all. It is a farming and livestock community. They are indigenous people, and they all speak Quechua. Maria works in farming to increase the family economy. The crops that do the best are corn and wheat. She also raises pigs and sheep. She sells the products in the Guaranda wholesale market every six months. The principal cultural event of the area is the Carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Also, Maria likes to walk. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for working in the field. Mostly she will buy chemical and natural fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good economic activity for her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and illnesses that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes T. tiene 49 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, trigo, papas, y también tiene una tienda en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria le  gusta caminar 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes T. is 49 years old. She is single, and she does not have children. She lives in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the Grupo Enmanuel Communal Bank. It is an area that is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda Canton, the capital of the Bolívar province. There are 17 members in all. It is a farming and livestock community. They are indigenous people, and they all speak Quechua. Maria works in farming to increase the family economy. The crops that do the best are corn, wheat, and potatoes. She also has a store where she sells basic needs products, and she sells these products in her house. What she grows she sells in the Guaranda wholesale market every six months. The principal cultural event of the area is the Carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. Also, Maria likes to walk. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for working in the field. Mostly she will buy chemical and natural fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good economic activity for her family. The challenges she faces are climate problems and illnesses that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 48 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada.Desde hace 20 años, se dedica a la elaboración de platos típicos de  su región natal .Cada día se despierta muy temprano para mezclar los ingredientes y obtener los mas deliciosos platillos que ofrece en un local que alquilo en una zona céntrica y comercial de su ciudad ; ofrece  almuerzos y  cenas, de esta manera obtiene buenas ganancias económicas . Le va muy bien y le agrada cocinar, además su esposa lo ayuda mucho en todas las  tareas que realiza, así  vende una considerable cantidad de platos al día cuyas ganancias  benefician  la economía de su hogar. Para el futuro Wilfredo tiene planeado instalar una pollería (lugar donde se vende pollo cocido a las brasas), y espera tener éxito.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible que pueda acceder al préstamo que le permitirá continuar progresando.Wilfredo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de gaseosas en gran cantidad, además de mejorar las instalaciones de su local para proyectar una mejor imagen ante sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 48 years old. He lives in a rented house with his wife and three children. For 20 years he has been making dishes that are typical of his native region. Everyday he gets up very early to mix the ingredients and get the most delicious dishes. He sells them in a rented spot, which is in a central commercial zone of his city. He sells lunches and dinners. This way he gets good earnings. It is going very well for him, and he likes to cook. Also, his wife helps him a lot with all of the chores he does. That way he sells a considerable quantity of meals of the day. The earnings help the household economy. In the future Wilfredo plans to set up a “pollería” (place where grilled chicken is sold), and he expects to be successful. This is the first time that he has had a loan with MFP. He is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for him to get a loan and continue progressing. Wilfredo plans to use the requested money to buy a great quantity of soft drinks. Also, he will improve the facilities of his business to be able to project a better image to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and improve the facilities of his business

loans.name: Maria Joaquina

texts.es:
Maria Joaquina T. R. tiene 45 años, es casada, y tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 

Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, y las legumbres además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como patos gallinas, ganado, chanchos,  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria desea que todos sus hijos estudien. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Joaquina T. R. is 45 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She is a member of Grupo Enmanuel, which has 17 members and is located 45 minutes from the canton of Guaranda, capital of the province of Bolívar. It is an agricultural and cattle-raising community where Quechua is spoken. Maria works in agriculture to contribute to her family's finances. The crops that are most popular are maize and legumes. Maria also raises farm animals such as ducks, chickens, cattle, and pigs. She sells her products at home and what she grows, she sells in the wholesale market in Guaranda every six months. Carnaval is one of the key aspects of the culture in the area and is celebrated in February.Maria also wants all her children to study. She is asking for a loan to purchase supplies for her work in the field, especially for fertilizers. Her goal is to do well financially for her family. The challenges she faces are related to weather and pests that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and animals

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 27 años, es una mujer responsable y hogareña que vive en su casa propia con su esposo, Sosimo de 32 años, y sus 4 hijos.  

Desde muy pequeña se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y palta, aprendiendo las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre. Luego de casarse, junto a su esposo, siembra una cantidad mayor de productos oriundos de la zona. Ellos cuentan con terrenos propios, los mismos que compraron con bastante esmero y sacrificio ahorrando las ganancias de los frutos que comercializan en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma, Huancayo y Lima, lugares donde vende a buenos precios que la alientan a seguir trabajando.
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es hacerse cargo de su vivero de café, pues viene contando los días para renovar sus plantaciones. Asimismo, pronto piensa instalar un negocio de venta de carne de pollo, ya que sería la única comerciante dedicada a este rubro, también aprovecharía el local para acopiar granos de café que luego trasladaría a otra ciudad para su comercialización.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tienen con MFP y está tranquila y feliz de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal, donde la gente es muy espontánea, unida y responsable en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones. Con los dos mil soles que solicita comprará carne de pollo y algunas verduras que venderá en su casa.
texts.en:
Antonia is 27 years old, is responsible and a homebody who lives in a house she owns with her husband Sosimo, 32, and her four children. Since she was young she has worked growing coffee, bananas, and avocados and learning from the agricultural techniques her father taught her. After getting married, along with her husband, she grows a greater number of crops that are native to the area. They own their fields, which they bought after carefully saving the earnings from the fruits they sold in the markets of Tarma, Huancayo and Lima, places where the good prices encourage her to keep working. What she enjoys most about her work is to take care of her coffee nursery since she counts the days until she can renew her crops. Additionally, she soon plans to start a business to sell chicken meat as she would be the only one dedicated to this business. She would also take advantage of the business to keep her coffee beans to later move to other cities for sale. This is the second loan she has with MFP and is calm and happy to continue working with her communal bank, where the people are spontaneous, close, and responsible about meeting their obligations. With the PEN 2,000 she is asking for, she will purchase chicken mean and other vegetables that she will sell from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment for new business

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana Lucia Santillán T. tiene 21 años, es soltera, y  no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Ana trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo,  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como ganado, chanchos,  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Ana desea ayudar a su mama con los quehaceres domésticos. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia Santillán T. is 21, single, and has no children. She lives in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the rural communal bank "Grupo Enmanuel," which is located 45 minutes from the Guaranda capital in Bolívar province. There are 17 members in all, and it is an agricultural and livestock community. The people are indigenous and speak Quechua. Ana works in agriculture to increase her family's economic resources. Her main crops are corn, barley and wheat, and she also works breeding livestock such as pigs. She sells her products from her house and she also sells her crops in the wholesale market of Guaranda every 6 months. An important cultural event is carnival, which is celebrated every year in February. In addition, Ana likes to help her mother with the household chores. Ana requests this loan to buy supplies for her work in the fields, particularly chemical and organic fertilizers. Her goal is to have a successful economic activity for her family. The challenges she faces are the problems with the weather and the diseases that can affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizers)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira tiene una tienda ubicada en la zona D. Munaypata D. nuestra ciudad, su domicilio esta ubicado a dos cuadras en la misma calle, su negocio tiene una gran variedad D. productos a pesar D. que el espacio que ocupa es pequeño, la Sra. Elvira esta casada y tiene 3 hijas D. 22,15 y 12 años D. edad, ellas están estudiando, una en la universidad y las otras dos estan en colegio. Su esposo es cerrajero y trabaja en la zona D. Obrajes D. nuestra ciudad ellos según cuentan empezaron D. cero y trabajando consiguieron comprar su casita y ahora están en una situacion economica aceptable, ellos están muy orgullosos D. su trabajo y siempre muestran responsabilidad en sus pagos, son una familia muy unida, el deseo D. la Sra. Elvira es ver a sus hijas profesionales, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para surtir su tienda, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elvira has a store located in the Munaypata zone of our city. Her home is located two blocks away, on the same street. She carries a large variety of products, despite the fact that the space she occupies is small. Elvira is married and has 3 daughters, ages 22, 15, and 12. They are all studying, one in the university and the other two in school. Her husband is a locksmith and works in the Obrajes zone of the city. They tell us they started with nothing and, through hard work, managed to buy a little house and put themselves in an acceptable financial situation. They are very proud of their work, and always demonstrate responsibility with their loan payments. They are a very tight-knit family. Elvira’s wish is to see her daughters all become professionals. She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise to supply her store. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they’ve shown in her by granting credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of various products.

loans.name: Las Abellanas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Salvadora V. quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Todas las señoras se dedican a actividades independientes así como la Luisa B. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.
Todas las integrantes del comité están muy satisfechas con el crédito por que mediante la misma todas van a lograr mejorar sus actividades emprendidas para generar ingresos y así ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Salvadora was the point of contact for starting this group. She invited and organized her friends to form a part of the “Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women). All of the women are run independent businesses. Luisa sells drinks. She invested the money from this loan to buy drinks in bulk, which maD. it possible for her to offer a greater variety of drinks to her customers. All of the group’s members are very happy with the loan because it will allow each of them to improve their businesses and increase their incomes so that they can help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinks for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 29 años, ella cree que en la vida sólo se sale adelante con valentía y coraje, por eso trabaja arduamente junto a su esposo, Jacinto de 39 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Esta familia vive en su acogedora casa propia.   

Desde hace 9 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a cultivar café, maíz y plátano, y para ahorrar en el transporte, las épocas de cosecha contratan operarios por mes y se van a radicar a la chacra donde ella prepara los alimentos muy temprano y ayuda a su pareja en sus labores agrícolas para avanzar con rapidez.
A Dina le gusta disfrutar de la tranquilidad del campo, sin embargo le parece difícil trasladar sus productos hasta los mercados de abastos o los acopiadores, pues recorre un camino distante y peligroso.
Aunque este oficio le parece sacrificado, es muy rentable porque gracias a las utilidades que obtiene puede brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es por ello que para el futuro piensa cultivar café en mayor cantidad para incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y asegura que pagando puntualmente cada cuota se demostró a ella misma que con perseverancia todo se puede. Así también le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, donde aprendió a sociabilizar con otras personas que no conocía, por eso se muestra contenta al sentir que tiene una grande y hermosa familia. 

Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita comprará dos sacos de abono, dos mil quinientas plantas de café de la variedad “Catemur”, muy solicitada por producir granos grandes y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old and believes that one only gets ahead in life with valiance and courage. This is why she works arduously alongside her husband, Jacinto, who is 39 years old. They have three children and this family has a home of their own. She’s been raising coffee, corn, and bananas for the past nine years. To save on transportation, they hire monthly operatives during the harvest season, and they travel to the farmland where she prepares the food very early in the morning and then helps her husband with the farm work in order to finish quickly. Dina likes the tranquility of the countryside, but she finds it difficult to transport her goods to the marketplaces, suppliers, and storehouses. The trip is long and dangerous. Even though it’s a sacrifice, it’s very profitable because, thanks to her skills, she is able to give a good life to her children. This is the reason that she is planning to increase her coffee production, so that she can increase her income. This will be her second loan through MFP and she guarantees that she will make each payment on time and prove that everything is possible with perseverance. She likes working with a communal bank, where she learned to socialize with other people whom she didn’t know before, and she is happy to have this large and beautiful family. She will use the money from this loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) to buy sacs of fertilizer and 2,500 coffee plants, of the “Catemur” variety. This variety is very sought after because it produces large and better quality beans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria Natividad Milán Agáuchela  tiene 31 años, es casada, y  tiene cinco hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como gallinas, chanchos, cuyes y borregos  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria  le gusta lavar cocinar en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives on the edge of the town of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province. She is a part of the "Rural Window Group Enmanuel," which is an enclave located 45 minutes from Guaranda, the capital of the Bolivár province. There are a total of 17 members in this farming and agricultural community. They are indigenous people and speak Quechua. Maria farms in order to improve the economic status of her family. The crops that she mainly grows are corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes. She also raises livestock such as chickens, hogs, Guinea pigs, and sheep. She sells the livestock from her home, but she takes her harvests to the main marketplace in Guaranda every six months. The principle cultural activity is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Maria also likes to cook and do the washing in her spare time. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her farm work, particularly fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good income for her family. Her biggest challenges are the problems with the weather and the plant diseases that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario Ramírez S.  tiene 38 años, es casada, y  tiene un hijo.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como gallinas, chanchos, cuyes y borregos  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria  le gusta lavar cocinar en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She is married and has a son. She lives on the edge of the town of Guaranda, in the Bolívar province. She is a part of the "Rural Window Group Enmanuel," which is an enclave located 45 minutes from Guaranda, the capital of the Bolivár province. There are a total of 17 members in this farming and agricultural community. They are indigenous people and speak Quechua. Maria farms in order to improve the economic status of her family. The crops that she mainly grows are corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes. She also raises livestock such as chickens, hogs, Guinea pigs, and sheep. She sells the livestock from her home, but she takes her harvests to the main marketplace in Guaranda every six months. The principle cultural activity is the carnival that is celebrated every year in February. Maria also likes to cook and do the washing in her spare time. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies for her farm work, particularly fertilizers. Her goal is to have a good income for her family. Her biggest challenges are the problems with the weather and the plant diseases that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Juan Ramón S., es casado y con una carga familiar de 7 hijos todos en edad escolar, trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 5 años desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad.
Se le han otorgado 4 créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y nos expresaba que le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
This man is named Juan Ramon S.. He is married and has a family of 7 schoolage children. He has worked for the City Hall of Chichigalpa for five years as a security guard. He has been given 4 loans which have been for housing improvement and he has told us thaht they have been a big help, since they have improved his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials (zinc, rods, edging)

loans.name: Blanca Mayra

texts.es:
Blanca Mayra Ramírez R.  tiene 31 años, es casada, y  tiene cuatro hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Blanca trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.
